author: {'steamid': '76561197994049547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1708637002}
review:
If you have an HTC Vive or Valve Index, just skip it.  Even if it is a dollar.  They did not implement snap turning controls on our platform, and they refuse to make even a minor update to add it. This is a long-standing issue that CANNOT be solved, since no mechanism exists to map the controls.  This game is old enough to pre-date Steam Input, and they have never bothered to add it as a patch since.

So if you're not one of the Oculus crowd, this game is basically hamstrung from the start.  Sad, but true.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007343154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 449, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1563325247}
review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041357242', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1676321676}
review:
Game is completely broken and unplayable in 2023.
Headset - Valve Index
GPU - 3070
CPU - i9-9900k

This game has constant stuttering no matter what settings you change, it makes the game unplayable and there have been no updates or announcements made to fix this issue, so i now have a AAA VR game sitting in my steam library i cannot play anymore.

If you plan on buying this game, don't, it is abandoned and there haven't been any updates since 2018.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153919062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1700424645}
review:
Globalement le jeu est plut√¥t bien et je le recommande, m√™me si en terme de note de lui donnerai √† peine plus que la moyenne. Pourquoi ?

D√©j√† il n'a pas re√ßu de mise √† jour depuis 2018, ce qui sous-entend d'apr√®s moi que le d√©veloppement a √©t√© arr√™t√©.
Ensuite, pour parler du contenu :
- Le jeu propose 10 missions avec une histoire.
- 4 personnages jouables avec des armes et des comp√©tences diff√©rentes.
- Un mode Solo, coop 2 joueurs, et PVP.
Un jeu simple mais mine de rien assez complet. Pourquoi aussi peu alors ?

Parce qu'il co√ªte plus cher que quasiment n'importe quel autre jeu VR connu (exception faite pour Half Life: Alyx mais c'est Half Life bordel !). 38‚Ç¨ pour √ßa, √ßa aurait pu passer si tout √©tait bien. Sauf que non.

Le tracking des grips n'est vraiment pas au point. Je n'arrive m√™me pas √† attraper mes armes par moment. Le support gaucher qui, comme sur 80% des jeux, n'est fait qu'√† moiti√©. Un gaucher √ßa tient l'arc avec sa main gauche, en fait, donc il doit √™tre sur sa hanche gauche. Pas droite.
Niveau gameplay c'est plut√¥t plat. On passe notre temps √† se battre contre des robots de diff√©rents types. Mention sp√©ciale aux 2 ou 3 niveaux qui apportent quand m√™me du gameplay un peu plus vari√© avec une courte s√©quence de puzzle, de l'exploration ou un combat de boss.
Enfin, dernier truc dommage : pas de sous titre, et le jeu est enti√®rement en anglais, donc √ßa inclut de savoir parler anglais. Heureusement, c'est quand m√™me relativement audible.

Alors pourquoi je le recommande alors ?

Le syst√®me de personnage est relativement bien fait et le syst√®me de comp√©tence permet de diversifier nos attaques. Le concept des tourelles est vachement cool aussi.
L'histoire en elle-m√™me, bien que courte, reste prenante et int√©ressante.
M√™me si on passe notre temps √† se battre, √ßa en vaut quand m√™me le coup parce qu'on a pas trop cette sensation de r√©p√©tition. Les environnements et les ennemis sont vari√©s.
Enfin, mais c'est une histoire personnelle, j'ai eu des fous rires sur le jeu avec un ami. D'ailleurs, je recommande vraiment d'y jouer avec un ami plut√¥t que seul.

En conclusion, le jeu est excellent pour d√©couvrir la VR et reste int√©ressant malgr√© son prix beaucoup trop √©lev√© √† mon go√ªt et ses petits d√©fauts qui au final rel√®ve plus du jeu en lui-m√™me que de ses m√©caniques. Il fonctionne quand m√™me tr√®s bien avec un PC pas fou. Il faut beaucoup plus le coup en promo, ou il atteint un prix de 20‚Ç¨ je crois.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112639485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1673394158}
review:
Hands down boring. I played the demo a lot at a demo kiosk a while back and kind of enjoyed it, and I thought I would get this now that I have my own headset. The shooting is meh compared to what I remember at the demo kiosk, but maybe that's because I was more enamored with shiny new VR back then since I didn't have my own headset. Pistol and Sword were the only fun weapons, and when you only have 4 weapons, that's a problem. 

The story is outright tone deaf. Fighting against a corrupt evil software and robotics corporation? And yet in the EULA, they have all the standard evil big company clauses, like waiving all legal rights, including juries, as well as clauses that say they can infect your computer with malware and somehow not be responsible. The absolute irony of a story about fighting evil corrupt Eden Corp, while moonlighting as an evil company yourself. I cannot take this game's story seriously, and I cannot enjoy the game when they ruin it with such a tone deaf story like this. 

If you can get this game at 75% off and don't care about the story, then maybe you'll have fun, but otherwise, it's not worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137349289', 'num_games_owned': 2329, 'num_reviews': 1371, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1546309040}

author: {'steamid': '76561198141550626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1672128376}
review:
It's a pretty fun game (esp. with co-op) but it comes with some serious caveats (hence the negative):
#1 there are numerous bugs which the developer refuses to fix, the most infamous being losing guns after you die and being unable to get them back
#2 some of the VR movement options are incomplete meaning, you won't be able to configure your right thumbstick for vertical movement. Kind of a strange choice considering it is a VR-exclusive game...
#3 replayability is low; once you beat it you're probably not coming back to it

author: {'steamid': '76561198147967116', 'num_games_owned': 828, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1672447573}
review:
While the boffins at Meta inc and ByteDance push the cutting edge of 3d gaming into the next gen by creating a whole new world of 3D gaming the brilliant geniuses at Survios studios have reinvented the meta in the world of VR game development by implementing their new innovation, 2d flat screens in 3d environments. Its a small detail but every loading screen and even the at the start of the game when you see the company logo just stinks of missed opportunity. The intro to the game (when you're loading into the menu) is fairly cool, with the company logo moving towards you in a sea of particles but its just a cutscene on a curved flat 2d plane. Its sigh inducing.

I write this with over 11,000 in virtual reality, the fundamental building blocks of this game are so out of data it makes it hard to play. For those of us who have moved over to using virtual desktop be warned that if you take your headset off that when the game audio switches to your PC speakers it won't switch back to your headset again. The games movement systems is designed for teleportation and, while it can be switched to walk, the walking system is slippy and generally unwieldy. I believe its possible to activate some sort of stick turn (allowing you to turn with use of the joystick rather than only by rotating yourself within your IRL environment), but it wouldn't appear on my iteration of the game. I'd like to make it clear this is not due to a lack of thoroughness on my part. I know an option to do this exist and I know from other players where it is located but somehow, some way, presumably due to my headset of choice (a Quest 2 connected to a PC via virtual desktop) the option is not in my menu ... but your guess is as good as mine on the cause, honestly. 

I cannot in truth comment on the game play. The game had several debilitating technical issue which culminate in game simply outputting a support ticket when I try to load it before me even getting to the game play. I'll try again at some point to actually get into a round of this and add an addendum to this review but for the time being I'd recommend against playing this if you've become too reliant the modern comforts of VR gaming, like smooth turn... or if you've become too reliant the modern comforts of gaming in general, like responsive controls and functioning software.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018219363', 'num_games_owned': 622, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1120, 'last_played': 1652898303}
review:
Good game if you like clearing waves with friends, it's fun however amount of glitches and bugs is insane. 
For example weapons tend to disappear midfight and there's nothing you can do about it. On highest difficulty levels this is ridiculous when you are defenseless for no reason (usually till end of map). Making 100% achievements in this game was PAIN. 

AI is bad but it's not that much of a problem, I mean all they have to do is destroy the core and hit your ass while doing that. The problem with mobs is that some of them might "teleport" around the map and here's where the shitshow begins.
Performance wise it was alright although graphics quality on some maps was very bad, no clue what is the reason behind that but it looked like devs felt lazy in the end. 

Would I recommend it? Nah. Don't fall into that trap of "very positive" reviews.

Maybe it works better on other VR headsets but I played it on Quest 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046263132', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 860, 'last_played': 1674964015}
review:
Its a very good game for what it is. If you like killing floor, its kinda similar, just VR.

Four things you need to know before you buy.
There will be no more updates to the game ever.
Its difficult to turn with the controller if your headset is newer than the game is.
You will never find a public match, you must already have a friend to play with.
The game is poorly balanced to play by yourself on higher difficulties. Insanely difficult solo.

If none of this is a problem for you, it is absolutely worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025407323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 984, 'last_played': 1654288435}
review:
I start with Saija (Light saber user), The first and second rounds were pretty boring because drone and kamikaze robot is hard to deal with. But after unlock enough skill gameplay will better.

This game have 4 character each character have one weapon. So you choose weapon that you want to play by change character for each mission. 

The gameplay of this game (After unlocking all skills) is quite fun. Being able to hold a dual sword or dual gun is so cool. The gun aiming system is also simple. 

The main disadvantage of this game is not balanced and has quite a lot of bugs. Some character is very hard to clear nightmare mission. Sometime your weapon disappear after you died. Sometime you died from fall through the floor. Some mission enemy not spawn and you can't progress your mission anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986552867', 'num_games_owned': 3554, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1650735258}
review: The game looked good and has promise but there's control issues that made me just quit in the first mission. First, and a common issue among VR games, they give you a control scheme but show the mapping only on a single VR controller type - knowing what the controls are on an oculus does nothing for me on the index. The second issue is when I picked up a smart pad audio log, there seemed to be no way to drop it, the audio played, but I was in combat and couldn't grab a new clip to reload my pistol without being able to drop the smart pad item, which there was no way to do it seemed - made the game completely unplayable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001606612', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 230, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1531287628}
review:
When vr was new(ish) there was raw data, which was a REAL game for vr, instead of the multiple vr "experiences" for 30 dollars, it was fun enough for me to get excited about the future of vr and the platform as a whole. Nowadays it doesn't really hold up, at all really. its gameplay is a mix of a wave defense and tower defense where you fight off waves of increasingly tougher robots across a loosely connected story. Plot was forgettable and gameplay just doesnt hold up, gunplay nor melee. 

Would i buy it for the $40 asking price? No. Would I buy it for a $15 price tag? Probably still no, its just not up to par with other games that released since 2017

author: {'steamid': '76561198093683381', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1650982496}
review:
Die 38‚Ç¨ sind zwar etwas viel aber wenn es in einem Sale ist (z.b: 20‚Ç¨ oder so ) w√ºrde ich es direkt kaufen es macht sehr viel spass und obwohl es erst 2016 rausegekommen ist , ist die Grafik immer noch top und die Level gut.
Es ist wohl eines der besten waveshooter die ich je gespielt habe und die towerdefense mechanik ist gut , aber man kann leider nur 4 - 2 T√ºrme gelichzeitig plazieren und die auswahl der T√ºrme h√§lt sich in grenzen.
Der coop Modus macht extrem viel spass , doch leider spielen dieses spiel nicht mehr so viele Leute das es alt ist und nicht mehr wirklich gekauft wird.
Also wenn es in einen Sale ist auf jeden Fall kaufen oder bei anderen Websites wie mmoga oder instant-gaming kaufen (habe es da auch her f√ºr 3‚Ç¨ was sehr wenig ist)

author: {'steamid': '76561198015295368', 'num_games_owned': 875, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1665421630}
review:
Das Spiel ist beim Starten mehrfach gecrashed, hat komplette Soundaussetzer und es kommt vor, dass zwei Charaktere gleichzeitig sprechen, w√§hrend Musik laut im Hintergrund dr√∂hnt. Wieso kann das Spiel auch nicht einfach direkt starten? Wieso erst zwei Popups, dann das Logo, dann H√∂heneinrichtung, dann Steuerungseinrichtung (ja, immer am Anfang) UND dann erst das Spiel ...
RoboRecall ist etwa viermal besser und daf√ºr kostenlos. Man kann da Gegner festhalten und Werfen, Arme abrei√üen, Kugeln fangen etc. Hier kann man mit seiner Pistole schie√üen. Wow. Gegner k√∂nnen direkt nach dem Spawn auch nicht get√∂tet werden. Supi.

Ich gebe dem Spiel noch ne Chance, aber der Ersteindruck f√ºr jemanden mit hunderten Stunden VR-Erfahrung f√§llt nicht gerade gut aus.

EDIT: Kriege das Spiel nicht gestartet. Crashed immer direkt. Einfach technisch beeindruckend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005697011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1647278512}
review:
Don't bother, I got this in a bundle (7 games for 10 bucks) and this game is not even worth that. Half of the game feels very polished, but the other half feels like playing a beta game that is not  ready to be released.

-Very repetitive
-Some classes are kinda glitchy, using the sword would feel badass but it doesn't hit enemies half the time
-The controls are pretty clunky, tons of mis-grabs, accidentally holstering your weapon or grabbing it when you don't mean to, Even after customizing the bindings and grip strength it doesn't feel natural. Walking vs teleporting doesn't feel natural either.
-Hitboxes on player character are off (getting hit all the time by slow moving lasers after I moved out of the way, but it still hits me)
-The story is extremely generic, and they went for a Glados type robot making snarky comments all except it's just really annoying and he won't shut the fuck up. The character is genuinely unfunny and there are so many talking scenes in between levels, huge waste of time. If the writing was up to par it'd be fine, it just isn't. If you wanted to make a basic wave/shooter/tower defence type game you don't need to pretend it has a good story and deep characters. Just don't.
-The tutorials are very basic, if you have any gaming experience you can skip them - but then every time you start a new level you will be bugged by a screen 'warning' you that haven't finished the tutorials. Of which there are plenty. Just why.
-Why is it that every time you start the game you have to accept a EULA, click through several setup screens before even getting to the game?
-Speaking about menus, pausing the game required you to press B, then aim your right hand and click on a button that says 'pause', which opens another menu. Why? Then if you want to unpause, you click on resume game, and the other menu you opened on your left hand is still there, which you have to click away while the game is already running and you are probably being attacked while you can't use either hand for a few seconds. I know it's minor but it's things like this that make the game a pain in the ass.
-The hands are not oriented properly for the Valve Index controllers - when I hold the controller straight in front of me, as if aiming a gun, in this game the gun would be at an angle about 10-15 degrees off. And there's no way to adjust this.

This game could be so good, but I just don't see it right now. 2.5/10 imo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198324754826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1643659208}
review:
This game was released in 2017, and it definitely shows. At least, I assume that is the reasons for some of the rather weird default controls and game options. 

The "in-game hints" and the tightly-restricted "Playspace" and are both extremely intrusive and detrimental to your initial game-play experience. Fortunately they can be disabled, but they still leave a rather bad first impression of the game. The game definitely would have benefited from an initial "how would you like to play this game" setup part. 

Locomotion is OK, but the "teleshift" (teleport) mode will often fail and then refuse to work for a bit. And moving around (in campaign) is frustratingly slow. Sure, I'm in a gun-fight with a dozen killer robots, but let me just casually walk from here to there. 

I could almost never get the "Ultimate" ability to work using the thumbstick, but at least it is possible to use X (or A) button instead. Too bad that wasn't part of the tutorial. 

Speaking of, the tutorial was just using the standard "game hints" to purvey information, which is sometimes a little on the short side, especially when the language used isn't always clear. Just leave the hints in a pop-up window to the side or something, where I can read it without it being too much in my way. Or maybe have a tablet or something that I can pull up with the game hints.

With all that critique aside, the basic game-play is rather fun, and I got the game for just ‚Ç¨1.50 in a bundle, so for that price, I think it is worth it. I probably wouldn't spend more than a few bucks on this game, though. But if you see it on a discount or in a bundle, go ahead and pick it up, and support your local VR developer/publisher, so they can continue to make more (and hopefully better) VR games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995673871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1642346065}
review:
Initially my impression of this VR game was not good. The first level involves standing in one place and shooting  robots as they amble slowly towards you. Dull. Level 2 was better, but still...meh. Ignore first impressions, by level 4 you'll not have time to think about anything but surviving.

Each level has 5 stages to it. You'll learn about turrets, which can be placed anywhere within the arena and which initially seem pointless - why not shoot all the robots with your guns? By level 3 you soon learn that those turrets are absolutely needed, without them you'll die. Levels 3-10 are where the story and the action really get going.

I haven't tried MP, but the single player is campaign is worth the price alone. Only 9 hours played, but wow were those 9 hours awesome!

review: Amount of lags on multiplayer, glitches and bugs is crazy in this game. I barely made it to end when my pistol was under my hand or when elevator killed me just because it suddenly throwed me under it. If my friend didnt had this game i wouldnt even play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200276935', 'num_games_owned': 588, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1638617772}
review: HOLY. FREAKIN. BRAIN DEAD. BULLSHIT. I expected wayyy too much from this game for that huge freakin amount of money it costs. NO TURNING. BARELY POSSIBLE TO CHANGE MOVEMENT OPTIONS. GRAPHIC SETTINGS BARELY CHANGE ANYTHING. THE WEAPON HANDLING.. OMG IS IT BAD. WHEN YOU PULL YOUR DAMN GUN, YOU JUST MOVE YOUR HAND IN THAT DIRECTION AND THE REST IS A SPECIFIC ANIMATION, THAT CAN'T BE MOVED AND AFTER IT, THE GUN SNAPS INTO THE PLACE WHERE YOUR CONTROLLER IS. SHOOTING ENEMIES OR SLICING THEM JUST RIPS RANDOM PARTS, WHERE YOU HAVEN'T EVEN HIT THEM. YOU CAN SLICE A ROBOT VERTICALLY THROUGH THE HEAD AND THE GOD DAMN UPPER BODY GETS SEPERATED FROM THE HIP. RELOADING YOUR GUN IS JUST MOVING THE NEW MAG CLOSE ENOUGH SO IT GETS MAGICALLY REPLACED WITH THE OLD MAG. AND BY CLOSE ENOUGH I MEAN ALMOST SMASHING YOUR ONE CONTROLLER WITH THE OTHER. ENEMIES ARE ALL THE SAME. NO SPECIAL ANIMATIONS, JUST WALKING, JUMPING, SNAP TURNING LIKE FREAKIN BACKGROUND CHARACTERS IN A 2001 GAME. THE ONLY POSITIVE THING ABOUT THIS GAME IS THAT THE LOBBY LOOKS DECENT, BUT THAT'S IT. I'D RATHER PLAY A GOD DAMN ROLLERCOASTER SIMULATOR WHERE I LITERALLY JUST WATCH A MOVIE ABOUT IT

author: {'steamid': '76561198044723649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1638052606}
review:
Forces you to face one direction, there is a popup telling you to "face the camera". No way to disable it and tell the game you dont have that type of vr restriction. That really just ruins the game.

Everything about this game is just so OLD tech, so outdated. Constant popups telling you what to do, so annoying and nothing like the descriptions. Terrible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017052567', 'num_games_owned': 546, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1636875259}
review: Just tried this game for almost an hour on a Valve Index headset. I apparently got it in a VR bundle or something so I got it for free and I'm still disappointed because even though the gameplay looks like it'd be a ton of fun, there's one feature lacking for any non-Oculus headset that renders the game unplayable for me. Apparently the game has snap turning on Oculus but not on any other brand of headset, and with how much you're expected to move around, I was having difficulty doing even the first mission despite using a pulley system for my cord because I was afraid I'd be twisting the cord. If you're not on Oculus, do NOT get this game, as without a turn feature this game is impossible to play with a corded headset safely and comfortably.

author: {'steamid': '76561199183768239', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1640192118}
review: At first, this game really irritated me with so many things popping up all the time, arrows pointing you in what direction it wanted you to face, tips on what do do when you were already doing them "reload here" after like 20 minutes of playing. Eventually I worked out how to turn off tips but the arrows are still there. Then you turn from teleport to joystick control but both work and you accidentally teleport yourself all over the place while playing, sometimes off the edge of things and die. The other annoying thing is you often accidentally drop a gun, I guess the grip is super sensitive, and then you can even accidentally put the left gun in the right holder as your hand is near it and suddenly your gun dissapears... there's lots of really annoying fiddly things like that. BUT the shooting, the enemies, the sound effects, absolutely superb, and it can get super intense and exciting. SO, fiddly but awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021215473', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1631657928}
review:
Outdated, at full price is not worth it at all. Valve Index controllers are not supported, they're detected as Vive Wands.

You should be able to rotate your character with your controller, "standing" play area is misleading.

Rotating your character and Valve Index controllers support is all they need for this 2017 year VR game to be worth it, however not at this price, a price range between 15‚Ç¨ and 20‚Ç¨ seems more appropriate to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052121756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1631546382}
review:
Raw Data seems like a very solid VR Wave Shooter with a primary focus "fulfill your roll" Style Co-op, where the player takes on a "hero" with a preset load-out. Pistol, sword, shotgun, or archer.  It's well made and runs smooth.
The downside is its just another wave shooter that has fallen behind the times of modern VR.  VR four years later has made extreme leaps and bounds in presence, and Raw Data has not been updated to follow along. 

This game is not upgraded to feature full Index controller support and relies [i] heavily [/i] on teleport style movement to effectively dodge incoming fire, and the game is designed around this quick movement.  (teleportation should be the last mode of movement considered for games)   While smooth motion movement is an option, this translates poorly to index controllers.

There are no full body Inverse kinetics so there is a huge spatial disconnect from your real body to VR spacial awareness.  This also means there is no option to utilize full body tracking for a more immersive experience or a more realize hitbox.  (you will clearly sidestep or turn to narrowly let a projectile sweep by only to still be hit because your hitbox is a large bubble around your HMD.

I would not recommend buying this game at full price but only from a sale at 75% off or more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038440131', 'num_games_owned': 828, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 1785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1102, 'last_played': 1639102365}
review:
Update Review; on the quest to nightmare mode, we keep getting the same game breaking bug on the final level.    we're playing on hard mode and the only way to unlock nightmare.  I really don't think the devs planned for people to be this invested in their game.  We have one more wave and the game freezes because the stupid voice characters are yelling at each other and causing the game to glitch.  It's not like they have anything important to say.  

Original Review:  This is definitely a game you get on a sale if you have VR because it's last gen.  I just recently beat this game with a friend and by the end we seemed to enjoy it despite one level that I'm convinced was designed to break your spirits.

there were some game breaking glitches on the last level where weapons didn't spawn and after fighting every single wave, the game glitched and the final scene never happened forcing a reload.  that's pretty much the solution to everything that went wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017277924', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1613518888}

author: {'steamid': '76561198133942310', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1633715856}
review:
It is incredibly hard for me to decide weather I would make a reviewe for this game with the "I recommend" or "I don't recommend" buttons. But after my latest session with my friend I decided on the latter.

I do absolutely love some of this games mechanics, one big one being that you unlock more abilities as you play, and my favorie class, where you are able to throw your laser-like sword as a boomerang that you are partly able to control the trajectory of mid flight. I think it can be extremely fun to play, play, throwing around a sword looking cool as hell.

But on the other hand, this game is so. incredibly. fucking. glitchy..! I can't get through a level without at the very least experiancing some jankyness. In some times game breaking. For the sword class, some of my difficulties are:
It can be extremely hard to grab your sword holstered from your shoulder sometimes.
I constantly drop my sword all the time so that it just falls on the ground, despite barely gripping my controllers (index controllers).
throwing the sword sometimes seems to have bad collision with enemies.

One huge glitch that I have seen happen twice is (unlocked ability spoiler, although the ability isn't super interesting/unexpected)  [spoiler] After unlocking the ability which gives me two swords to weild, mid game one of the swords just suddenly dissapears and it never respawns on my shoulder, meaning that I have to play the entire level (which can last to 20-30 minutes) with only one sword. This same glitch happened to my friiend that played  [b] a different class! [/b][/spoiler] 

There are more glitches that appear, but they are more so just small annoyances that appear, which can vary largely, so I can't really remember them as of now. But I am still aware of how incredibly janky this game can be.

Some of the glitches, like constantly dropping your weapons, is beacuse I usee index controllers, which are apparently seen as really bad for this game (which I can definitely get), so if you dont want absolutely garbage controlls, you have to make/download custom ones from steam. And even so you will most likely still experiance glitches related to the controlls. There are a thousand glitches that I failed to mention here tho, and most of them probably arent specific to the index...

There are also a bunch of questionable design choises. A small one that I can think of right now is this, it doesn't really impact anything, but more so a "what the fuck were they thinking??" thing: In the lobby there is an object that is completely made up out of 90 degree angles. But for some ungodly reason they decided to make a LOD model of it with a bunch of random angles, like they just said "oh lets just slap a decimate modifier and collapse a bunch of vertecies randomly, that will look alright!", and it looks so incedibly ugly. I don't even see a point in adding an LOD for an object like that, at least not one that is so incedibly obvious to see... This paragraph almost looks the longest of all of them, and it's about the most unimportant thing ever... whatever...

I want to enjoy playing this game so incedibly much. I absolutely adore most of the mechanics, and the story is really interesting. But the fuck ton of glitches I encounter constantly makes it extremely frustating to play and I can basically never play this game with my friend without at least once getting noticably pissed off at the game doing unintended stuff. And I would regard myself as a person who very rarely gets frustated at games.... when they work correctly that is...

so in conclusion, would I reccomend this game? I honestly don't know. If you use index controllers, that decreases the chanse I would reccomend it quite alot. Apparently my friend says that most of the issues (that are controller related) arent experianced by him since he has different controllers. But even if that is the case, the game is still incedibly glitchy at times. If you like action, and don't mind being completely fucked by super unfair glitches. Then I think I would reccomend this game. Otherwise I think I wouldn't.

Thanks for comming to my TED-talk and listening to my salty speech.

author: {'steamid': '76561198368764852', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1658441106}

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198854061315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1656, 'last_played': 1635102429}
review:
A science fiction themed shooter arcade game. Simple and straightforward but with plenty of fast, cyber-mayhem. Featuring interesting characters with sharp abilities, Raw Data really shines (and it's probably best enjoyed) in co-op mode - otherwise one would miss its true experience. 
Definitely worth a look from gun-addicted VR gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220026309', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1608325169}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048304491', 'num_games_owned': 367, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1628497353}
review:
Raw Data is a very stylish hero defense game with some good VR mechanics. Unfortunately, bugs ruin the experience and it seems the developers no-longer support the game with patches.

The game itself is fun and the each of the 10 levels throw a new challenge your way. You will also be unlocking a few cool abilities for your characters, which will keep you wanting to play to try them out as you get them.

But being such an old VR game, the actual controller bindings are not suited for Valve's Index. If you're using an Index and smooth locomotion settings, you may need to fiddle with the bindings on SteamVR for a while before the game is playable. I also wouldn't recommend getting this game if you plan on playing with a friend as there are many bugs that appear in co-op. The last few levels are especially buggy in co-op with frequent softlocks, desynchronization, and visual bugs.

Raw Data was probably a great game during its time, but bugs ruin what would have been a good VR game to play with a friend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063844776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1626970476}
review: I got this game at a heavy discount so I might have a biased view. This game so far has been very fun. It's very wave shooter/tower defense oriented so know that's the genre when buying. You can choose between a pistol wielding character, an archer, a shotgun wielding character and a ninja with a sword. They all have their pros and cons with the pistol character being the basic I would recommend starting with. They also all get new upgrades as you play with them which encourages multiple play throughs. Still have a lot to play through and features like co-op and PVP I haven't tried but if you're looking for a fun wave shooter with some tower defense it's been a blast so far!

author: {'steamid': '76561198261789295', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1626043565}
review: For the good of all that you have within whoever reads this DO NOT DOWNLOAD THIS GAME. Not only are the controls extraordinarily clunky and simply stupid, there are extreme lag spikes every few seconds. Running this on a powerful alienware with eithernet, on the Oculus Rift S, on lowest possible settings, and I still get huge lag spikes. The game is undeniably a good concept, but Survios has made a terrible game, verging on unplayable. Play RoboRecall if you want a good futuristic robot shooter. Nothing about this game is remotely good. DO NOT PURCHASE! Spend your 40 dollars on something worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055726862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1620987117}
review:
The game has a good atmosphere and  decent visuals. Get a bit closer and the rougher edges and textures are apparent. I wouldn't knock it for that since I spend most of my time avoiding rounds and collecting tablets.

Combat with the Bishop character is quite enjoyable and a good starter. He is pretty strong out-of-the-box, and unlocking his dual wield upgrades make him a blast to play as.. The other characters have novel abilities and a great to play with at times, but my play style lends itself better to pistols.
 
The story is a cyberpunk melodrama. It tries to be thought provoking, but I personally can't take it seriously.

All in all, It's a fun wave shooter to turn your mind off to

author: {'steamid': '76561198100753214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1622218538}
review: Tried for a little, not worth it for the 40$ price tag, glad i got it through the humble VR bundle. Controls are janky with the index as it was never properly updated for it, but devs abandoned the game so it'll probably never happen. Whenever i tried to use the sword it'd just constantly disappear and reappear in my hand for no reason. The other weapons worked fine, but some abilities like the bow's crystal field were difficult to activate due to the need to swipe from left to right on the touchpad, which is a little difficult on the index. Maybe try on a steep sale if you have a vive or oculus, avoid if you have an index.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032142118', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1620371456}
review:
I wish I could give this game a positive review. It would be pretty good if I was able to turn left/right

I can not turn left or right using neither the joystick nor the thumbpad.
I played dozens of games that don't have official support for valve index and never had this problem.
wasted two hours trying to solve it.
Even the settings in game are bugged, and don't show the option to allow or disable smooth turn.
It's it's a bug or it's intentional... idk. either way, it should be really easy to simply allow left joystick -> turn left and right joystick -> turn right. but it doesn't work.
wasted 2 hours and my money :(

hopefully they'll add index support and I'll reinstall and change my review

author: {'steamid': '76561198251995014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1618347267}
review:
overall thoughts: kinda meh
ok so full disclosure, this game is decent, and it was actually able to hold my attention for a while, but i eventually gave up halfway through the game, it was just too meta for me
to describe it briefly, this game is a tower defence/wave shooter where you take down hoards of enemies while protecting a data core from getting destroyed. its a bit like robo recall in a sense bun instead of moving through a course you stal in one space the entire level. the game has 4 main weapon types, the pistol, the sword, the shotgun, and the bow. each weapon has varying play styles so let me describe them all:
the pistol is probably the most versatile weapon of the 4, its effective at any range and even has a "charge" ability to shoot high powered shots. one of the things i liked about the games mechanics is how shooting specific parts of the robots can actually remove those body parts, for example if you shoot them in the arms, they wont have an arm to shoot with, if you shoot them in the legs, they will have to crawl to you. its a fairly decent weapon and it can usually get any job done
the shotgun is like how shotguns are in most games unfortunately, extremely effective at close range, and trash at long range. it does have a rocket launcher ability which is also useful for taking out mechs, but overall its just kinda a difficult weapon to use
the sword is definitely the most sweat inducing weapon of them all, since youre going to be swinging it around A LOT, being a melee weapon its not very effective against drones, but it does have a difficult to use throwing ability where it comes back like a boomerang. my main issue was that it never really felt life you were using a "sword" in the game since killing enemies never results in a clean cut, they just fall to the ground while whatever body part you hit falls off at the joint regardless of where on that part you actually cut, also its extremely ineffective against mechs
finally theres the bow, but i didnt play the game long enough to use the bow so lets move on
the game can get pretty repetitive after a while, all you do is stay in one map the whole level and protect a data core from robots. personally i would have preferred it if there were a few levels where you actually moved through a level trying to get to a goal, murdering robots as you go, but unfortunately theres only 1 play style to this game, and it gets old real fast. also this game has a multiplayer PVP function, but its playerbase is long dead so thats a huge chunk of the game you simply cant play. theres no real penalty for dying, all that happens when you die is you have to wait about 3 seconds, then you respawn. the only downside is that you wont be able to protect your data core in that time but trust me, it has plenty of health, youll be fine. the only positives i can think of with this game is that it has some pretty good graphics and voice acting, and it is pretty fun before it goes on too long
so yeah, not really something i would recommend, especially for 40 dollars. if you find it on sale id recommend buying it and giving it a shot, but if you dont like what you see id say quickly ask for a refund while you can, like i said the game is pretty repetitive and if you dont like the first level, youre not going to like the other 9

author: {'steamid': '76561197991507114', 'num_games_owned': 1178, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1616612823}
review:
Gespielt auf der Index.

W√ºrde eher einen Daumen in der Mitte geben. Das Spiel ist mittlerweile technisch veraltet und von Diversen VR-Konzepten √ºberholt. Beispielsweise gibt es ausschlie√ülich Teleportationsbewegung und die Griffmechanik der Indexcontroller wird auch nicht unterst√ºtzt (ist nur eine Alternativbelegung zu einem Knopfdruck). Das Halten von Waffen ist damit auch ein ziemlicher Krampf, da dies vom Spiel eigentlich nicht vorgesehen ist und stattdessen eine Halten/Wegstecken auf Knopfdruck Steuerung gew√§hlt wurde.
Das schadet der Immersion auf jeden Fall ungemein, daher habe ich es trotzdem mit der Griffmechanik gespielt. Das f√ºhrt allerdings dazu das man zwischendurch ausversehen die Waffe fallen l√§sst. Ein wenig nervig, daf√ºr aber eine extra Herausforderung in dem ansonsten doch recht leichten Spiel. 
Von der Technik und dem Schwierigkeitsgrad abgesehen bekommt man allerdings ein gutes VR Spiel geboten. Alleine daf√ºr, 
 dass man mit Lichtschwertern k√§mpfen kann, was direkt ein Jedi-Feeling aufkommen l√§sst, lohnt sich der Kauf bereits. Vollpreis ist allerdings zu hoch angesetzt, da wie erw√§hnt technisch veraltet.

review:

Don't get me wrong, it's not a bad game, it's actually still good, but 40 dollars is an absurd price, games half the price offer so much more

review:
Bought the game on sale and I'll be refunding it. I have never heard such annoying dialogues in a video game. You can't skip them, and you have to listen to the god damn "quirky, but polite" AI and the blandest remote assistant possible. 

The tracking and combat are good, but in order to play with Rift S comfortably, you have to disable the settings that always ask you to "look at the camera and rotate using right stick". 

This is the case where the initial impression irrecoverably ruined the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961017729', 'num_games_owned': 3005, 'num_reviews': 3428, 'playtime_forever': 1120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1110, 'last_played': 1709098531}
review: For a time, Raw Data was the Halo (or something) of early VR shooters. It was the most 'powerful' game. It would run on a 970, but at 45 frames the whole time, before the days of motion smoothing. Depended on the level. You shoot tons of robots and it's fun and stuff. I was still able to enjoy it then, and was in early enough to at least witness (but not play) alot of the updates. Originally there was like, only two levels to this game. [u]Fruit Loops when it came out only had two flavors, too.[/u] Overtime they added alot of stuff to this game, and I had sometime in 2019 or 2018 played the whole campaign, alone. I would bet it's hard to find a match these days, but I had enough fun in coop back in the day to get my monies worth there. I never tried the PVP mode, I heard it was very fun. [spoiler]It should easily be worth 30 bucks, but it's on sale right now for 10. [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197997326516', 'num_games_owned': 506, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1617553893}
review:
Got it in a Humble Bundle, so I can't complain too much, but it really sucks that it doesn't even try to support Index. It wouldn't be so bad if the Vive support was even remotely decent, but unfortunately for whatever reason they decided not to include any way to turn if you play on Vive, and if you use an Index like I do it just boots up assuming you're on Vive.

There's no way to rebind it, no option to toggle, and an official statement from the Devs that they have no intention of updating it.

Stay away if you're on Vive or Index unless you have some damn good cable management that lets you just freely turn in real life, because otherwise you literally can't even play.

review:
One of my favorite "shooter type" games - no it is not a FPS type shooter, but it does have that element to it.  I played "Bishop" but doubt I would play the others in the game (too much physical movement for the other 'classes' for me - can't make those movement (physical limitations)).

The game skips past the attempt to make "realistic reloading" bs so it makes it very playable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198251382648', 'num_games_owned': 875, 'num_reviews': 420, 'playtime_forever': 881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 781, 'last_played': 1673202003}
review:
Great first person tower defence / wave shooter.

Maps are varied, as are the enemies. 4 characters with different weapons and powers.

Looks great, performs well, weapons feel powerful, coop works fine playing with friends is fun (not really pvp population)

Audio from voice acting to shooting to sfx are on point.

It goes on sale from time to time, grab it then, but its not a bad game even at full price

Even in early 2021 its still One of the best Tower Defense / Wave Shooters out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980760584', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1615081459}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993477748', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1615488968}
review:
To be honest, there is nothing much can be said - Raw Data is extremely obsolete at this point. 
There are some great ideas here and there, but at it's core the game is outdated and, sometimes, is really annoying (buggy train level when you constantly falling from the train on rails, also it being balanced for pistol guy rendering this level unbeatable for shotgunner and warframe ninja). 
I'm still not sure why developers didn't decided to merge all 4 classes into one, because gameplay using only one weapon getting stale too fast. 
Level variety is nonexistent - out of 8 finished levels four of them were same cryo basement with some minor changes.
Among mild annoyances - really long tutorial and whiny voice acting.

And yeah, finally - there are the worst implementation of shotgun i've ever seen in VR game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087599922', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1616689266}
review:
This game saved my life.

I am 42.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.
After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you

author: {'steamid': '76561198002807991', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1607028317}
review:
Raw Data is a great 1st gen VR game, but has it's flaws.

I first played Raw Data on a PSVR, so have played it to completion. When I previously played, the mechanics were fun and interesting, the combat was challenging yet fun, and the story was passable. So, if you have an oculus CV1 or a Vive, get this game and you'll enjoy it.

My main issue with this game is a very first world problem: The lack of index support. Most games that use Vive bindings in place of dedicated index bindings can get by decently, but Raw Data's controls and settings map very poorly to index in my opinion. I find my self constantly dropping my sword or missing my shots, not to mention the lack of snap turn (though this might just be me being stupid.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198452768988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1618159540}
review: $40???!! WOW. I had no idea. I got it on sale for $6 and still sometimes wish I could return it. Now, dont get me wrong, the gameplay is okay...not great, not super fun...challenging yes, fun...eh.... I hated how long it take just to get "into" the actual game. Besides the tutorial taking eons, and the unclear instruction of said tuturial, and lack of instruction on character classes....it's just...not...that..great.. $40?!! i'm still shocked. I would never pay that much for this game, not ever. Survios is from what i've seen a solid company that makes very polished games, with major blindingly glaring issues they neglect and move on to the next project. I personally dont gaff how smooth your game polygons look if the gameplay just isnt that fun. And the fact I can't load this game up, and just jump into some fun, kills it for me. Everything takes too long in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001623955', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1613626173}
review:
DOES NOT WORK well with Oculus Quest 2, I'm getting a refund....

The game looks cool enough but the support is dead and as I've come to find out, the developer has abandoned the game years ago...

Teleport is buggy, snap turn simply does not work unless you're on the HTC Vive, performance is pretty poor for a 2017 game. 

What a shame, I was really looking forward to this. I might rebuy on the oculus store but this leaves a bad taste.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008110697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1606551618}
review:
The core idea seemed interesting, but I never got very far as you can probably tell from my play time. How far did I get? The first missions, multiple times the first mission.
The problem was the first two times I ran it the game broke. Once, it just crashed, gotta say a crash in VR is not a fun experience when your view goes all wonky, that can be a quick trip to vomit town if you don't pull it off quick and go alt f4 on the computer.
And the other time one of the enemies had a rather... odd problem. He got stuck to my camera, as in attached to it. So he'd be crouching behind cover, but if I look to the left a bit he maintains the same relative location in my view, so he's no longer behind the cover, problem was he could still shoot at me, but my attacks would just go through him. I spent awhile shoot at all cover spots thinking he was actually still in one (or his collisions at least) but no luck. I tried walk to the edge of the room and turning my head so he'd be hopefully far enough outside the level to unload, or down on the floor I lay turning my head sideways, in the end coudn't kill him so I had to quit and restart that time.

So ya, it wasn't a great start. The core gameplay also wasn't... bad, but definitely had a few issues with movement, and some of the enemies methods of fighting or taking damage and reacting and stuff didn't feel the most intuitive or stuff, so while I felt like it'd be worth killing some time trying to play it a bit more if it ran well, with it not working well two out of three tries it just started feeling like a waste of time and after that session I haven't really gone back to play it anymore. But my core argument that this game is not reliable or bug free by any means does stand, so I can't recommend it to people since it might just not work or waste your time. If it does work, it might be an ok game, but probably not a great one or anything. So ya, if you have free time, have played everything else good you can find, and it's on a great sale then it might be worth biting the bullet but that's around where my current thoughts on it end.

review: the worst VR experience I ever had! it's so buggy and awful that I couldn't even finish the tutorial! as a heavy VR user & developer I write this review because the game is just impossible to play - the movement system, the UI, all the clicks and accepts and intros - why so much friction??? every time I tried to play I encountered a new bug - I stuck on the floor and can't move, the wrong explanation UI pops up - and the game doesn't even have a normal menu, you actually need to exit the game to change your dominant hand or to recalibrate  - I'm sure that in the core experience the game has potential, it's promising, but not with all the bugs, the poor interaction system and the never-ending friction, till I could actually play the game I just wanted to quit

author: {'steamid': '76561197970857731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1629624360}
review:
This game is simple, easy to learn, heaps of fun to play.  Find your buddy and you're in for hours and hours of fun!

After the short tutorial, we did 2 player coop.  The game has voice support so it's straight forward to yell at your buddy "behind you!", "big robots at the data core!".  Control is intuitive, character skills are diverse, covering melee/ pistol/ shotgun/ bow.  I highly recommend this game for VR coop gaming.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198051213112', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1608407707}
review:
The game is a wave shooter but to call it that would be making it terrible disservice. It has a story to give you a reason for all the killing of wave after wave of enemies, decent voice acting and some high quality videos to go with it. It has 4 characters each with it's own weapon and special abilities and those abilities are unlocked one at a time to give you a good sense of progress. All the characters will be able to build turrets but the 4 turrets available are not that great and only offer a slight tactical advantage (that you will probably need on the harder difficulties).
There is no custom load outs to speak of and you can only choose from a couple of skis for each weapon BUT the 4 characters feel very different:
1. Pistol shooting character with reload mechanics that left a little to be desired (you draw a new clip from the unlimited stash on your waist and then just move it near the clip in the pistol and the rest is automatic).  I would have liked a button to eject the old clip but after you upgrade him the reload will be done by moving the pistol to the hip so that did not matter too much.
2. Shotgun having character - just what you would expect: a lot of damage closeup and pretty big spread of pellets at a distance with options to shoot grenades ... he feels like the brawler of the pack.
3. Archer - nice bow mechanics with nice special abilities like charged arrow, multi-arrow ,etc.
4. Blade wielding jedy woman - a sword that can reflect bullets and nice telekinetic powers that make you fell like a jedy badass.

The graphix are very nice and the sound are good with only some improvement needed imo when activating voice logs that just play over the dialog that is having place but you can pause or replay them so its not too bad.

The campaign is about 5-6h but you can replay on a harder difficulty and play missions coop (2 players). There is even a PvP but I did not manage to find anybody to play. I did try a couple of coop missions and they were fun but just keep in mind that voicechat is not on by default. You have to call that player to hear him (no one answered the call so no opinion on the quality of that.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198201771489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1615080725}
review: This is one of the best VR games I have ever played, from its exceptional story line to its dynamic combat. You can be a cyber ninja with laser swords, or you could be a crime boss with a super shotgun. The only thing I don't like about it is that you aren't supposed to turn in real life, and an indicator pops up telling you to face fowards again. Truly a masterpiece of a game. 11/10, would DEFINITELY buy again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063351882', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1606846760}
review:
Honestly, it's not a bad game. It looks great, and I would have really liked it even if it wasn't VR. I played it with an Oculus Quest 2, trying with both the Oculus Link and Virtual Desktop. Since it is an earlier VR game, you can play it on budget hardware (1650/970/1650 Super) but be aware that you might need to lower the graphical settings for better framerates. Even on the lower settings though, the visuals are pretty dang impressive and the environments give a peek into the potentials that VR has for game immersion.

What is more, the gameplay, in my opinion, feels tight and fluid. It is an FPS tower defence game where there are multiple 
classes to chose from. I personally picked the cyborg ninja who does not carry a gun but has a laser katana which decimates small enemies in a single swing, and large enemies in several quick swings. Honestly, I had so much fun playing as the cyborg ninja, and at one point, I forgot I had to repair my turrets because I was so into the sword play.

The story and dialogue is also pretty interesting. The voice acting is better than that of most AAA titles (though that's not a very high bar, sorry not sorry), and as a fan of cyberpunk settings, I have so far really enjoyed how the information relevant to the story was gathered. I also chuckled whenever the voice in your head (forgot her name) argued with Simon (your robot assistant/companion). 

So why am I giving a review of the game so early? Well, it is an early VR title, and it shows. I know it might be my fault that I chose to play as the melee focused cyborg ninja, but I personally felt pretty tired and dizzy after every single level. If they were shorter, I wouldn't have minded that much. However, they often feel like they drag on forever, and the levels are relatively large. So turning around to teleport all over the place felt very disorientating. Speaking of levels, I don't think they are very well designed, and as much as I found it fun to hack and slash all over the place, I often got really frustrated when I had multiple large enemies coming at me from different directions, all the while swarms of small robots came running from other corridors. 

Needless to say, I got the game from Humble Bundle and I'd say it was worth the price I paid for it. That being said, I would personally pay a maximum of ¬£15 ($20), and not a penny more. It's not that it's a bad game (as I stated), it's just that you can do much better at ¬£30 which is just way too much for an early VR title. I recommend getting the game if you find it on sale but never at full price (unless you have someone to play with).

author: {'steamid': '76561198263158803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1606262890}
review: I got this as part of a Humble Bundle to play on my new Index. I was worried it wouldn't work after reading some other reviews. I updated every part of my Index before running the game, and didn't have any problems. The game runs well and performs as expected. It's a simple game, being a wave shooter, but it does what it sets out to do well enough. I don't think it's worth full price, but if you can get it cheap it's a decent shooter. My only complaint is that it isn't meant for seated play. When I play seated I have to dig spare mags out of my butt to reload. I couldn't see my wife's face when I did this but I sure heard her asking what the hell I was playing. And no, I didn't dirty my Index by having to dig too deep. I use a bidet, so I'm clean down there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032186037', 'num_games_owned': 535, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1606082634}
review:
‚ö†Ô∏è Review coming from a Valve Index User ‚ö†Ô∏è

TL:DR: Lack of comfort features such as turning, Knuckles controllers hardly work and make it a hassle to play, had to restart game multiple times to have coop to work, some characters are hard to use because of the controller bindings. Avoid buying game for ¬£29.99 not worth.

The game has some serious flaws on the Index controllers suck as movement being binded to the touch pad and the pressure sensitivity being all wonky. I did try out a custom key binding for it but it still wasn't perfect. The hand position was lower than my actual hands. Made interactions clunky and un-enjoyable. This game doesn't feature any kind of player rotation instead forcing you to spin on the spot, every game in 2020 should have this option by now. The movement itself feels like I'm on ice, having a small amount of acceleration and deacceleration makes it semi nauseous. Some of the characters were just un-fun to use and a hassle to actually use, the katana person is able to throw their sword but on the Index it's always a 50/50 chance of it happening. The bow and arrow angle is all off making you hip fire it in order to actually shoot it straight. The only real redeeming factor to this game that it's currently available on Humble Bundle and it looks pretty nice. Other than that, if you own the Knuckles controllers I would avoid it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037958977', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1605926462}

author: {'steamid': '76561198083560280', 'num_games_owned': 541, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1605888185}
review:
This is really bad. It really shows how this game is first generation vr when you can't snap turn and the basic movement option is teleportation and they won't let you change it until you finish the tutorial.

Gameplay wise, it's a wave shooter, a boring one too tbh. I wouldn't recommend it even if, like me, you get it for free. Go get Half-life Alyx or really any other game if you really want to play a vr shooter.

The UI is absolutely awful, I don't think I mentionned that yet. VR games especially should get good UI design to not confuse the player but this is just bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196898169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1632732658}
review: Katana Character sucks :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198090772737', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1605835921}
review:
Got it for $10. 

While I've messed around in the menus, i refuse to even try to play beyond that. 

I play on the Valve Index, and with limited space. I cannot physically turn too much or i'll either hit a desk or a dresser. That being said, Raw Data does not support the index controllers, meaning it is impossible to turn in-game. If you choose smooth locomotion instead of teleporting, if you move the joystick fully forward, you'll stop and it'll bring up the teleporting controls. 

If this supported the Index controllers, and had the ability to turn and move smoothly, I'd probably enjoy the game, but my 0.3 hours is likely to stay that way until that happens.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965174371', 'num_games_owned': 733, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1605831105}
review:
Generic wave shooter with very outdated control scheme (Teleport only, no matter what the options say). You'll need to have a large play space to dodge around in, as it appears to penalize rapid teleports by taking away your ability to teleport at all if you bounce around too much in a short time. Didn't play past the first mission. Zero index support, but the controls seemed to map well enough.


Asking price is waaay to high at this time. Pick it off the bargin bin, but don't spend more then $5 on it, not $40

author: {'steamid': '76561197971757617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1606454095}
review:
I played a bit of the first mission, which was just a wave shooter.  The videos seem to imply there is more to it, but I hit a game breaking bug on the second stealth ninja guy wave during the first mission, where I couldn't reload anymore, it wouldn't let me grab another clip from my belt, so just had to die, and I quit in frustration.

Seems there is a bit of autoaim going on to (I don't think I'm that accurate), it does make the headshots easy and satisfying.

Anyway looking at other comments seems this is possibly abandoned by the developer? at least as far as index controllers go.  So I guess I'm not expecting it to be fixed/updated.  I got this as part of a humble bundle so not too worried about it, but I would have returned it for a refund if I bought it directly, and certainly would have been disappointed paying full price.

The good it did look good, the gun play was satisfying, but I'm not likely to return anytime soon.  I didn't try the multiplayer/coop modes, not normally my thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991090389', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1605588091}
review: Got this in the humble bundle. Game is abandonware, no updates since 2017. Requires custom binds for the index controllers to work properly, won't let you change locomotion modes without doing the tutorial first, and there's no way to turn using the joysticks like real VR titles such as half life: alyx and boneworks have spoiled us with. Even with customization the other controls are clunky, and I found no way to not constantly unholster/drop/reholster the pistol if my hand got anywhere near my right hip.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089120658', 'num_games_owned': 330, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1605889638}
review: Absolute gem. didn't know this game existed until the humble bundle and soon found out just how much fun it is. 10/10 makes you feel like John Wick.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970566982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1605471526}
review:
You have to physically turn around IRL in order to turn in the game. This is a fatal issue for me as the base stations lose tracking of my controllers. It's also awkward in terms of play space, cable management etc.

If any devs read this, please consider a patch to update the movement options & controls to bring them into 2020.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960467687', 'num_games_owned': 1772, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1605333466}
review:
I want to recommend this game but just can't.  It has good ideas, and some good implementations for 360 shooter / mild td elements but has too many issues and has been abandoned by the devs.
It is a buggy mess.
If you try to co-op and are not the host you will have all kinds of issues, such as being unable to reload your offhand pistol, which has been noted for over 3 years now.
In the span of playing multiplayer for one hour issues we had were: couldn't reload offhand, at one point I had NO guns and could only punch, teleported outside of map, couldn't move, everything became invincible.  My ping to host was 60 during this play through.

With these being common issues for years they won't be fixed it seems, making for a very frustrating experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074922533', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 615, 'last_played': 1602537604}
review:
Like a lot of games in my library I played this originally with the OG Vive, and it was an absolute blast. But then expectations were lower, the tech was weaker, and I wanted to know if it lives up to spec on the Valve Index. 

It doesn't. And especially not for ¬£30 which is honestly a joke. 

I won't spend much time on this one as ultimately I won't recommend it, but quick takeaways are:

Whilst the gameplay loop is fun and at the start quite engaging, it burns out very quickly. There's not a great deal of variation in the enemies and most problems and be solved by waving a sharp stick at them very quickly. The companion narration is well executed in terms of voice acting quality, though the content leaves a lot to be desired. The story is a sneeze in the wind, gone before it can leave a trace.

Combat is varied on the surface but ultimately gets very boring very quickly. Guns have very little feel to them, the sword uses Skryim physics so short fast waves will ruin everything, but the bow and arrow is good fun. Enemies don't feel rewarding to defeat but have some nice effects when destroyed. 

The environments are very pretty and rather varied, however very forgettable and, apart from being pretty, lack functionality that sets them apart from each other in a gameplay fashion. 

There is essentially no support for the Index controllers and this makes it a nightmare to play. Do not get this if you have an Index, unless it's literally free and even then you'll have to suffer a bit.

My final takeaway is this; this game is fun-ish if you can look past the flaws. And there were no other games out there that did the exact same things but better. And it wasn't thirty damn pounds sterling.

review:
I first tried this game as a PSVR demo and had a lot of fun with it there, so I was excited to try it here, but it has completely busted Index controller support, and the devs have openly stated they aren't fixing it, and the issues with the Index controllers are so deep they *cannot* be fixed with community remapping.

So... it's trash. Not really playable by any means.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986428281', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1605307239}
review:
Absolutely poor index support, turning functionality appears to be completely missing from this game. I wasn't able to find community bindings in SteamVR that enable it and even tried OpenVR for alternatives.

Ultimately I wasn't able to play the game, let alone start a mission. Grip controls feel a little janky but I think that's largely due to pointing at the menu when holding a weapon which seems to holster it until you point away. 

I'd really like to see more of this game but being limited to standing room only and not a lot of options for turning, I honestly cannot recommend the game for anyone in my position. It's too critical a feature to have missing.

review: Cool game. Before every mission, you can play as four different operatives: Bishop, with pistols. Elder, with bow and arrow. And then my two favourite operatives Boss with a shotgun and Saija with a flash blade. As you play with these operatives you unlock new abilities these include passive abilities that can be used at any time and ultimate abilities that do lots of damage but have a cool-down. Overall: Cool game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002000160', 'num_games_owned': 512, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1614896779}
review:
A must play. Very satisfying gun/swordplay, it looks and sounds great, the abilities you unlock add a lot to the game.

I have an index, and while the game isn't built for it, and does have a few issues (gripping can be buggy sometimes, no snap turn)  these didn't get in the way of having a great time.

You need enough space to swing your arms, i have a 2m x 2m space, which is just about enough to not worry about smashing your walls (i recommend putting a bath mat down in the middle so you can feel with your feet where you should stand.

I haven't had my index for long, but so far this is the best shooter i have played
