author: {'steamid': '76561198055928482', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1596, 'last_played': 1640053600}
review: Pretty good for what it is, interesting story and good overall gameplay... except the bow. My Rift S does not like bows in any game and this one is no exception. The tracking lags so bad, it's almost worthless. The katana throw is horrible, almost complete garbage, but that's just one move on a character's skillset rather than the whole skillset. The game is definitely worth picking up, especially on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102407795', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1600220961}
review: This game has no business being $40 dollars anymore. I can't really comment on where VR was 3 years ago when this game was released, but this feels like a tech demo. Extremely repetitive combat missions in which you have to use one weapon for the entirety of the mission are basically the entire game. There is the multiplayer but good luck finding anyone else still playing this. Maybe it was a limitation of the time, but I cannot understand why you would break out the weapons into different characters which you are locked into for the entirety of whichever level you play instead of just giving the player freedom to switch between weapons as the situations in the levels demanded it. I highly recommend against this game, considering how many worthwhile VR experiences are available these days.

This game is great, one of the best VR shooters out there. The pvp is amazing and by far the best part imo...but it just really needs to be promoted more or go f2p cause people are sleeping on this great shooter and it'd be a shame for it to die. 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198880717778', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1605480262}
review:
It's a wave shooter which is not my favourite genre of FPS, but it's done very very well.
- weapons really fits and are done very good
- you have 4 different charaters you can play
- each character has it's own perks which are opening by playing them
- it has COOP mode, so you can play with friends
- it has difficulties
- it has PVP mode (I'm not PVP player, but I count it as pro)

I recommend, it's fun to play, and also very relaxing.

Przekle≈Ñstwem gry jest wed≈Çug mnie to jak gra siƒô zaczyna. Ciƒô≈ºko siƒô odnale≈∫ƒá, a postacie nie wydajƒÖ siƒô byƒá interesujƒÖce. Po trofeach widzƒô, ≈ºe ma≈Ço kto da≈Ç grze szansƒô, a naprawdƒô warto.

Tak jak pisa≈Çem w mojej opinii to 10/10. Polecam.


I've been wondering for a long time and I've had to give 9/10, but I'll give it 10/10. The game is amazing.

We have at our disposal 10 relatively large levels (transition time). Each of which is divided into five parts, so you can catch your breath. Levels vary widely, although the first two can discourage.

The situation is similar with the heroes. We have four completely different heroes to choose from. Each has six skills that we unlock for level transitions. That is, unlocking all skills for all characters is 24 levels of the game. Each hero is cool and offers a different way of playing. And here, in the same way, without unlocked skills, they can discourage.

I personally recommend choosing a teleport as a way of moving.

A guide at our headquarters. Completing all the tasks of the guide will make it easier to understand the game. And here traditionally, ... the game can discourage you if you don't. In addition, here it is worth to test yourself quietly each unlocked skill. The control, it is very good, it is extensive and convenient. But... can discourage if we do not read what and how.

The story is expanded, additionally collecting five "jingles" from each level. We unlock interesting audio tracks, lists and descriptions that open the story more widely.

Difficulty levels are well chosen, playing alone on normal, is normal. On hard it is difficult, and on the nightmar nightmar horribly. Playing with someone in two makes it much easier to play. I went through the game alone to normal later on hard and it is possible. At this time I went through one level on nightmar (one I tried myself without the other person). It's not played by many people today, but you can play online if you want.

I highly recommend the game. I believe it is better than many well-known and popular titles. Most of my library, and others that I played and do not have, including those considered top. The curse of the game, in my opinion, is how the game begins. It's hard to get started, and the characters don't seem to be interesting. Watching the trophies I see that few people gave the game a chance, and it is really worth it.

As I wrote in my opinion is 10/10. Recommend.

review:
Seems like a fun game, but the complete inability to turn ruins the experience. Probably not a problem if you have a lot of room but even before I got into a proper level, my controllers would lose tracking because I hold it up at an angle that hides it from one of my base stations while my body blocks the other.

If I could just turn in-game, it'd be infinitely more playable. If you have the room or hardware other than the index, it might still be worth picking up.

The devs apparently have no plans on updating the game, which is a shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006585831', 'num_games_owned': 592, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1105, 'last_played': 1599245413}
review:
Played on the Oculus Rift S.

Was the first full game I'd played to completion, and I really enjoyed it. I picked it up on a sale for ¬£5.10 - and I feel I've gotten my monies worth - not sure I'd say it's worth the full ¬£29.99 though. The game has 10 levels at 5 waves a level (so 50 waves total). Some of the levels are similar in design (they change elements but are ultimately the same level - but I'm cool with this given the changes in level and introduction of new enemies on these levels) but overall I liked the levels.

There are four heros, each with six unlockable abilities. You can unlock all 6 abilities by playing and finding all of the collectables on the first five levels for each character. The shotgun felt a bit weird to me, but might just be me.

I've played co-op with a friend and has been decent too, not experienced any issues - covering my friends face with my hand and blocking his vision has been fun though! Haven't tried the PvP mode yet.

review: Wave shooter game. There are several playable characters (which use pistol gun, shotgun, bow, or sword), which are more or less appropriate to use depending on the level. I enjoyed the sword dude the most, mostly because you mostly swing around your sword (plus eventually use skills) and it's fun. Until you find the explosive robots. The game is not even bad, until you reach a level where you are pretty much forced to physically crouch, which is something I personally do not enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087735490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1592787641}
review:
[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
Raw Data is a fun game with questionable UI design choices.

[h1]Summary[/h1]
Okay, I can only play this game in short bursts because, while it is fun, it doesn't really do a good job of mitigating motion sickness or accounting for small playspaces. Below is a list of gripes, followed by a list of things I think the game does well.

[h2]Gripes[/h2]
[list]
[*]Many of the UI elements are stuck to your face so you have to utilize your glance to to read text on the edges of the lenses. 
[*]Hints and titles often sit in the middle of your vision and block the action
[*]As someone who gets easily motion sick, limiting and flat out disabling the teleport [i]at all[/i] is borderline unacceptable. This is only exacerbated by a small playspace.
[*]Game elements are often placed outside of my playspace so I can't reach mission critical elements, and the teleport ability can only get so close to map geometry. I'm sure you can imagine how frustrating this is.
[*]The sword, while it is the most fun in my opinion, is very difficult to use because it has to be swung pretty fast to do any noticeable damage. It will probably do more damage to your real life walls than anything in the game if you have a small playspace like me.
[*]The pistol is not quite aligned with the Oculus Touch controller and feels like I have to slightly turn my wrists outward to line up the sights
[*]The player characters' arms feel like their shoulders sit higher than normal, which is weird since I often have the opposite problem being 6'2" (188 cm)
[/list]

[h2]Things the game does well[/h2]
[list]
[*]The game looks good.
[*]The game sounds good.
[*]The pistol and bow feel good to use and like they reward skillful play.
[*]Most enemies react satisfyingly to being hit.
[*]There's an actual story with solid voice acting and dialogue.
[*]Feels good to unlock stuff and try it put immediately between every mission.
[/list]

[h2]Conclusion[/h2]
This game is great, especially with friends, if you can tolerate weird UI design choices and a little motion sickness. I have to play it in short bursts because of all the weirdness, but honestly that's okay, since my pudgy body tends to poop out around the same time I get sick or frustrated with things being outside my playspace.

Get Zero Caliber VR instead, it proveds much more guns and much more content. I'll just be doing a comparason

Pros:
+ different characters
+ a story that makes sence

Cons:

author: {'steamid': '76561198035130011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1588877483}
review:
Oculus Rift CV1

More a base tower defense game than a FPS,  it is hard to apprehend at the beginning you have to let go your frustration from the confusing start especially if like me you bought the game a while ago and did not really knew what to expect from it.  

The levels are small rooms but big enough for you to move around and defend against waves of ennemies. There are 4 characters and each have their own weapon: pistol, shotgun, blade and bow. The range weapons are a bit approximative in their shooting mechanics, I should precise the pistols and the bow, so don't expect a super acute FPS experience but if you like strategy and Base Tower Defense games you'll love it, don't imagine soemthing completely terrible it's just that it's not purely FPS oriented. It reminds me of Sanctum 2 a bit.
The story is there but unremarkable however the graphics are nice, no screen tearing, the only thing that I really don't like are the messages appearing on top of my gun when I am aiming and shooting my targets. 
Overall it's good action with some moments of total panic. I play the campaign solo but there are people online and you can either play Co-op or PVP. Co-op is probably where it's at but I want to play solo on normal difficulty at least for my first character then I'll invite or get invited. There is an ignore option for the people spamming you to play with them. 

Once again, give the game some time for the first 30 minutes is poor experience you don't have double wielding or power ups or automatic towers etc yet, you get my point DO NOT JUDGE THIS GAME TOO QUICKLY.

>SOlid 7.5/10,  worth it in 2020.

Les armes √† deux main sont laborieuse et mal design√©e : le fusil √† pompe est trop grand pour le tenir √† deux mains et n'est pas adapt√© √† la prise main gauche et √† l'inverse l'arc est trop petit ce qui fait qu'on a l'impression d'avoir une jouet pour enfant ou au mieux un arc pour enfant dans les mains.
L'impression g√©n√©rale que j'ai c'est que c'est un jeu de tir o√π la vis√©e est totalement al√©atoire.
Le plus comique c'est que le fusil √† pompe a un tr√®s bon viseur...
Les graphismes sont corrects.
Le jeu est tr√®s vite ennuyant surtout du fait que les armes sont mauvaises. On encha√Æne les tirs approximatifs pour esp√©rer toucher l'adversaire. Donc il faut minimum un chargeur pour tuer un mob...

author: {'steamid': '76561197998094126', 'num_games_owned': 1682, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1587955460}
review: One of the better VR games I've played - it has a lot of content for a VR game and the gameplay loop is fun.  It does suffer from unskippable dialog and slow elevator rides for levels you've been through before at times (especially frustrating after a missions failure).  There are a few bugs but they didn't get in the way of gameplay too much.  The story is fairly well done if not particularly original, though it'd be nice if it gave you a choice toward the end given the direction they went with it.

De m√™me le fait de jouer sur oculus est assez mal pris en compte puisque pour viser droit vous allez devoir vois tordre le poignet. Peut-√™tre un des meilleurs jeu du d√©but de la VR mais abandonnez l'id√©e d'y jouer maintenant.

review: This game is great! love playing it with friends and the mechanics are pretty simple. There‚Äôs an alright story line and plenty of background info to go allowing with it. Some say the game is to hard once you get far enough.... well luckily, they have this nifty little option to change the intensity of the level. Nightmare mode is the most fun imo. But if you don't believe me try it for yourself. i'd rate this game 7/10. downsides are for the repetitiveness in the beginning and some glitches but overall, it‚Äôs a really polished game that i think is worth the 15 or so bucks.

review: This game is like a disney ride with guns; much of the "story" is annoying voice acting that you can't skip through. Beyond that it's just a wave shooter. When it first came out there weren't a lot of decent VR games, but paying $40 for this now would be ridiculous.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082073343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1613317059}
review:
Whilst the game itself has an enjoyable combat system, there isn't really much else on offer here. The "story" is wave-based combat that switches to wave-based combat with points to defend about 5 missions in. It can be beaten with relative ease. There's no options for anything like subtitles that I could find anywhere in any options menu, so the story itself which is delivered as narration over all the fighting can be hard to hear and understand.

There's also not been any notable updates to the game in a year or so, as proven by the fact that I've played through on a Rift S and the game displays models for the original Rift controllers when starting the game up so some of the jankier mechanics aren't going to change anytime soon and there won't be any new features added anytime soon either.

review: Played this game when it was still Early Access.  Watched more content added as I played, and definitely enjoyed myself. Played most of this with a friend, and I would definitely recommend playing it that way. Solo, it's not as fun, but still worth playing. The gun play is fun enough, the characters are all very unique, the skills the characters gain are fun, and there is a diverse amount of enemy types to keep it interesting. $40 is a steep price point, but I'd say pick it up with a friend if it goes on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063144610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1588518096}
review: Nach ein paar Einstellungen, das Men√º ist wirklich ein wenig Un√ºbersichtlich, Spielt sich das Spiel wirklich klasse. Die Grafik ist Fortschrittlich, verglichen mit anderen VR Titeln und die Twists sind wirklich eine Herausforderung. Der erste Kampf im Dunkeln nur mit dem Licht an der Pistole, das war schon wirklich was Stressiges, aber wer sowas wie Herausforderung nicht m√∂chte der sollte nicht Raw Data spielen. Nachdem ich den Oculus Room Modus eingestellt habe nervt auch der Hinweis nicht mehr ich solle mich zu den nicht vorhandenen Kameras umdrehen. Von mir gibts gan√ü klar ein 8/10. Ein bisschen mehr durch die Welt h√§tte ich mich schon gern K√§mpfen wollen, doch die Rundenbasierten K√§mpfe finden, zumindest bis jetzt, mehr in einem Labor statt dass sich immerhin auch von Welle zu Welle erweitert. Wie viele Gegnertyen und verschiedene Gegenden es gibt werde ich wohl auch sehen wenn ich weiter Spiele, und sollte es etwas Freier werden, also auch mal ein Kampf durch eine gr√∂√üere Arena spendiere ich meiner Bewertung eine Editierung mit angepasstem Score.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960885974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1598626093}
review:
I played raw data when it was released and it was very glitchy and buggy, but it was one of the first better wave shooters back than. Now they had a lot of time to do updates and fix everything so I tried it in coop mode with my wife.
The game is still quite buggy and feels like the same old "tech" demo. The graphics and performance are a bit better, but not comparable with current AAA VR Games. If you want to play though all maps it takes about 5 hours which isn¬¥t that much, compared to the price. The game is quite simple, just a room, with robots spawning around you.

About 20% of the time is just waiting and hearing some non skippable and boring dialogs. Everything feels quite slow.
We ended up, closing the whole game every time we finished a mission, to avoid those long dialogs and faster start the next mission.

One one mission my wife lost her ammo and couldn¬¥t reload anymore, so we needed to start again. Things like those are quite frustrating, especially if you got used to newer coop shooters, which provide better quality, amount of content and less bugs. I shouldn¬¥t have played it again, to keep my good old memories from the first time I did. Now it feels like watching a very old movie again, to see that it now sucks. 

I can¬¥t recommend the game for the full price, If you have never experienced VR, its ok, but I played more than 200 VR titles and Raw Data is ranked 89 on my personal list of VR titles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076790219', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1582224303}
review:
NOT WORTH FULL PRICE  
Good game tho  
So the game is wave based shooter with turrets. The maps are pretty jaw dropping but the gameplay is on rails enemy. Movement is solid, there's walk and teleportation, I use a mixture of both. The characters level up but in my opinion each character needs more weapons. 
6/10 recommend on at least 1/2 price off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002636573', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1581885424}
review:
I've had this in my library for ages. After trying it out and apparently not understanding what I was doing I didn't play anymore. Now that I've retried and unlocked a few more upgrades it's much more fun. No more manual reloading, dual wielding, and more offsets this game compared to something like Space Pirate Trainer.
The story is actually interesting, although to actually experience it you have to wait between phases and listen to the NPCs, otherwise you can accidentally just click through all of it. Skippable 'cutscenes'? You bet.
Visually it's very nice.
All in all a good VR title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030792746', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1580425287}
review: The game itself seems like it could be fun with the right controllers, but I would not recommend getting this game if all you have are knuckles controllers. The game is not optimized for them at all and it is hard to use them. For one, grabbing weapons and objects is very unintuitive with the knuckles controllers, and it requires you to maintain a force grip the whole time you are holding the object unless you use the sticky pickup mode, which makes putting down the objects annoying. This pales in comparison to the bigger issue which is the movement. For some reason, there is no way to use the joystick for walking, and you can only use it for teleporting. which is incredibly difficult to use in combat and makes using two handed weapons almost impossible. If you want to walk normally, you are forced to use the small scroll wheel touchpad which makes moving sideways impossible, and along with this if you accidentally press a little too hard on the touchpad while you are trying to move it will open the teleport movement. I was only able to play the first mission before I had to quit because I got so annoyed by accidentally dropping my weapon every minute or so and having to wait ~3 seconds for it to respawn on my back so I could use it again, and constantly having to sit and wait for the enemies to come attack me because I couldn't move towards them easily.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021324770', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1579093425}
review:
The Good
+ INTENS. Enemies come from everywhere. You can't hide! Also you have to move all the time to avoid getting punched and/or to dodge lasers
+ 4 classes with unique weapons and abilities. Surprisingly, I liked the shotgun guy the most for its melee. Punching robots in the head feels good. Very good.
+ Nice variety of enemies.
+ 10 maps. First two maps are similar, but the other maps are very different. I liked the map in particular where you have to duck/run around to dodge the lasers.
+ Graphics are well done (they look good even on low, which I'm playing on with my RX470).
+ Interesting story. It's quite funny how deep the story and universe is, considering you're in the same building most of the time. The dialogues between simon and ang3l are hilarious.
+ Good music, especially for a small game studio.

The Less Good
~ Sometimes the drone explosions are not visible (bug? maybe this is just the low graphics settings).
~ The crawling zombie robots sometimes get stuck on your body when they die on you, which seems to cause subsequent problems with movement.
~ One of the main characters aNg3L keeps telling you to hurry up, and even talks over recorded messages. which is so rude..
~ The tower defense aspect seems to be an afterthought. It's sometimes cumbersome to design a good cluster, because the map is not divided into tiles the size of a turret. Objects stand in the way. Sometimes the turret highlight is green and flickering (e.g. happens when trying to put a shield turret near the data core in some levels). Enemy has trouble shooting at the turret and vice versa when there's an obstacle between enemy and turret.
~ When you lose connection, even when playing single player, there will be a massive pop-up message that blocks your vision and the game doesn't stop. So you have to keep evading and killing robots as you clumsily close the message.
~ No endless mode. I think a survival mode with endless waves could give the game a lot of replay value.

Anyway, I've had a lot of fun with this game so far and I hope there will be a sequel that takes the story further, with perhaps a more fleshed out tower defense and more lasers (maybe a map with only lasers?)!!
The good outweighs the bad, and the buggy things can be fixed. Haven't tried co-op yet bcs of my internet instability.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981614306', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1577040651}
review:
If you own a Valve Index, don't bother unless you're okay with manually turning, as the right analogue does absolutely nothing. I sadly can't handle the manual 360 turning, as I end up wandering, deeming this game absolutely pointless. Admittedly, it doesn't say it supports the Valve Index and I took a shot in the dark, hoping the devs would soon update it to support one of the leading headsets, but the sad reality is they don't even update it. Will change my comment if they ever decide to integrate a simple control system.

TL;DR = Index DOES NOT WORK (as stated). Shame, as it's looks like it would have been loads of fun (My negative is purely from the lack of support for devices, with a hefty price tag and seemingly ignorant developers).

author: {'steamid': '76561198073319250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1578302781}
review:
Recent reviews at the time of me posting this review are mixed which I think is very sad. This game definitely deserves an overwhelmingly positive rating. I was almost 10 hours into this game and I absolutely love the gameplay although I will start off by pointing out some of the things I think are flawed in this game and why it may have received mixed reviews.
1. Voice acting is very poor and some of the characters can be annoying during gameplay.
2. Tutorial system is not very good; I spent half the game fighting as the bow guy and I didn't know I could create a decoy as well as use another type of arrow which was stored on my back. I had to look up the game online to figure out I had a decoy and then I had to fiddle with the controls to figure out how to use the abilities. Let me save you the trouble: the bow guy's decoy can be activated by grabbing his right holster and pulling outwards and there's another type of arrow you can grab off his back. They teach you how to use all arrows, but I couldn't find a tutorial where they taught you how to use the decoy.
3. Some levels are recycled in the game with the addition of some extra areas which I found somewhat disappointing.

However, all in all; why I praise this game so much despite its flaws is just how fun all the game mechanics were - it was a blast playing as the bow guy and shooting down enemies, and even though some levels were recycled there was still variety in levels you'd see in the campaign. The campaign is also somewhat short (consisting of around 8 short levels) however I don't judge harshly on short games because that campaign was good quality and the community who play this game are also really nice and help each other out. There's so many sales for this game but I'd happily purchase it for full price and I'm the type of guy who doesn't leave reviews often.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060468688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1578167930}
review:
This game almost gets it right, but having played truly great VR games this title constantly leaves me frustrated. Weapons randomly holster themselves or disappear altogether, abilities activate for seemingly no reason, and some abilities are so poorly implemented that there's simply no point in using them. The inability to look left and right with the right thumb stick is an understandable design choice, but feels like more of a chore than immersion. Lastly, the PvP is hilariously broken. It's just a race to see who hits who first and playing as the ranger makes his far too effortless.

If you're looking for a co-op VR game, this one is playable, but I'd be hard pressed to call it fun.

Played on Valve Index.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039389246', 'num_games_owned': 1213, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1577642485}
review:
It's got some issues that prevent me from burning dozens of hours in it, so I can't suggest it as an example of what VR can be, but it's still fun. The issues stem from weird tracking/gripping issues that cause weapons to straight up fail, fall out of your hands, change hands (lookin' at you, bow-n-arrow guy), etc. The control scheme isn't the most refined in VR history, but it's not too bad. Each weapon and ability, when working correctly, feel impactful and useful. Each enemy feels reasonable. Co-op is decent.  
The game is a bit shallow and tries too hard to throw things at you (tutorials mostly), and it seems to forget when you've completed a tutorial at times.  
Overall, it's an OK VR game that I'd really enjoy if they fixed the clunky handling and weapon-breaking bologna.

review:
I can barely recommend this game. It voices itself as a fps experience and the trailers make it seem like you move room to room, fighting waves of bosses. Yet, it just seems to be a single room that you run around. There is no head height cover and the classes are quite glitchy, making the game feel very frustrating. When the game does work and the classes don't glitch out everywhere, it's pretty fun, but the Rift S's wires make me have to slow down a bit

tl;dr 6/10; needs more patches and more realistic representative trailer

author: {'steamid': '76561198971379817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1658631001}
review:
it might seem short , and there is only 4 characters, but this game is absolutely worth the purchase , the 1st couple of missions make you think the game is going to be pretty much the same for every mission, but the missions get more interesting the farther into the story you get , the multiplayer is fun but unfortunately not enough people are playing this game, so i only ever saw 1 multiplayer map


trust me if you are looking to blow off steam or take out your frustrations , these robots are made just for you 


 the ps4 demo doesn't do it justice, dont get me wrong the ps4 demo was fun but i almost didn't get the game because i don't like when games have teleport as the only method of getting around, but this game lets you turn on walk then your still able to teleport witch is awesome because you can walk around normal like then when you need to get away from or near a enemy you could warp way


my only complaint with this  game is you cant turn on walk until you get passed the 1st cutscene, and they have as a preference on the menu before you start the game, i want to be able to set walk before i start







this really makes me want the old ps2 era star wars battlefront 2 in vr, so if the devolpers of this game was to ever make a star wars game i would absolutely buy it

or  someone could make a star wars mod that could be cool, honestly any mod that expands this game would be nice

either way i love this game so much that i need more please

author: {'steamid': '76561197978010407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1575599724}
review: I played the game for over an hour. No problems with graphics or gameplay.  However, as a FPS I was expecting something along the story lines of Doom or AZ Sunshine. Instead, the game (solo play) is a series of "arena" challenges. There is the "holding" area, where you can train and learn about missions, and then you descend via elevator to a room where you need to fight off successive waves of robots. Then back up the elevator. No exploration, no real maps. Just up and down. Not my cup of tea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024588924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1575098207}
review: I can't get over the graphics issues. I get a lot of frame stuttering but also bad graphics and menus and tooltips that seem to be scaled way too large and get in the way of other things. I played this a year or two ago whenever it first came out and was having issues and steam discussions about the sort of ugly aliasing I was getting, i thought for sure this is a technical issue and it will be sorted out eventually. Playing it again in late 2019 and the issues are still there. Lots of weird moire aliasing and the anti-aliasing seems to just make it worse and actually makes performance and graphics worse. I use cosmic trip and the lab as my go-to standard of what things should look like in VR for clarity. This game looks like it has a ton of fine detail that looks good in screenshots and somehow does not translate to VR headsets at all. Either that or I'm having technical issues, but I have no way of knowing if it's technical or I just have certain expectations. It has a lot of content, so for 9.99 it's probably a great deal for some. But I can't recommend it based on my  own experiences in VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045552099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1697315502}

author: {'steamid': '76561198409242060', 'num_games_owned': 52, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1575093655}
review: Dude, man, this game, is not very good, in my opinion. The graphics are actually just mediocre if not even below that. The movement of the robots and such are incredibly unnatural. Obviously they are robots but the immersion is ruined when one sees these poorly programmed robots. There is not much interaction. I mean that in the sense where your hand and weapon goes straight through objects and there are veeeery limited things one can actually grab. I think that is a huge problem with a lot of VR games, but what can I do but write a review. The combat is just a slow wave combat which isnt really that hard until later and overall just isnt really that exciting. The guns are crap, the sword is meh, the bow is bad. I'm talking about those in terms of enjoyment not power. I really wouldnt waste your money. I got this for 10$ and feel i should refund it and it wasnt worth the money. I much much rather play a game with even much less content like blade and sorcery. Do what you want but I would not advise spending money on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168041872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1575071863}
review: This is a poorly polished tower defense game with an annoying amount of inane drivel constantly pattering out of the mouths of the cheap voice actors.  Graphics were meh.  Mechanics were worse.  Levels were repetitive and boring tower defense of inanely small scale.  This is no Sanctum 2.  This is no Plants Vs Zombies.  This is like Crystal Defenders, but with less enemies and defenses.   I got it as a gift and refunded it.  Maybe pick it up if it is less than $2.00.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021771780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1584118452}
review:
- Valve Index + Knuckles
- Ryzen 2700X
- RX580 Nitro +
- allready played a lot on PSVR

The game runs smootlhy on highest settings (Index set at 90Hz).

Its a little bit like an arena shooter/tower defense with story, waves of enemy coming at you (or a core to protect) and you can move around in locomotion or teleporting. 

You can choose left or right hand as main hand, controlls are fine, the action and atmosphere is great. Feels like a big game with replay value, coop, hidden collectibles, different characteres (each character represents a weapon and skills with this weapon: pistol, shotgun, bow and flashsaber thingy lets just say cyber katana) and so on. 
I would absolutely recommend it if you like action games and have a little workout while playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001813417', 'num_games_owned': 457, 'num_reviews': 850, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1571869007}
review:
Ist Raw Data von Survios mittlerweile in die Jahre gekommen? Die erste Ver√∂ffentlichung war 2016, seitdem ist viel passiert und das Spiel erschien bereits auf allen Plattformen. Es war damals eines der ersten Spiele mit gr√∂√üerem Umfang und fantastischer Grafik. Raw Data kam somit fast schon einem AAA-Titel nahe. Zu dieser Auffassung kann man aber auch heute noch kommen, wenn man es zuletzt 2016 gespielt hat, denn nicht nur grafisch wurde Raw Data h√ºbscher, sondern unter anderem wurde auch die Storyline erweitert.

Raw Data bleibt aber immer der bekannte und wohl beste Wave-Shooter, der sich auf den Arenakampf konzentriert. Hier steht man allein oder in Gesellschaft gegen√ºber den anst√ºrmenden Feinden und muss ihnen standhalten. Die Spieler k√∂nnen hinter Deckung verschwinden und sich √ºber den Kampfplatz teleportieren oder auch frei Bewegen.

Es gibt vier w√§hlbare Charaktere, jeder mit seinen eigenen Kampfstil, der jeweils hochgeskillt werden kann. Es gibt jede Menge verschiedener Waffen, sogar B√∂gen und Schwerter. Jede Arena kann in verschiedenen Schwierigkeitsgraden gespielt werden und hat freischaltbare Inhalte die im Laufe der Kampagne gebraucht und benutzbar oder verf√ºgbar werden.
Es gibt einen Einzel- und Koopmodus sowie Teamwettk√§mpfe aber auch 1vs1-K√§mpfe sind in Raw Data m√∂glich.

 Raw Data sieht technisch nach den Updates immer besser aus und funktioniert mittlerweile reibungslos. Das Spiel l√§sst sich trotz der hervorragenden Teleportationsbewegung auch wunderbar in fl√ºssiger Bewegung spielen, wo bei die Richtung der Handbewegung folgt.

Raw Data ist immer noch einer der Vorzeige-Wave-Shooter in VR schlechthin. Eine tolle Einzelspielerkampagne, ein hervorragender Multiplayermodus und die M√∂glichkeit Koop zu spielen l√§sst diesen Titel wohl noch l√§nger in den VR-Charts ganz oben stehen.

Wer es noch nicht hat, bei einem Sale bedenkenlos zugreifen.

[u]English:[/u]
------------------------------------------->
Is Raw Data from Survios getting on in years? The first release was in 2016, a lot has happened since then and the game has been released on all platforms. It was one of the first games to be released with a larger contend and fantastic graphics. Raw Data came very close to an AAA title. But you can still come to this conclusion today, if you played it last in 2016, because not only did Raw Data get prettier graphically, but among other things the storyline was extended.

But Raw Data will always remain the well known and probably best wave shooter, focusing on the arena fight. Here you stand alone or in company against the attacking enemies and have to resist them. The players can disappear behind cover and teleport across the battlefield or move freely.

There are four selectable characters, each with their own fighting style, each of which can be highly skilled. There are lots of different weapons, even bows and swords. Each arena can be played in different levels of difficulty and has unlockable content that can be used or become available during the campaign.
There is a single and co-op mode as well as team competitions but also 1vs1 fights are possible in Raw Data.

 Raw Data looks better and better after the updates and is now working smoothly. Despite the excellent teleportation movement, the game can be played in fluid motion, where the direction of hand movement follows.

Raw Data is still one of the showcase wave shooters in VR par excellence. A great single player campaign, an excellent multiplayer mode and the possibility to play co-op will keep this title at the top of the VR charts for a long time to come.

If you don't have it yet, take it without hesitation at a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134812738', 'num_games_owned': 39, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1572212358}
review:
it's ok, but there's much better games out there. 

I must say, I love the setting and the story. It's very creative and enjoyable. However, the game feels quite repetitive, and by comparison, outdated. 

For example, the weapon mechanics are quite basic. The pistols reload by just moving them close to the holster, for example. The light sword thing is awesome, but feels weird and inconsistent. throwing it is very difficult, and using it up-close doesn't work lots of the time. 

Gameplay is fun, but too repetitive. it's baasically stand there and survive. If you die, you just respawn without any penalty, which removes the challenge too. 

In general, compared to games like H3VR, Raw Data feels archaic and repetitive, and to me fails to justify a price tag of $15, let alone a whopping $40. I'll keep on playing a bit and try any other modes, and I'll change my review if I change my mind

I have not quite finished the game yet, but its pretty good so far, the game mechanics are impressive, the variety of people to play as is very fun, and soundtrack is amazing. review:
One of the first VR games I bought. Definitely something you should pick up if you want more VR experiences.

It's got several different classes with unique unlockable skills that makes the character much more fun to play (for example you can upgrade from one sword to two swords) so there is replayability.

The only dislike I would have about the game is the system robot that constantly makes cheesy jokes throughout the whole game. It's alright at first but... c'mon

review: Just played a few missions and I had to write a review. I saw many comments about movement or turning not being an option. I am not sure if or when they updated it but all the turning options and walking options are there. Smooth turn is the way I like to play and it is in there if you look for it. The game so far is really good I have loved every second of it . The graphics to the voice acting seem great. The gun play has many options like charged shot or rapid fire I don't know if or how many other weapons are in the game so this maybe the only ones but it still is so fun to play. There is even multiplayer co-op , PVP and things like king of the hill that I can not wait to try. Again great game to have in your VR collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970617460', 'num_games_owned': 1118, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1566171238}
review:
Disclosure: Received this for free via a Steam Gifts giveaway site (not from the developer).
Hardware: HTC Vive Gen 1 (Wired-Room Scale)

I initially encountered what I would consider a bug in the beginning when trying to locate the power switch as it was not rendering near the center console but I eventually found it jumping around.

I've played all of the available tutorial options thus far and a handful of missions with Boss and Bishop. Using boss on the first mission my first play-through may have been a mistake but it was a great experience that I took him through the second mission as well. The game is great fun but I only wish I had a wireless headset. At the speed the enemies are coming at you and from the various angles (both ground and air) I felt I had to hold my aggression and speed back from the virtual world while worrying to not trip over my cable or melee a metal pole just outside my play area. Overall, it has been great fun and there no complaints from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970859560', 'num_games_owned': 5618, 'num_reviews': 358, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1564374893}
review:
Recommend: Yes. Caveat: $40 is too much. 

This is one of the better VR action games I've played. The graphics are decent, the story is good enough (though standard sci-fi fare), the weapons are decent, sound/music fine. 

I find the controls too ambitious and kind of janky. There are too many abilities mapped to too few buttons, and it's not feasible to use them properly in combat in a VR interface. There are some odd problems as well--shotgun dude's shotgun keeps clipping through my vision, bow guy's arrow hand gets stuck, sometimes with katana guy your sword drops out of your hand when you meant to throw. 

At this point the price should drop to $20 and I'd give it a totally solid yes. Regardless of the problems, it is fun.

review: This game is a blast.  Gun play feels great.  Not much enemy variety however.  Want to feel like Zero from borderland 2 but in VR?  Play the katana cyborg and get a nice workout, melee is very satisfying.  Should be in anyone early VR collection.  Got the game free as a deal but worth it for 20.  Works fine with Index and controllers.  Good co-op

author: {'steamid': '76561197985565063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1564709432}
review:
I'd like to review this game as kind of mixed, but steam doesn't allow for that level of complexity in your rating so it's a not recommended.

In short, I have one, maybe two huge problems with this game.

There's too much fucking preamble. If I want to just get in game and kill some shit, it takes a short eternity.

The UI is non-obvious and not great for VR, it's a big step up from the absolute garbage they had for a UI during their first free weekend, but a step up from garbage to just bad isn't great.

The actual gameplay is OK. They never did a great job of handling some ways of cheesing enemies and it's kind of just another wave shooter, but you can move.

By VR standards, it's a decent game but they really didn't take advantage of the VR aspect at all, more like grudgingly worked around it.


I got this for free through a promo, and at that price it's worth getting, but I probably wouldn't pay any sale price it's been at to date for it. There are better games out there for VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143183012', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1584285622}
review: Some of the best armed combat mechanics I've seen so far. Guns feel nice, Melee is surprisingly enjoyable if you're not worried about ramming your fists into nearby walls or furniture. Only now found out that this also has multiplayer too. Enemy movement appears to be slow at first, but it might actually be just right after all. Voice acting is definitely on point aswell. Really enjoyed my first time playing, I'll be back for more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992711083', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1562631851}
review:
Awful. 

Right off the bat, the floor calibration is broken, so just above your ankles will mark the floor line. Have fun with your immediate disillusionment and nausea. Guns are equally poorly calibrated, so if you make a "thumbs up" sign with your hand, a few degrees shy of where your thumb is now pointing are your inexplicably placed cross-hairs. 

Animation is bad. Tutorial is a cacophony of noise, a mix between gunfire, an annoying character explaining the ill-conceived rules of the game, music, and robot sounds. You are supposed to "get out of the way" of gunfire, to "stay mobile," but the aforementioned problems make that inconvenient, to say the least. Like so many other games, far too much info is barfed onto you all at once, exactly while all the noise is occurring while you slog through the ankle deep floor and shoot at CG robots that all look identical from a VCR tape of what computer animation looks like from 1995. 

Graphics look like Playstation 2.

review:
Are we not going to talk about the terrible voice-over work?
With all VR games, there's not much here. Literally the same small room over and over again with slight variation. That wouldn't be so bad except for the characters talking/narrating are *actually* so awful I can't even play this. The script writing is terrible, the sound of their voices is terrible, and it never. stops.
I don't get the hype here and I never will.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030291733', 'num_games_owned': 1000, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1606932174}
review:
I really, really wanted to enjoy this game since it looked promising and felt that way in the tutorial but its missing one seriously crucial thing that makes it unplayable for me: no snapturning for Vive users! I'd happily play this if I had two working trackers but one of them is busted so I only really have one to work with. But what annoys me is snapturning does exist in this game but ONLY for Oculus users....Why? Until the feature is implemented I'm refunding this and hoping they'll add to it. 

So in conclusion to ALL Vive users who have small space and one tracker, avoid this game.



(This review will change if they make this fix)

author: {'steamid': '76561198315432480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2227, 'last_played': 1691020831}
review:
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME, so i have had fun on this game and do really enjoy it but for the past few months i have had no enjoyment out of it,this is because the amount of glitches in the game with robots being alive but stuck in the ground so u can not see them also not robots not dying no matter how many bullets you put in them, also on a few levels u can not place briefcase to pass to the next level i have owned.

 i have written 2 complaint to steam about this issues and ether asked for a new update to sort these issues out or to be refunded as i can no longer play the game cause of the amount of issues both times i have been ignored with no reply which i think is outrageous i have never been ignored about these types of issues before with any other game which suggest the people that made this game could not care less about any fult within the game.

i hope this review will help people make the right decision in not buying this game due to wasting your money on a fulty game that is not cheap

author: {'steamid': '76561198065884036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1560127389}
review:
I have played for about an hour, that might be too little  time for a review, but oh my god, there is little to no gameplay.

 Yes new enemies get introduced, new weapons, and new maps, but its pretty much the same material, robots slowly walk towards you and you can slaughter them to your hearts content, if your trying to play the game seriously, good luck, the game is boring: the ai is terrible, causing enemies to miss you in insane ways, all melee besides the sword (which almost saved the game), is terrible making enemies be able to hit you, when you cant even hit it. Walking mode fixes this issue, but it is still a chore to do, and can be made up with a simple headshot from your pistol.

Multiplayer is non existent due to the replay value, some of the features are buggy or aren't player friendly, such as the holsters for Bishop's pistols, or the shotgun's slide which is so loose you can just move the gun pack with one hand and the slide moves back.

Overall: The combat is easy and boring, the gameplay makes everything feel cheaply made, and the 40$ price isn't worth it.

I would keep the game if it was 5-10$ but for now im refunding it, I would reccomend that you go check out Robo-Recall, its the same premise, without multiplayer, weapons that are all interactable and friendly towards the player, proper melee combat in the forms of punches, and whacks(not to mention doom styled dismemberment) based upon points instead of waves or other scenarios, so its less about beating a level, and more about getting the most score.  Better yet Robo-Recall is free with the oculus, or at least it was when i got it.

developer_response:
Hey Domnu,

Apologies for the crashing issues you're experiencing with the game.


Could you contact us at support@survios.com with your DxDiag attached? We'd be more than happy to help troubleshoot this issue with you.
[list]
    [*]Open a Run window by simultaneously pressing the "Windows" and "R" keys on your keyboard.
    [*]Type "dxdiag" and press "Enter" or click "OK".
    [*]Select the option "Save All Information" which should be near the bottom right of the DirectX Diagnostic window. Select any location for the file but remember where it is for the fourth step and save this file as a Text File (*.txt).
    [*]Attach this Text File to your email.
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198052353402', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 860, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1547144783}
review:
IMHO, the only thing that makes Raw Data a game worth playing is it's melee character - telecinetic cyborg-ninja that is basically just a jedi. I'm still waiting for someone to do a full game around lightsaber swordplay and jedi powers and Raw Data is the closest thing I've found so far.

The rest of the game is kinda mediocre - it is a lot like a Robo Recall but worse in every aspect. 
The missions are probably the weakest part - all campaign levels after the first one are basically the same: defend core against waves of enemies. It is not very exciting to defend something in an action game and especially annoying for solo melee character. Well, at least they are not an escort missions, I guess)

author: {'steamid': '76561198076744941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1645428493}
review:
It's a simple game, but pretty fun. Overall I'd give it a 6/10, maybe 7/10. 

What it is: a wave shooter, with some story and even voice acting. You can gain a few skills/abilities and there are a few characters that you can play, each of which uses a different weapon (I think there are maybe 4-5 characters?). The weapons are all fun to try out. The sword is pretty fun too, but I'm not sure it makes a lot of sense when you're always fighting the same types of mobs that mostly all use ranged weapons. During each level, you fight a few waves of enemies, and you can move around a combat/play area to fight off these waves, and even build turrets to help you out. Overall, it's fun and it's also a bit of exercise, depending on how you play. 

The voice acting is pretty good, but the story itself isn't really that interesting to be honest (it's sort of generic - big evil corporation is doing bad things - let's go spy on them by uploading data on site while shooting waves of enemies) but I think it still adds a little bit of immersion to the game. 

Overall I haven't experienced any bugs in this game, and I can't say the same for all VR games that I have played, so points there. 

If it looks interesting to you, get this when it's on sale. It's fun, but it doesn't really stand out a whole lot either.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981221001', 'num_games_owned': 714, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1546581439}

review:
Graphics + controls aren't good on WMR.

Most Steam games don't advertise WMR so I tend to get them anyways and try them, but some of them are borderline broken or just pretty bad when used on WMR (Cyube VR is a really unfortunate case of this as well... I loved that one on the Oculus)

author: {'steamid': '76561197979982916', 'num_games_owned': 504, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1591418905}

author: {'steamid': '76561198058024438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1103, 'last_played': 1536679651}
review:
As much as I wish to really recommend this game, I feel that S$39.00 (~US$29) is too much for its current state of development as its still a wave shooter cliche in VR. When I used to play Raw Data at a local Singapore VR arcade, it was fun at first until the new updates that introduced rampant bugs that kind of made the game dull after a while.

Yes, while Raw Data is really cool with you being a badass dual pistol wielder or using katanas that make you feel like a Jedi, the game doesn't feel developed enough to warrant its high price. The graphics are pretty good yes, but gameplay wise, its wave of 

Though with that aside, this game kind of got really buggy after the new updates and it seems Survios isn't really fixing it.

Though to be fair, this game still has playability if you wish to host this on a commercial scale (time cafe, VR Arcades, etc) but Raw Data seems to be only be a one in a life time experience sort of thing, until VR becomes mainstream.

Survios, I expected more from you all.

I personally feel that Raw Data should have more, rather than just waves of missions which is kind of a plus from a traditional VR wave shooter. If this game had something like a proper Campaign (instead of waves of mobs in the Single Player), it would really be awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977116241', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1543127870}
review: First off, the game spams you with achievements to prevent you from refunding it which shows how it is bad in itself. The game is just a killfest with bad ai and minimal story. There are only 4 characters and each with a different weapon. Every level is essentially someone saying something about a plot device that dangerous and then you have to iniate the battle by activating a hacking device of some sort. You then fight off robots for a solid 6 minutes and then go to the next round. The only fun I could find in this game at all was the multiplayer mode which is also extremely glitchy because the players will teleport around and the robots will teleport infront of them. The game is just glitchy and does not have nearly enough content to make it fun. The enemies are predictable and are very cliche and this game does not have any sense of originality in it besides the fact that it is one of the first vr games to do this concept. Probably a 4/10 at most.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158424534', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1553357905}
review:
WARNING - DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. EVEN IF IT HAS A LOT OF POSITIVE REVIEWS!

The game is dead, buggy, doesnt feel like a AAA title, and it straight up isnt fun.

The first mission seems ok but on the second mission is were it goes downhill. I had to wait like 2 hours in total for people to join my co op game. And dont get me started on pvp, absolutely NO ONE plays it.

So lets say that no one plays this game making pvp and co op matchmaking nearly impossible,
how about solo?

Nope, this game is meant for multiplayer. Like solo is waaay to hard. The game tried to go for a tower defense route but you only get 2 towers per match, and they barely do anything as after the second mission everything is a bullet sponge. 

Not even the katana is fun! At first it looks cool and you get abilities, but the katana is just striking up and down waiting for a enemy to finally die.

Have I also mentioned how buggy it is? Mission 4 has you [spoiler] trying to defend a data core, but at the same time enemies spawn left far away, and right, even behind you and in the sky! The simple robots are trying to get to a reactor so you have to defend 2 reactors and if they get into 1, a huge bs robot will spawn that you have to put full focus on allowing the other robots to get to the other core and spawn another huge bs robot so that they can all hop on down to the data core and destroy it.Also good luck trying to kill the damn robots as a lot of them dissapear and become invincible after being hit. Especially in the atlas reactor [/spoiler]

Overall dont get this game, you will be waiting 2 hours for a match to join in co op and by the time you are in mission 2-4, you will realize how bad this game is, try to refund but youre over 2 hours so GG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002729192', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1017, 'last_played': 1572374528}
review:
Raw Data is one of my favourite VR games to date, and deserves more recognition than it gets in my opinion. The characters each have a distinct playstyle, the graphics are very polished and the controls mostly feel natural to me - reaching over my shoulder to draw the sword or using my off-hand to reload really helps with the immersion. The storyline provides an interesting backdrop to the shooter but doesn't feel like a main focus. The different difficulty settings kept me coming back and playing more, but I'd love to give the co-op mode a real try if/when friends get into VR.

The only downside for me is that the gameplay lacks depth (the game could be described as a high-end wave shooter), but some of the larger levels do reward you (or require you) to move around smartly and pick targets carefully.

author: {'steamid': '76561198303151311', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1543119842}
review:
The Vive controls are absolutely horrible. Take everything you know about what makes controlling your character in games like Pavlov so easy, and throw it out the window, and what you get is this game. A frustrating mess. The default controls don't get turned off when you choose different ones, and it is bad. Movement with weapons is anything but fun, and teleporting with the shotgun is more of "Where is your gun pointing" instead of what makes other games easy to control of "Where is your controller pointing." 

Though this game does have good things to it, and that is the graphics. They look great. The game is pretty fun when you try to get around the horrendus control scheme the game uses.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971411710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1542755943}
review:
Honestly, I'm on the fence.

PRO:
The production quality is ace. The robots are scary and the main controls work great. Combat is mostly fun.

CON:
The damage starts alright - a shot to the head takes out a robot, while hitting the limbs might take away their arms or legs and they crawl after you. Shortly later you find yourself unloading ammo into bullet sponges taking away any sense of immersion.
Also the weird tower defense bit doesn't seem to work well. The controls for placing, repearing and removing towers are clunky. The towers seems to be quite bad as well.

Probably worth giving it a try now, but once better games enter the market this might change.

author: {'steamid': '76561198337617607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2926, 'last_played': 1597349469}
review: This review is a long time coming because for a while I wanted to see if Raw Data would reach its potential and iron out the bugs which make the game unreliable and affect its playability. Raw Data is a disapointment, not because its a bad game but because the developers have chosen to ignore usability and playability. Usability is very important because it allows players get into a game without jumping over lots of little hurdlers first. For some unknown reason players need to insert an extractor into a slot to start the phase, this action is completely unneccesary and delays or prohibits lets expereinced VR gamers from even getting into a game. Then theres the playability - firstly, the character Bishop had a longstanding flaw where his guns would just disappear after a certain amount of waves - it took literally years to fix this. On some levels bots just wont spawn at all, sometimes the dreaded extractor just wont move no matter what you do to it. Has potential but its a frustrating expereince and its been frustrating a while.

Also whoever made level 6 can off themselves. That level is like sticking a toothpick under your toenail and kicking a wall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079255468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1566501451}
review:
I was astound seeing that recent reviews are 57%. Raw Data has been around for a long time for sure, but we were happy it was out there, when there weren't any of those polishes AAA-games. It was the go to game for a long time and even comparing it today to newer games it still stands out as one of the more polished games. 

So yeah it's a wave shooter, but the best there is. And the developpers are still there to support it after so many years in a niche game genre that VR GAMING still is. Kudos!

author: {'steamid': '76561198822401357', 'num_games_owned': 497, 'num_reviews': 221, 'playtime_forever': 2272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 18, 'playtime_at_review': 1345, 'last_played': 1711768388}
review: Best FPS with actual story available on VR. Gameplay and graphics are the best I have seen on VR. Gameplay, charactors, and background look great. I am running on 2x GTX 1080 Ti in SLI on X299. With this setup it runs great. I imagine you wouldnt have a great time with any lesser of a setup, but I am not sure. If you have the GPU to power this game, buy it!!! I am sorry I didnt buy earlier.

author: {'steamid': '76561198819868626', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1633264698}
review:
this game is really good. it doesn't lag, the fighting feels fluid and it feels fun. whether you play ranged or close quarter style, it is fun to just punch a robot in the face and watch them fly. the only thing i miss in this game is an option that lets you turn insted of having to turn in real life, one of my sensores is busted so i can not turn around without losing tracking. but exept for that i rate this game a 10/10
you will not feel as if you have waisted you money buying this game

author: {'steamid': '76561197986552419', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1669254143}
review: I'm new to VR, played for a couple months and what i like most about this game is it's a great warm up for people like myself that need to get used to the emersion of VR. One of my first games was A-Tech Cybernetic and the first time a zombie like creature came running at me I threw myself into the wall trying to back up! - im not a jump scare kinda guy, i startle easily,  so as bad as i wanna play A-tech i gotta train myself and RAW DATA is a great for that. im really liking the game overall as well. So if you're in the same boat as me and need to get used to VR, the emersion, and how s*%t can literally be all up in your face then i highly recommend this game

author: {'steamid': '76561197970566201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 882, 'last_played': 1609368589}
review:
It's a very well-crafted and polished game that's a lot of fun. However, it's a bit short for the full $39.99 price so I'd wait for a sale. I believe I got it half price and feel like it was a good deal.
Basically, a wave shooter but one of the better ones. There are four characters to play and each has a different weapon. Pistols, bow, katana or shotgun.  And of course, since it's VR the game play is quite a bit different with each character giving the game some replay value. Which is good because it only has 10 levels and three of those are the same level that you play three times. You unlock various skills for each character as you play through which again adds to the game play variety.
When I first started to play it was a bit frustrating as it starts in 'front facing' mode. And in that mode any time you get turned too far from the front it pops up a small window telling you to face the sensors, but it pops it up right on your gun sight (I played pistols first) so it blocks your view as you are trying to defend yourself. Very annoying and a bad choice of where to put the warning. There are also these huge arrows that point to the front that are really distracting too.
Fortunately, in the settings there is a 360 degree tracking option that eliminates those issues but of course you have to have 360 degree tracking. Frankly if I had to play it in front facing mode I probably would have refunded it but fortunately I didn't have to. My only other complaint is that some of the levels are far superior to others and on play through you'll notice that. If every level had the quality game play of levels 7 & 8 then this would be a $40 game. But they don't and as I mentioned you'll actual play the simplest level three times during the campaign so it‚Äôs only 8 distinct levels.
The graphics, sound and game mechanics are all very well done. None of the characters feel like they have an advantage over any of the others even though you have completely different weapons and powers which speaks to some pretty good game play balance. I haven't tried to play coop but there always seemed to be plenty of people to play with in the lobby so it's fairly popular.
So fun game but a bit short for $40 so wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977803559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1539038173}
review: What about 360 degree support? Every time I turn around I keep getting this indicator that keeps telling me to turn physically turn around. How do I turn it off so that I can turn freely?
developer_response:
Hey wlopez,

There should be an option under the Preference tab called "Show Playspace". If you uncheck this box, the assist arrows should disappear for you.

Please let us know if the indicator arrows are still appearing for you with this option turned off!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076586806', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1577391419}
review:
Don't buy it full price, not worth it. it's a repetative and boring wave-based tower defense game. The enemies are either uninteresting fodder or just annoying bullet-sponges. The towers/turrets are just as dull, they lack any upgrade system and are not new or creative in design. They just sit there and gently pick away at the cannon fodder enemies whilst being boring and unsatisfying. With the way this game's actual shooting/slashing and movement mechanics worked, this would've been one of the best action-shooters VR has to date, so it's unfortunate that this VR title decided to pull back to being a lackluster tower-defense.

The voice acting was great too, it's too bad it was either interupted or cut short by 'WAVE 3 COMMENCING, TAKE COVER' or some other waste of air vibrations throughout the game. I found myself constantly waiting in between waves for the exposition to end just so i wouldn't miss it, knowing it's the only chance i'll get to here it. The only other way you hear the dialogue is in the lobby, too bad you are just watching two still faces on a blue screen talk. I felt like a toddler just waiting beside their mother as she had a 45 minute long conversation with another grocery store mom. but I had to wait it because there is no other time I hear it.

PS: The hallucinogenic garden level should've been what the entire game looked like. More of that next time devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043489516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1622362786}
review:
Makes me look like a skilled Jedi in front of my friends. 10/10 Would reccommend. 

Definitely pick it up if it's on sale. At full price I'm not sure I would consider it. 

The game is a arena survival mission style of game, with a fairly interesting story, that is quite fun, but only if you have a class that you like. Fortunately there are four to choose from, each with their own unique abilites and weapon. I can't quite remember the exact names, but I will attempt to describe them as best I can. 

The Jedi(try to tell me it's not) is super fun for a melee class. Your light saber functions as both a short and long range weapon(you can throw it like a boomarang). The throw is kind of difficult to figure out, but is generally useful if you can get the angle correct. You also get some neat telekinectic powers to throw enemies around with. One more thing, the laser katana deflects any projectile as well as blocks beam weapons. 

The archer is basically that, only with some different arrow types. Fairly straight forward. I enjoyed it for the most part, just kind of tired of archery in VR to be honest.

The pistol class is kind of neat in that you basically have the balistic version of the plasma pistol. It has a charge shot as well as an auto fire ability. It's manual reload, that's kind of difficult to perform mid-fight. The magazine doesn't always line up correctly and needs a little bit of practice to do efficiently. 

Lastly, is a kind of brusier class with a shotgun. Frankly it tires my off arm out as you have to cock the weapon before fireing. Luckily no reload mechanic. You also get some mini laser spike knuckles to decimate foes with. Which I definitely thought was neat... If I could reach the enemies. You can punch with any of the classes, but you need to be quite close. They also have a much longer reach than you and can complicate gauging the distance between you and the enemy. 

There is quit a bit more to the classes at you progress and gain more abilties, but I will let you discover those for yourself.

Overall the game is simple, kill the enemy while defending the data core. You also have the option of installing turrets onto the battle-field as well as having friends or randoms with you. 

Graphics wise, this is one of the few VR games that I've played that has minimal issues with blurriness. Everything looks very good from a distance and all the text is legible. This makes me happy. I'm using the original HTC Vive. 

There's nothing particularly glitchy per se about the game, it's just needs a few tweaks to some of the abilites. 

Probably my favorite game on VR thus far.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970489454', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1545155450}
review:
Normaly i am not realy impressed by wave shooter games, but RAW DATA has got me playing 2 hours non stop.
The grapisch are great and the gameplay is immersive and the weapons react very good, it feels very naturtal.
did not expirience motion sicknes so i would recommend this game if you are looking for some good VR fun to escape reality for moment :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197972378114', 'num_games_owned': 774, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1638504552}
review:
at the time of this writing, i'm still only a month into VR, but i've played tons of amazing games.  Raw data feels very clunky compared to just about every other title i've tried.  the pistol is fun, but the rest of the weapons are painful to use.  firing the shotgun for example requires a reload after each shell... this feels great in games like pavlov VR but in raw data, it was very inconsistent.  The blade and bow were the worst in any VR game i've played... so sad

For the price, Raw data just isn't worth it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198137450623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1534720252}
review:
Well, I feel really torn up about this game. You'll notice overall it has very positive reviews, but lately it's fallen off hard.
It's not that the game changed, in fact the reason for the negativity is that it hasn't changed.
When VR first came out, and in fact even a year ago when I bought my headset and immediately purchased this game, Raw Data was one of the best games on the market at the time. A very polished wave shooter, with multiplayer as well.
Now however, the game is nothing new. In comparison to the new titles that have come out, and the price of the new titles, $40 does not justify this game at all. Buy it on sale maybe, otherwise not at all.
I've only played 9 hours, and that's because I played it until it was fun, then didn't play it anymore. Mulitplayer is dead, so don't count on that.
I really did like this game when it first was big. I just can't recommend it now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993059159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1537728735}

Apologies again for these bugs ruining your experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025866376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1644099104}
review:
From the first few minutes I can play the game, it's awesome. A lot of intensity to it when you're getting into the first round with Eden. 

UPDATE: This is not for the feint of heart, or if your GFX card is low end. Below were my original issues on an AMD Raedon R9 390 using the default graphics settings. I changed the two "mid" settings to low, the physics engine from "Epic" to "medium" and the multiplier to 0.9x. Any number of these might have done the trick but it allowed me to finally complete the first mission -- an incredibly heart-pounding shoot-out from all directions. If this is indicative of the rest of the game, I highly recommend it!

I do see some people are upset with some headtracking bugs... all I can share is my feedback with respect to their support: they have been responding quickly. I had already included an export of my DirectX logs and they jumped right into some suggestions, including the one above which fixed it.

-- Original Review ------ (left here in case your situation is the same)

Here's my issue - when I'm starting the actual campaign, inevitably my headset blacks out and crashes for a moment. When it comes back I've lost sound to the headset plus whatever valuable time I had while in combat. The only way to fix is to do a full reboot which means it takes me a good 5-6 minutes to get right back to where I was only to have it happen again. 

Really disappointed I can't experience more of it :/

review:

If it wasn't just a bunch of tower defense missions this game would be pretty good, but the fact that it's tower defense (which gets boring after the third mission) and only has average gameplay is the reason I'm giving this game a no.
