author: {'steamid': '76561198070874899', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1531533784}
review: Game doesn't feel like it has enough content in it to be worth 50ish dollars to me. The whole wave shooter thing is fine but it's not worth the money to me at least.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186799667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1070, 'last_played': 1675729989}
review: Great game! Lots of fun that you can drop into quickly or spend some time at. Raw Data is the closest thing to a AAA title you are likely to find for Vive at this time. Variety of powers and weapons including swords, guns and bow and arrow. Levelling up to unlock weapons abilities is fun and rewarding as it really helps against the robots. Great futuristic atmosphere, some fo the voice acting gets a little irritating but can be muted. Otherwise sound effects are great/solid.  Enemies are well made and solid, fun to blast/slash. This is a title I keep coming back to. Always feels solid.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971133121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1531791766}
review:
I have a Rift, I'm not sure if it's just my setup, or the Rift, or what.  This game doesn't work well for me.  None of the other games I've played have had so many tracking issues.  Additionally I ran into a bug with a floor crawling robot that was 100% immortal and my mission never ended.  

Robo Recall is WAY better.  It's also free. Like, I would have paid money for Robo Recall, that game is amazing.  I'm extremely unimpressed with Raw Data.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970982479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1531393310}
review:
A solid VR wave shooter. While each class only has 1 weapon the range of abilities associated with the weapon work very well with VR controls and are varied enough. I found this sytem preferable to having numerous weapons in other VR wave shooters.

The second level is terrible and I think a cause of many negative reviews. After it the game becomes more balanced and lighted. Only played it coop, might be a bit hectic for singleplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972266460', 'num_games_owned': 1201, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1569360616}
review:
Simple but fun, Raw Data is an easy to recommend title. It is a wave based defense game where you pick one of four classes, and accomplish various tasks while defending your "Core" from the enemy.

It's a simple game, but its well made and fun. I had a great time with it and it makes great use of VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213379373', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 1358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1571316415}

author: {'steamid': '76561198019309352', 'num_games_owned': 608, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1595668672}
review:
This was one of my first vr purchases and i found it to be a great introduction to vr for me and when introducing to friends as it makes use of first person shooting which vr is made for plus I haven't known anyone to experience sickness after playing, it also starts with a great scene when you go down to your first level which I will not spoil.
I enjoyed this game throughout. Completed it and still go back to it now and then. There are better shooters out their but not many in my experience so I would definitely say this is worth adding to your collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142819669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1078, 'last_played': 1500581580}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068226938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1511402187}
review:
Raw Data was the first full-scale game I played in VR. I bought it on recommendation from a list of the best VR games available. 

In terms of gameplay and utilization of VR functions, I would have to agree that it's first rate. The immersion is essentially total, the combat is visceral and satisfying and the graphics are as good as one could hope for. 

That said, the storyline is almost insulting banal and the wave-based defensive gameplay does tend to wear thin (as well as requiring more physical space than is indicated, which became more than a nuisance at times as I was forced to physically back up and retreat from my enemies, though this is only based on my experience in my room, which is admittedly barely big enough to support VR to begin with). The dialogue and characters are nothing but a detraction and feel as if they were computer generated based on stock characters from some of the more stilted TV sitcoms. 

Overall, the gameplay itself overwhelms any other considerations and I can recommend it with the above caveats.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056102908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1559588342}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972587327', 'num_games_owned': 725, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1601114813}
review: Not sure why this is getting negative reviews. Easily one of the best VR experiences out. The shooting, movement, and the co-op is pretty damn fun. I'm only new to VR, but after trying The Lab, Rick and Morty, Project Cars, Rec Room, The Golf Club VR, The Forest VR and mucking around in Steam VR environments, this has easily been the most fun experience yet. Ignore the haters.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975817124', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1587908116}
review: Limited amount of weapons, too dark with things jumping at you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977679902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1527633315}
review:
The production values are high, but the experience is not worth $40.  It's basically a wave shooter.  4 weapon type loadouts (attached to specific characters) and you teleport around a very small level killing robots until they tell you to stop.

But, honestly, the real crime is that despite how simple the gameplay is, this game will talk your damn ear off in unskippable dialog.  Whoever wrote it is clearly in love with their own writing, but it's not very good.  It's supposed to be "funny", but it's not even informative.  It's just filler, which is a sin in VR.  If  I wanted to wear a heavy hat and listen to banal conversation... well, I'm sure I can think of something better than putting on my Vive and playing this.

The game sure is pretty though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001807994', 'num_games_owned': 478, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1531959512}
review:
So i'm going to say this is an AMAZING wave shooter. simply amazing. However. This can't hold a candle to killing floor, and at $40 bucks this is a bad comparison. 
This is, more or less, killing floor with robots, with 4 specialized characters, and simplistic maps.
I am not going to say this isn't fun, but i'm on mission 4 and Probably about 10-20 hours tops i'll play this game and have fun, and then it will sit on my hard drive. This is wave shooting and meh enviroments and cute dialogue. there is co op and pvp, so maybe that will break up the monotony a tad, but we'll have to see.

I am very, very reluctantly going to recommend this for the price. this game, honestly, should be about $20 bucks for what i'm seeing. I will update this review as I play more, but i recommend looking for discounts off steam to buy this.

edit: much more fun in co-op. still have to try PVP. i'm on mission 5 of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050439403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1613354896}
review: This game pushes the limits of VR and delivers one of the first true AAA feeling experiences. I am immensely proud of the team involved and applaud their effort. I love this game. It has great graphics and the gameplay is solid. The abilities really make this game legendary as well. I cannot recommend this title enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071052682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1555391528}
review:
This game is so much freaking fun to play. 39.99 seems a bit high though tbh, since it is a wave shooter but seriously everything in this game is very well polished. Would definitely recommend. 

Basically the game is you pick one of 4 classes, you then go into an environment where you shoot wave after wave while running around trying not to get jump scared by terrifying robots. It also has a little bit of tower defense in it as you can built turrets etc. Very fun to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071806867', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1545505184}
review:
[h1] Take this with a grain of salt as i only have 4 hours experience with this game as of writing this. [/h1]

This game is facking amazing;
[list]
    [*]Amazing characters with great abilities.
    [*]Great maps.
    [*]Good variation in enemies.
    [*]Interesting story.
    [*]Very immersive. (Gets kinda creepy sometimes. In a good way tho}.
[/list]
2 bad things about the game;
[list]
    [*]In some levels (like level 4) you need to defend 3 things. Usually enemies only spawn at 1 of the 3, but it still gets pretty 
    frustrating.
    [*]The bow is very hard to use because you need to pull back very far. Could just be that i have very short arms tho.
[/list]

[b] My opinion on the classes: [/b]
Bishop (Pistol}: Great abilities and a nice primary weapon. reloading is at the beginning very easy and gets even easier when you play a few levels as him. Can't really think of anything bad about him.

Boss (Shotgun): Cool idea and nice execution. Good primary weapon. Easy to use with 1 and 2 hands. My  left hand (Hand to reload) when using 2 hands does get tired pretty quickly, but that could just be me not having an active life.

Saija (Sword): Facking awesome. Great abilities. His sword is a 1 shot on normal enemies. What i can say tho is that taking out drones is a facking pain in the ass. Especially if you dont have the telekenisis ability yet. Other then that he is really good. He can take out enemies with a large healthpool very quickly aswell. And he just makes me feel like a facking badass.

Elder (Bow): Can't say a lot about him, because i dont play him at all. He is like i said annoying to use for me. His bow is pretty good but hard to use. I dont understand his first ability at all.



[Table]
    [tr]
        [th]Class[/th]      [th]Rating[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [th]Bishop[/th]    [th]9/10[/th]
    [/tr]

author: {'steamid': '76561198349758010', 'num_games_owned': 24, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1666539282}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009618255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1524267139}
review:
Just a lot of really small issues piling up to make this a really disappointing experience for me.

Pistol doesn't move to left handed holster for left handed players, so reloading is too much of a pain to even bother with this class.

Shotgun is buggy to hipfire, and feels akward to try aiming down it's ironsights. It feels like my arms aren't long enough to comfortably reload and most of the time it jiggles all over the place when I do, as I simply can't move my arm back and forward in a straight line. So every time I reload I have to aim again.

Sword is nice, boomerang is fun.

Whenever I have the walking option on I'm almost constantly slowly moving in some direction. The only game where this is an issue.

I have the game on the lowest possible settings and I'm still stuttering in some instances. Mostly when I hit a robot and they freak out and ragdoll inside of walls.

This is not constructive criticism. The games been out long enough to where these problems should have been brought up already by people that aren't me. This is just me venting my disapointment.

Took me about 20 minuts to start the game up my second play as it black screened on startup twice. Why 20 minutes though? Because starting the game up to the main menu takes about 7 minutes, by far the longest load times I've seen for any game recently, vr or not.

Tried the bow out, and yeah I guess my arms are just too short. Stretching my left arm out as far as it could go allows me the ability to just barely try and aim this thing down its sights. Same problem as the shotgun. Hipfiring it just as wonky and unfun as trying to aim down the sights.

Bit the bullet and decided to just use my right hand for Pistol. It was fun. I actually thought about just sticking around for Sword and Pistol class. But then I thought, Is this game that only has two weapons for me to use more or less fun than Sairento? It's less.
developer_response:
Hey BB,

Apologies for all of these issues affecting your Raw Data experience.

We've seen the feedback you left on our forums and appreciate you taking the time to share your thoughts.

We're investigating some of the bugs you brought up, such as the pistol not swapping holsters.

Sorry again for the negative experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023207225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1523731391}
review: Awesome game.. totally blew me away.... action packed and the multiplayer is amazing

author: {'steamid': '76561198025611643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1523379035}
review:
So I couldn't even get into a game because the tutorial/hub area was so uncomfortable. Teleporting required me to bend my wrist at a high angle or hold my arm up high and walking still made me stop too far away to melee anything. Even when I was in range to melee, there was zero feedback I was doing any damage until the robot just fell on the ground.

Gunplay was ok. The pistol being the easiest to use and the shotgun being the hardest due to the reloading mechanic. The sword suffered from the same range issues as punching and the bow has pretty much been established in VR.

I bought in before I really understood what I was going to get with this game and I'm glad I found out early that I wouldn't like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973187370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1551493458}
review: Not sure why it took me so long to get this.  It's my favorite Vive game!  Everything from the Immersion, movement, and game play are right on.  And the co-op works great, I've never had an issue loading up a game with a friend.  This blows away games like Fallout or Doom.  Do yourself a favor and pick this up if you were like me and hesitated buying it, you won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046498525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1523017418}
review:
This is a game that I really, really wanted to like, but I went in expecting more action and less tower defense. Watching 
 some meager gameplay of it got me really excited, and I thought it looked amazing, but in practice it is only an alright, if well polished, tower defense shooter. It reminds me generally of my experience with the long defunct Sanctum. The initial concept is interesting, and it feels polished, but after a short time playing it became clear to me that I wasn't going to get much out of it. For some, I'm sure this will be a blast, but I even found the ninja underwhelming. The sword didn't really feel like it had any reach, and the two handed function felt awkward though it looks awesome from an outside perspective.

Unfortunately, I also got the sense that the levels were very small. The area you actually have to/will normally traverse is minimal, especially since the maintainence of turrets is a hassle if they are spread all around far from the tower.

Overall, if you've ever played Sanctum, and you got hours and hours out of it, I think you'll think this is a solid game, and perhaps you'll even get your money's worth, though it's severely lacking in the scale that Sanctum had, map wise, and the movement isn't nearly as dynamic and fluid. Given the price tag, I simply cannot recommend this game.

A suggestion for the developers though, perhaps. I can't confirm that this would help at all, but I HIGHLY SUGGEST varying the first two levels of the campaign, so that they're not cookie cutter with different lighting. That very much set the tone for the game in my mind. Variation might just be the key, but I realize the game is already released and major changes like this are unlikely at this point.

review:
One of the few multiplayer games you and a friend can load into and play in VR. Arizona Sunshine and Payday VR are similar types of shooter games that you can play with friends.

This is one of those games where you can practice your headshot aim with much joy :)

It can get stressful at times if you are playing by yourself as an adult ... so not recommended for kids!

There's a couple of times when the lights go out, and it gets frightneing and tense as the enemies are coming at you from god knows where. Be careful about letting kids play this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028183041', 'num_games_owned': 565, 'num_reviews': 376, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1553632197}
review:
Wenn schon Wave-Shooter, dann bitte so!
(Getestet mit der HTC Vive)
In Raw Data infiltrieren wir den Konzern Eden Corp, um Datenpakete zu stehlen. Dazu stehen uns 4 verschiedene Klassen zur Auswahl, wir k√∂nnen entweder mit Pistolen, Schrotflinte, Schwertern oder Bogen in den Kampf ziehen.
Nach einem ausf√ºhrlichen Tutorial geht es auch schon los. Wir schlagen entweder alleine oder im Coop Wellen von Robotern zur√ºck. Das f√§ngt an bei stupiden L√§ufern, die im Nahkampf auf uns einpr√ºgeln, und geht √ºber Flugdrohnen bis hin zu raketenfeuernden Riesenmechs.
Zus√§tzlich k√∂nnen wir unseren Charakter durch Stufenaufstieg mit Spezialf√§higkeiten ausr√ºsten, ob nun Bullet-time beim Pistolensch√ºtzen oder spezielle Pfeile f√ºr den Bogen, m√§chtige Schwertattacken und und und...
Auf den verschiedenen Karten k√∂nnen wir uns frei bewegen. Dazu k√∂nnen wir uns zwischen Teleportation und fl√ºssiger Bewegung entscheiden, beides funktioniert sehr gut.
Das Waffenhandling finde ich pers√∂nlich auch sehr gelungen, Zielen klappt ausgezeichnet, das Ausl√∂sen der Spezialf√§higkeiten geht ebenfalls gut von der Hand.
Die Grafik sieht ebenfalls sehr gut aus und das Spiel lief auch mit einer GTX 970 noch durchaus Spielbar. (Mit 1080 ti hat man mehr Weitsicht)
Lediglich im Koop traten gelegentlich Grafikfehler beim Schwertk√§mpfer auf (Endlos lange Gummiarme, wenn sie das Schwert wirft), vielleicht wurde es aber auch schon behoben. Au√üerdem ist es vorgekommen, dass ich im Koop durch den Fahrstuhl gefallen bin. Nicht weiter tragisch, aber auch nicht unbedingt n√∂tig ;)
Den PvP-Modus fand ich eher nicht so gelungen, es kam einfach keine rechte Spielfreude auf, aber das ist sicher Geschmackssache.
F√ºr mich in dem Genre auf jeden Fall eines der besten Spiele, auch wenn es auf den ersten Blick f√ºr einen Waveshooter nat√ºrlich sehr teuer ist.

Gru√ü Ziffi
Ziffi¬¥s Spieletipps als Kurator: http://store.steampowered.com/curator/5837414/

author: {'steamid': '76561197995761970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1523, 'last_played': 1582393896}
review:
What can I say...

Did you even want to be Neo from the Matrix ? Or the Terminator ?  Or a Jedi ?  Or maybe the Green Arrow ?

Well, with Bishop, Boss, Saija and Elder, now you can kinda "jack in".

The learning curve is smooth, and getting new abilities on characters is a must to make it easier in the later stages.

Playing in coop is really fun and simple.  A few bugs here and there (but nothing game breaking thankfully).

I hope they expand the game a bit to add more diversity to the first few stages of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273279129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1537229016}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041117535', 'num_games_owned': 2047, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1518763237}
review:
I don't mean that Raw Data is a bad game. I just don't recommend it.
The game is okay, but I don't think it justifies its $40 dollar price tag, and this is for two reasons.

The first reason isn't that bad, but is worth mentioning: the game is, at its core, a wave shooter. This means a lot of reused content - the first level and the second are the same except for lighting and enemy spawns, each level is just waves of enemies walking at you, etc

The second is the reason I refunded the game just now: enemies take WAY too many hits. If I run up to a dude with a shotgun and shoot as quickly as I can, the harder enemies take FOREVER to die, and the weaker ones take more hits than they should. The swords can take more than one slash, and that's if they collide properly at all. The pistols sound like they're toys, and they hit like it too. The bow is /super/ fun initially, but one-shotting everybody turns out to be lame too.

If there was a way to make the game spawn way more enemies but have them all die in just a few hits, then I would think this game was fantastic, but as it stands, it's super bland.

I bought this game because I wanted more Robo Recall.
I realize now that I should have just booted up Robo Recall for that.
Would highly recommend were it $9, but not $30-40.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333553306', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1600647326}
review:
(HTC Vive Review) Literally the coolest VR game I have played yet. As cool as FO4 and Superhot and other sweet games were, Raw Data has been my favorite so far. Picture iRobot for VR.
Pros:
-Very Intense
-Very fast-paced
-Relatively easy controls
-Different characters you can play as
-That feeling when you turn around and you try and quickly try to dive across the room to get out of the way of a robot jumping towards your face
-Nice range of difficulty settings
-Teleporting and Walking Locomotion, take your pick
-Great graphics

Cons:
-Uh... intro can be confusing I guess, if you were too busy looking around to listen to the instructions?
-If you are a chicken, this might be too much to handle, but you will still enjoy shooting down waves of evil robots.
-Buy it, you won't regret it

author: {'steamid': '76561198036514832', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1516920405}
review:
This game is easily one of the best available for VR at the moment. 

It is broken down into four classes, I cannot say much about the others as I have been living out my life as a Jedi/Ninja with the sowrdsman. 

It is so deeply immersive and fun that you lose track of time easily. Flinging virtual swords and reflecting bullets whilsts force pushing robots off of ledges has never been more fun. 

The gameplay is difficult yet not impossible, its a fun and rewarding challenge and I wholeheartedly recomend this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064549326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1535304745}
review:
One of the standout VR releases on the market. Great controls, and the upgrades and skills available to you as you progress are really fun to execute. If you want a game to shoot robots or slice em with an energy blade, this is the game for you. Just don't mind the generic story fluff thats also packed in there, but it can be mostly ignored.

The multiplayer integration is also great and it's even more fun to play it with someone else.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990603939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1600011903}
review:
Well holy hell from its very beginning, Raw Data has expanded and excelled as one of the top VR games out there since the start! 
My buddy and I got straight into some Gameplay if you fancy seeing very NOT professional gamers haha
https://youtu.be/5ZI8wr6Pvgo

Each class feels unique, and tailored and you do find yourself drawn to a specific character as you work out your play style. Sure running around like a jedi/cyborg/ninja was cool, but for me the pull to the Equilibirum styled Cleric was great! 
The comfort value and tracking as well as movement means absolutely no nausea in this at any point and the general 'feel' of shooting is perfect, there was clearly some serious work put into the tracking! 

Final thing, not everyone thinks about but it can make or break a game; sound! The effects, background music and pacing make an epic concoction! The music is fantastic and fits the cybernetic dystopian theme of fast paced action well. every sound effect from arrows to exploding robots is also wicked! 

so yeah, I like this. I thin k you will like this too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970587998', 'num_games_owned': 1067, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1609954266}

author: {'steamid': '76561198055744458', 'num_games_owned': 1589, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1555736494}
review:
This is kind of like a FPS tower defense game in away. Game is very simple you jump into a mission and you have to protect your hacking core while it hacks into some thing by killing every thing that comes your way. You have four classes to pick from that specialize in a weapon and you level up and can unlock abilities. Its not very long around 3-4 hours to beat. with replay value in playing through as a differnt class, You can also put turrets down to help defend your core. There is a story to it but honostly i didnt think it was any thing that great and i dont even remember it.

Graphically it looks very nice . it runs very smooth, and controls are good. Lots of control options like smooth turning and free locomotion thankfully. Though i did find the Teleportation movement nice in getting out of a hot spot. so i found myself using both. Its a good game but $40 is a bit on the high side for what you all get. It would be nice if the missions were more varied and just more of them. For $20-$25 worth a pick up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198436919163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1516242219}
review: Not worth the price tag. That's the main complaint. It's simply a horde game. Weapon system is pretty decent though. Multiplayer could be better if there were more players on their servers. All in all, it's not a bad game. I expected more because of the trailer but it simply doesn't live up to the hype and the $40 pt is ultimately the reason I got a refund.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083989189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1513903409}
review:
Bought it a month back and could not successfully launch the game.
Spent a day applying any workaround I could find on forums and their FAQ (update to Windows 10, disabling Nvidia Surround, etc.)
All bug reports seems to be the same - someone can't launch the game -> applied some workaround -> support glad they don't have to do anything and then recommend the same workaround to other players.

Well, none of workarounds helped me and support still asks me to see if any software conflicts with their game.
Guys, any other game works fine for me!!! I'm very casual gamer who doesn't use any overclocking or any other gaming software aside from steam. I don't even have antivirus, because I use Windows only for steam gaming.
If you can't find the reason why your game crashes - add some logging, troubleshooting options, whatever. Do something, stop asking your users to apply workarounds!

It's sad that steam can't refund my wasted time.
developer_response:
Hey Vit,

Apologies again for this launching issue you're experiencing with Raw Data. We completely understand how frustrating this situation is for you. We'll reach out to you through your ticket and troubleshoot to hopefully resolve this issue!

review: If you like standing in a limited space and shooting wave after wave then this is the game for you. However if you dont like that, its very borning. The game is very polished though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129903896', 'num_games_owned': 382, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1476478910}
review:
I can't buy this because oculus store says it *requires* windows 10.
Which it actually doesn't. So you lost a sale.
I'm on windows 7 and have no intention of upgrading to windows 10.
Good luck!
developer_response:
Hey corporatezombie,

We're aware of this restriction Oculus has in place and have been working with them to change this. Apologies for this inconvenience.

While we do recommend Windows 10 as your OS for Raw Data, a good amount of our Steam players have been able to successfully play on Windows 7. Also, the Steam version does features Oculus SDK, so you should have the same experience if you purchased Raw Data through this platform. 

Sorry again for this inconvenience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997692176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1514739803}
review: It's a wave shooter overall, but the graphics and mechanics are quite polished and the gameplay is really satisfying. The enemy robots are terrifying and I really enjoy smashing them with my [strike]lightsaber[/strike] lightblade, my shotgun, or my fists when they get too close. I really like the world and environment that they set up in this game. I'm still not through with this game, but so far I like it. The experience overall is very immersive.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975441883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1136, 'last_played': 1568226891}
review:
One of the best VR games to date. It has the feel for the aiming just right and a lot of locomotion options. There is also a lot a  of variaty in terms of playstyle between the different classes. The game performs well on my PC  since the last patch (i76700k/GTX 1070 OC @2000mhz/ 16GB ram). It used to lack in this regard but they got it fixed.

And last but not least this game has hands down the prettiest graphics I experienced in  VR so far. BUY IT! Servious is a VR exclusive developer. Give them your support! They need it to make other great VR games in the future!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011962570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2305, 'last_played': 1632666075}
review:
Alright, you can possibly here because of 2 reasons: 

1, wondering if you should buy a Vive or Oculus
In this case, please try them out somewhere and if you like them go buy one. If you like them after first try then there is a 99% chance that you will love it more after you get used to the controls and the technology itself. So proceed to 2.

2, You got a VR system and wondering if you should buy this game.
If you invested in a VR system then it is a no-brainer decision. Really. do not read further, click Add to Cart.
Why are you still here? ehh, then the actual review follows:
It is an excellent experience in VR, simple, but very entertaining. Good storyline, good immersion, several different characters (4) with different unlockable skills. There is a supercool Co-Op mode, and even a PVP (quite few players though yet, but it is general problem for VR games). There are a few "bugs" or - let's say - areas for improvement.
30 hours of unconditional fun guaranteed. I just finished collecting all achievements.

Absolutely recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197979740638', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1514756316}
review: Ultimately this is just a wave shooter, in a room, with some guns. There's a ton of them on Steam right now, and I don't think Raw Data is worth the $31.99 on sale price tag that it is right now. The experience ultimately is one you can find on Steam for much cheaper, maybe pick this up when it hits $15.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987827305', 'num_games_owned': 910, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1510173184}
review:
A snippet of the review I wrote for Pocket-lint.com:

"The premise for Raw Data feels heavily inspired by the works of Isaac Asimov and essentially puts you in the shoes of Will Smith in iRobot. The mission is to uncover the secrets plaguing Eden Corp, but in order to do so you'll have to fight for your life against an onslaught of mechanical men intent on ending your existence. 

Raw Data has an enthralling sci-fi vibe. We love the futuristic setting - the built-up skyline out of the corporation windows, the mechanical men in various shapes and sizes, the talkative AI who's tagged along for the ride - which creates an atmosphere that gels perfectly with the story.

Most of the campaign levels take place on the various floors of the Eden Corp building as you make your way from lab to lab, trying to extract data from the systems to reveal what the company is up to.

This is where it becomes clear that Raw Data is a wave-shooter/tower-defence game at its core. Dropping into the first level, you insert a device to extract the data, then the alarm bells start ringing and the robots come baying for blood.

We love the introduction to the game, where a crazed bot smashes head-first through a glass panel in order to get at you - a scene we can't help but think we've seen before...

Overall, Raw Data is much like a lot of things we've seen before. It's another wave-based shooter with a few mildly interesting mechanics. It doesn't do much that other VR games haven't already cracked.

The design of Raw Data does have a lot going for it though. The graphics are impressive, the mild-RPG elements are engaging, the ability to play with friends online is a welcome addition, tracking is accurate, movement problem-free, and the gunplay works really well.

However, we did feel a bit frustrated with not being able to get access to more weaponry or upgrades, while many levels feel too similar in their tactic.

With around four or five hours of gameplay in the main campaign there's not a huge amount of content, but with access to co-op modes and player-versus-player - with cross-platform player support, which is a rare and welcome feature - you're bound to be able to get your money's worth. "

https://www.pocket-lint.com/ar-vr/reviews/142744-raw-data-review-the-robot-uprising-is-coming

author: {'steamid': '76561198031541959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1242, 'last_played': 1531464640}
review: Raw Data is about the 15th VR game I have played, and the first one that, in my humble opinion, offers the complete VR gaming experience. The wave shooting format feels right at home in VR, giving the player time to rest and find his/her bearing within the living room. All four weapons are fun to play with in different ways offering much replayability. The unlockable skills give a sense of progress. The stages are well designed and exciting. The story is interesting and even manages to explain away the teleportation locomotion not as a technicalworkaround of VR gaming but as a sci-fi story element. Five stars.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993372438', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1706500848}
review: This is what Triple-A VR game should be like. It has a great use of roomscale, great action that complements the VR experience, and a great story with lots of lore to explore. If you're tired of VR wrapped console ports, but you want that expansive experience, try this game out. The hand models/animation blew me away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062027460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1675034270}
review: This is the first game I have gotten for VR that I did not have to tweak the hell out of to make playable on my rift. The default settings are absolutely spot on. The story is very basic, and there is not a lot of customization if thats the crap you are into. gameplay is very similar to another shooter recently released on rift, you can teleport, have to physically reload and whatnot, but the beauty of it is in that it is fun. every level is a slightly different challenge. But it is optimized also, unlike a game i recently paid 60 dollars for(fallout4 vr). I am a huge fan of the fun of vr shooting, and this is one of the few vr shooters with melee mechanics of some sort. graphics 10/10 gameplay/controls 9/10, mostly because reloading my pistol hits the menu button every other time for me, sound 10/10, fun 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197960498075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1514201464}
review:
This is full-featured wave shooter with an exceptional campaign. However, I don't think it's polished enough for a 30 euro price tag. At 20 euros, I could recommend it. 

I didn't test the multiplayer features. Maybe those justify the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968323605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1514318324}
review: This is one of the more enjoyable VR games. Highly recommended. It is a wave shooter but it isn't of the stand in one place variety. Levels require movement and several of them have unique mechanics which keep things interesting. The second half of the levels are particularly enjoyable. Unlocking abilities as the game progresses adds variety while the 4 selectable heroes are significantly different from each other to allow for different play styles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198406565721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1609731073}
review: LOVE THIS GAME.  It's fast paced and exciting and will keep you on your toes.  Want a work out in VR? This game will have your blood pumping fast.  Stunning visuals, fun game play, good controls, there's even a cute story line.

review: Getting used to the controls for my sword guy was difficult, but that's okay. It's a rewarding game. It is a wave shooter that allows you to move around the entire map, and that creates a desire to play with more people, which is a good thing. It is fun and I recommend anyone this game who essentially wants a small scale Borderlands in VR.

review: I quite enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030281248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1581216543}
review: Raw Data is a MUST BUY if you have a vive. This game is everything VR games should be. It has so much polish and content. And it feels so good to play. Definitely worth the price tag. I doubt anyone would be dissapointed with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961635953', 'num_games_owned': 1093, 'num_reviews': 230, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1586672407}
review:
Some of the best controls I've ever seen in a VR game and for something as fast paced as this, it's a Godsend.  Wield duel pistols, a laser sword, shotgun or bow and take out droves and droves of robots. It's a shame the game is often little more than a wave based shooter, save for a couple of missions that actually have a sense of progression through an environment.

Still, there's few games with mechanics as tight as this and it's amazing how little time it takes to become quite adept with any of the classes and kick some serious metal ass. My favorite is the bow wielding hunter, with his charged up arrows and AOE abilities.

But if you're looking for a deep story, this ain't the game for you. Raw Data's narrative is often delivered during missions in the form of a voiceover, when you're too busy taking on the neverending onslaught of enemies to truly pay attention. Later missions just keep throwing the tougher enemy types at you to ramp the difficulty, but there's no noticeable punishment for death, outside of a 5 or so second respawn time which affects your end level score.

Certain classes only become fun once you've unlocked certain abilities, duel wielding for the Cleric as an example, so the initial enjoyment factor can be quite slow.

All in all, money well spent though if you're after a cool looking and playing VR game to show off to your friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964003991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1513634963}
review:
I have been on the fence for this game for some time and finally picked it up on sale. 

First impressions were very underwhelming. There were many technical issues that came up that shows this game is still unpolished; crashing, jitters, games deadlocking, player interactions invalidating the tutorial. It was a mess to start. Luckily, my friend and I kept pushing each other to keep trying it a little more. If it wasn't for the co-op factor we would have both dropped this game like a bad habbit. 

It wasn't until the 5th co-op game we play that we really got excited. By this time we tried all of the different classes and progressed the primary to duel wield. If I had to do it over again, I would level up the pistol guy to duel weild first. You get a couple of other perks that improve the gameplay tremendeiously; in fact, its such an improvment it seems like it should have been the default abilities. 

The game itself has very polished graphics, but that seems to be were the spent most of their time polishing. THe enemies you fight tend not to feel very engaging or aware of your presence. To many times I have multiple guys with a laser riffle staring off into space but dead shotting me with their gun. Other times you'll have AI walk right passed you not turning its head or trying to attack you. These little moments break the transparency and fieel of the game; you can just feel the lazy programming here. 

So all in all, AFTER playing for 3 hours we finally got into the rythm of the game and we were cheering and yelling at eachother all through the last match even though we failed it right at the end. We're hoping for more maps like this one afterwards, and if this was the only good mission I'll come back and change my review. 

The community seems very active and I had many people try to get me to play co-op with them while i was waiting for my friends. You can choose to share audio separately from joining their game. This is nice if you want to talk to them prior to playing so you don't get stuck into a potential 30m uphill battle.

If you have a buddy like I did then this is a great VR game to play together. If you're solo, well grind out a few levels and interact with the other people in the lobby.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013443780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1512821727}
review:
I have just requested a refund after 2 hours, I've only done this 1 other time in my 9 -year Steam history. It's not that the game is awful, it's just massively overhyped for what it is, even for VR. It's more polished than many titles, but overall it feels very simplistic and gets boring incredibly quickly. It is quite literally nothing more than a basic wave-shooter, with some uninspring and rather annoying dialogue in between rounds in order to try to convince you that the game has story/progression. 

The shooting/reload mechanics are not particularly fun to play with compared to games like Onwards or Pavlov, and I found myself drearly pointing my gun at the encroaching enemies waiting for it to get interesting. I was annoyed 3/4 of the way through the first level at yet again having to grab that bloody data download thing and wait for the ai companion to find another excuse for the surrounding robots to start attacking me, it all felt very contrived. The 2nd level looked almost identical to the 1st, save some marginally different enemies. It switches up a little more in the 3rd level and beyond but not enough to make me want to keep playing at all. 

Overall I just feel there is not reason to play Raw Data. The mechanics aren't fun to play with, the story/characters aren't gripping, and the scenarios are repetative, so the fact that the world looks polished doesn't matter. Even dying felt like it didn't matter, I just seems to respawn quickly with the level still ongoing. There's nothing to really care about or feel engaged with.

If it was ¬£9.99 I would have left it in my library, but ¬£29.99 is just far too much for something so bland and simple.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971028231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1542447284}
review:
This was the first real VR game I ever played earlier in '17 at a gaming convention. At the time I played on an Oculus Rift with Touch Controllers, and was blown away by the experience. This is the game that hooked me on VR. Plays and feels great on the Vive as well!

Some say its just another shooter- to an extent this is true. The main point is shooting things. But the gameplay is fun, the ninja character is a blast to play, and the graphics are very polished. There are even some horror elements to the game. I get quite the workout whenever I play as the battles get intense.

In my opinion right now this is one of the best VR games on the market.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081950025', 'num_games_owned': 804, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 2366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2230, 'last_played': 1616711599}
review:
Very fun shooter with a few nice surprises, very good shooting model and fun combat. Both teleport and full locomotion available. Progression and replayability value - you level up one of four heroes unlocking abilities ("Eden tech") by playing the levels. And speaking of heroes, you have a choice between a swift and deadly female cyberninja Saija wielding an awesome lightblade katana, a big, grizzled, shotgun toting Boss who loves to get physical with his augumented fists, gun-kata master Bishop who excells at dual wielding pistols and an old Master Archer, Saija's father who can poke an eye (along with the whole head mind you) off an eden corp automo across the room using his bow and arrows.

Game has a nice, cyberpunk story (which is best enjoyed playing alone), but also offers a coop PvE mode which allows you to band with a friend to chop the robots together in beautiful scenery. Speaking of which, the level design is very good, there is a lot of space in some of them which is emphasised by VR. They have this distinct, cyberpunk atmosphere of dystopian future.

As for performance, I have an i5 3570k@stock clock, GTX 1070 and 8GB RAM running on W7. Game works without a hitch performance wise, no stuttering, so I think the minimal specs are a bit too high.

I highly recommend this game, especially to try the cyberninja. Lightsabers are sooo last century, lightblade katanas are all the rage ^_^

author: {'steamid': '76561198002494496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1111, 'last_played': 1512692059}
review:
Wow, what a fun game. 
I initially didn't like the first level, because I don't like being surrounded, but once I realized how to use teleport and use my surroundings, it turned totally fun.  Not quite done, but I like almost all the mechanisms.

Only thing that would be handy is to be able to re-orient your rotation to keep your cord behind you.  Most levels there is one primary area from which you will fight, leave and return, and the cabling is much friendlier if that orientation has the cord behind you (in teleport-only mode).

BUGS:  you can accidentally holster your right hand gun in your left have holster (by handing it off in the heat of battle).  Once that happens, you won't be able to draw the gun unless you realize what happened) - and you will die without the other gun.  If you end the level in this state, you also won't be able to restart the level, because only the right-hand gun can be used as a pointer (an open hand cannot).  And teleport is disabled at the end of a level for some reason, making it hard to reach things (I've had to change walk modes to grab briefcase or restart).   But these are small things in a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970614306', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1639690376}
review:
I was skeptical about getting a VR system and with recent pricing specials decided to go for it with the Rift (with touch controllers).  Ten minutes into this game I was hooked on VR.  As a lifelong gamer I can't emphasize enough what a game changer this is (pun intended).  Being able to duck behind cover, using your arms to sight down and blast robot enemies is pretty awesome.  Better yet is using the  laser sword(s) to slash apart enemies, cutting them in 360 arcs if you let them swarm you, and bouncing back laser blasters to fry the drones that are too high up to hit.  I don't normally even like FPS games...yet for sheer entertainment value nothing I've ever played before can match it.  

On another note this is the only game I've tried so far that utilizes my SLI setup (GTX 1070).

author: {'steamid': '76561198012044688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1710216366}
review:
Ever since we got out Vive we've been the family place to entertain for all the family get togethers. I've had the VR for about a year and up until recently Arizona Sunshine has been the guys go to title. I have to say that Raw Data's campaign mode as now taken over that spot by a mile and left all the others in the dust. 

Though it's a wave shooter at it's heart the movment, graphics, controls, and gameplay are second to none. We play with roomscale and It's a fast paced, intense adrenaline filled rush that will get you moving. You'll not be taking down robots here standing flat fooded blasting away. Nope, not by a long shot! Here you'll be dodging lazer blasts, ducking and side stepping lazer beams, dodging / blocking melee attacks having a hell of a time doing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975023587', 'num_games_owned': 880, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1508, 'last_played': 1539819975}
review:
Raw Data est, dans mon exp√©rience, le meilleur "wave shooter" con√ßu pour la VR disponible actuellement. Le jeu a pass√© presque 1 an 1/2 en early access, dur√©e pendant laquelle il a √©t√© r√©guli√®rement am√©lior√© et agrandi. 

Attention √† ne pas se laisser tromper par les trailers : l'histoire est tr√®s rudimentaire, il n'y a pas de campagne √† proprement parler et les dialogues, bien que r√©ussis, ne sont l√† que pour donner un peu de contexte √† l'action. On en apprend plus sur l'univers SF/cyberpunk du jeu en consultant des ressources externes comme le vrai-faux site de la compagnie "[url=http://www.edencorp.tokyo/]Eden Corp[/url]" ou les [url=https://survios.com/rawdata/media/]bandes dessin√©es[/url] produites pour le jeu. 

Tant qu'on rentre dans ce jeu en s'attendant √† de l'action non-stop, on ne sera normalement pas d√©√ßu. Les parties se jouent soit en solo soit en coop √† 2, et chaque niveau consiste √† d√©fendre ou attaquer une ou plusieurs ressources face √† 5 vagues de robots meutriers de diverses engeances. Les ennemis vont du mini-drone volant au robot g√©ant de 10m, en passant par les kamikazes explosifs, ninjas invisibles, fusilliers, lance-roquettes, etc. Il y a 10 niveaux de taille vari√©e qui pr√©sentent tous des variantes sur le principe de base. La difficult√© est param√©trable (ce qui est utile car jouer en solo se r√©v√®le nettement plus difficile qu'en coop).

4 personnages, repr√©sentant chacun un arch√©type de gameplay, sont jouables :[list]
[*]Bishop le pistolero, utilisant 2 pistolets √† la fois (√©voquant le style du film Equilibrium)
[*]Saija la ninja, qui manie le sabre et la t√©l√©kin√©sie (en gros une jedi)
[*]Boss le gros dur, qui pr√©f√®re le fusil √† pompe et ses poings (me rappelle un peu Judge Dredd)
[*]Elder l'archer, quant √† lui, envoie une panoplie de fl√®ches au effets vari√©s (√† la "Oeil-de-faucon" de l'univers Marvel)
[/list]

Un mode PvP est √©galement pr√©sent et semble populaire (pour un jeu VR) mais je ne l'ai pas essay√©. Le PvP et la VR en g√©n√©ral font actuellement mauvais m√©nage en raison de la tr√®s faible population de joueurs. Je ne recommanderai donc pas d'acheter un jeu VR actuellement pour son PvP, car il peut rapidement se retrouver d√©sert et donc inutilisable. Fort heureusement ce n'est pas l'attrait principal de Raw Data qui, bien qu'id√©al en coop, est tout √† fait fonctionnel en solo.

Au niveau visuel le jeu pr√©sente des graphismes soign√©s, au dessus de la plupart des jeux con√ßus par des studios ind√©pendants, mais en dessous des grosses productions commes celles financ√©es par Oculus. Le jeu utilise le forward rendering et le MSAA (ce qui n'√©tait pas le cas au d√©but de sa p√©riode d'early access) ce qui lui permet de compenser les probl√®mes d'aliasing qui affectent les jeux VR.

Enfin le jeu g√®re le crossplay entre Oculus et SteamVR de sorte √† maximiser la population de joueurs. Attention toutefois Steam et Oculus ne partageant pas de listes de contacts, retrouver un ami sur l'autre plateforme n√©cessite un peu de bidouille. Il vaut donc mieux pr√©f√©rer l'achat sur la m√™me platforme, ind√©pendamment du hardware, si on souhaite jouer avec quelqu'un en particulier.

Bilan : Raw Data est actuellement dans mon top 3 (sur plus de 50) jeux VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042372444', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1707238084}

review:

Le fait qu'il y ait un sc√©nario m'a plu (sans √™tre le sc√©nar' du si√®cle, je fais partie de ceux qui ont du mal √† d√©fourrailler √† tout va sans avoir d'explication sur le contexte).

Si les 1√®res missions sont assez basiques, elles sont surtout destin√©es √† d√©couvrir les diff√©rentes classes d'ennemis. Les niveaux suivants voient appara√Ætre des m√©caniques qui apportent une vari√©t√© et renouvellent l'exp√©rience de mani√®re tout √† fait satisfaisante.

Chaudement recommand√© !

author: {'steamid': '76561198000076065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 3229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3040, 'last_played': 1619749052}
review: This is one of those VR games that you keep coming back to. Just checkout my playtime. Most current VR games will have content enough for 1-3 hours. This game is well worth it's cost. It makes you feel like a super hero. The wave shooter of all wave shooters. I cannot recommend this game enough. It has great graphics, a good amount of levels, multiple characters with different unlockable abilities, some awesome world building, team multi player support, 1v1 dueling, and coop story mode support. I feel a bit bummed out when I take off my headset and have to leave this awesome cyberpunk world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004035591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1451, 'last_played': 1566401692}

author: {'steamid': '76561198085000575', 'num_games_owned': 1166, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1511713569}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029732815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1689005849}
review:
I've played around 20 different vr games now and this one is by far the best. The aiming witht he guns is perfect, its well programmed and feels stable (No falling through the floor for example)

The bullets fire at a decent speed, making it easy to get headshots. Theres a variety of enemies with different skills and a training area where you can practice till your hearts content. 
 
Doesnt lag. 

Hopefull the campain is quite long, at 7+ GB i would expect it to be

author: {'steamid': '76561198026664624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1512222098}

author: {'steamid': '76561198294969782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1510467007}

author: {'steamid': '76561198076677763', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1561749302}
review:
That game is really best game I have tried on the Vive so far !!
This is the closest we have to a AAA title. The amount for Detail, Polish, mechanics!! Everything just shines on the Vive! It has the best use of locomotion/teleport movement.

It a very comfortable method or movement with teleportation/sliding without breaking immersion or making you dizzy.
You feel like a freaking jedi slashing, throwing, and force pushing your way through waves of robots.

All of the characters are unique and rewarding to play. The levels are well done, challenging, and fun. The story is classic cyber punk / science fiction, and they really nail the details of building immersion into that world.
There's pvp too, and it's really good.

So that game dont miss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083016870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1624129618}
review: I purchased this game awhile back and stopped trying to play it after a few attempts to finish the first mission because it would crash. It was in early release at the time so I didn't gripe about it and figured they would get it figured out after sometime. I'm running two 1070's in sli and was surprised to find out that this game actually has VR SLI support. I have to say that I'm honestly impressed with the difference of one GPU vs. 2 GPU's.  Not the worst game experiance I've paid for and the chance to experiance what SLI support could look like in the future made it worth it for me since I bought in early release.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986999150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1540076690}

Hands down the best gun reloading system IMO

Wish there were more weapons and exploration, but for one of the pioneers, this game does a lot of things right!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972609948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 1804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1094, 'last_played': 1708649446}
review: The game earns its status as one of the best VR games out in 2017.  Co-op is fun, but the lack of regions for players and small playerbase due to hardware market penetration hampers it a bit.  i've had some of my oddest multiplayer experiences in this game after being in mmos for over a decade.  The thing that brings the most to the game is the way your characters feel with all their abilities.  Each one is unique and has its strong points.  The ninja is the closest thing to a jedi in a vr game currently.   Its a lot of fun and feels good.

Wave shooter + Tower Defence, –Ω–∏—á–µ–≥–æ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ. –ú–æ–∂–µ—Ç –≤ 2016 –æ–Ω–∞ –∏ –±—ã–ª–∞ —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–∞ –¥–ª—è HTC Vive, –Ω–æ —Å–µ–π—á–∞—Å, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –µ—Å—Ç—å –±–æ–ª–µ–µ –¥–æ—Å—Ç–æ–π–Ω—ã–µ –∏–≥—Ä—ã (—Ç–æ—Ç –∂–µ Robo Recall) - Raw Data —Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏—Ç—Å—è –∫—Ä–∞–π–Ω–µ —É–Ω—ã–ª–æ –∏ –æ–¥–Ω–æ–æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–Ω–æ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044320557', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1467, 'last_played': 1561824363}
review:
Great game!

Alot of fun to play alone, EPIC with a friend. 

There are 10 missions with 3 difficulties (4 if you are able to comlete the game on hard), so this game offers good fun for everyone. The main goal of each mission is to protect a data core, but for most missions different elements are added to make the gameplay more interesting. For each sucsessful round you will get a new ability (to a total of 6 for each of the 4 classes), and most of the abilities are strong and fun to use.

I see from the reviews that some people have experienced some bugs, but i have yet to encounter any gamebraking bugs afrer the full release. I have however found some minor glitches like robots freezing and just hanging in the air for a few moments after beiing killed.

Overall this is the best VR-game i have played yet, and i really recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046743137', 'num_games_owned': 514, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1509678340}
review: I used to really like this game, back before they added the Elder. He's not the problem, only the last time I played this game, he wasn't in it, and the sword wasn't useless, and the enemies would hit you instead of your room barriers. Now the pistol magazines are glitching out, the weapons are all so underpowered, and I find even the tutorials irritating with a sword. Not a game I plan on playing anymore, nor that I'll be recommending to anyone.
developer_response:
Hey TheNarwhal,

Apologies for the negative experience you've had with the game as of late.

Could you try deleting your .ini files and see if the awkward placement of the magazine persists (as shown in the video you linked)?

To delete ini:
[list]
    [*]Open a Run window by simultaneously pressing the "Windows" and "R" keys on your keyboard.
    [*]Type "%localappdata%" and press "Enter" or click "OK".
    [*]Navigate through the following pathway: RawData > Saved > Config > WindowsNoEditor
    [*]Delete the contents in this folder, then relaunch Raw Data.
[/list]
Best regards,
Survios_CS

author: {'steamid': '76561197991555039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1298, 'last_played': 1512922839}
review: I bought this game when it was in early access, I liked it that time as well, but now its out and it really deserves the positive review because it became one of the best VR title in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028339827', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1536815495}
review:
VR wave shooters are supposed to make you feel like a badass. I've seen reviews on other games claiming that they do. This is the first one that has genuinely done it.

When they say you need space they aren't kidding. Don't expect a decent cardio workout on easy if your aim is good - the enemies don't engage you until they are practically in melee range.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970331629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1508700201}
review:
Raw Data has some very cool mechanics. Graphics are nice, handling the weapons seemed cool for the most parts and the game flow seemed just fine for me. That is, if I didn't encounter three game flow breaking bugs within my first hour of play, the first one happening within minutes. The weapon tutorial wasn't loading, the menu on the training side simply wouldn't pop up. It worked after I restarted the game, so I believed it was a one time bug. During the first mission, the game got stuck again, just before the mission end as I figured out after restarting the mission entirely, which then I was able to finish. And guess what? The same thing happens in the second mission as well. 

I probably could get along with this if this was an early access title but for a full priced and finished game, this is a no-go.

Refund.
developer_response:
Hey General Problem Solver,

Apologies for these issues you experienced with the game.

We're working on fixing these specific bugs with an upcoming hotfix.

Sorry again for these ruining your experience.

Best regards,
Survios_CS

author: {'steamid': '76561198004267428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1565876674}
review: Tr√®s bon √† tous les niveaux !

author: {'steamid': '76561197980003848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1555171813}
review:
[h1]I was quite surprised how well this game is made.[/h1] The main features that I think makes this game great are:
[list]
    [*] Multi-player matchmaking
    [*] Dynamic combat system
    [*] Improvements to weapons and cosmetics
[/list]

Apart from that, the level design is quite beautiful, very nice effects.
Story-line seems interesting, and you are able to play either single-player, multi-player or player versus player.
I was not quite convinced when I read that people deemed this game the best VR game out there, it couldn't beat Arizona Sunshine.
But after playing it, I might actually agree. It bests all other VR games I've tried in terms of combat dynamics.

For this game I recommend a GTX1060 or higher.

Only played the game for 85 minutes, and I'm already certain that it was worth the money spent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074046884', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1508554433}
review:
[h1]Like a lot of VR, it's FAR TOO EXPENSIVE for what it offers[/h1]
I know the trailers really don't make it seem like it is, but Raw Data is pretty much a tower defense game. You have one defense point (plus yourself) and 4 towers with which to bring an assault on swarms of robots. The problem is that gameplay is far too repetitive once you get the game going. And I've already played 6 of the 10 levels. All you do is shoot/stab and teleport away. It's fast paced, but surprisingly not very engaging. The sword boomerang is extremely glitchy and dropped the sword half of the times I tried to throw it. When the environment moves, it sometimes leaves fixed elements behind that aren't supposed to stay with you. I lost tracking repeatedly despite being in the center of my (large) room-scale playspace, and I even lost the ability to teleport and had to restart the game. Absolutely frustrating problems that shouldn't persist into a final release game.

Oh, did I mention that it's only 10 levels? And each one can be cleared in a fairly short amount of time. All you do is shoot/slash robots while an AI and someone on comms say barely meaningful things (repeatedly). You get the point, it gets old really quicly. It's absolutely frustrating how studios pump out basic VR games then charge big-name studio pricing on them. I bought this game on sale and it's still too much for what it offers in gameplay. For $10, yes. But ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• NO for $40. Refunded.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970755891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1540675763}
review:
A great-looking, well-tuned, high-quality, TERRIBLE game.

When was the last time anyone bought a first-person arena wave shooter for mouse/wasd? Yeah, I thought so.

VR games need to be held to the same standards as non-VR. 10 levels? That's it? And each one is basically one room? There are 80's arcade games with more content.

The updated movement mechanics are great (Smooth move FTW!) and the combat mechanics are polished and enjoyable. But you just never go anywhere. Boring. Repetetive. No AI. Not much story. Like so much else in VR, it's a $10 indie title at AAA prices.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994526477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1508305756}
review:
Compared with Robo Recall on the Rift... man this game is just not comparable.

The Good: 
_Awesome, tight environment design. Plenty of beautiful areas to look at.
_Cool story premise. I heard it's good, but short.
_I can see my magazine run down in the handgun. Nice touch. It's the coolest weapon by far. Oh, I could turn off the laser sword. That was cool. No sound effects though.
_There is a nice challenge to the game on normal. But... it's for the wrong reasons.

The Bad: 
_I couldn't get hooked into the story at the beginning. What am I doing here? What is this weird video? There was some cool nuanced tone but then they made it ULTRA blatant with your narrator character just outright saying the company is evil then... Well then why am I in the frigging lobby of their headquarters farting around? Just feels all wrong to me.
_Sum up the tone of the game as "Gamey". Characters get unique power ups? Laser sword magically swoops back to your hand automatically when thrown? Stuck in a room while a person says "hang on I'm hacking the system. Oh no they are blocking me from the system. Oh no"? no thanks.
_One character, one weapon. Not particularly fun ones. Maybe this changes later? Didn't bother to find out.
_Melee class is miserable to play solo. Feels like they just wanted to cross it off their checklist.
_AI is very simplistic (in the bad way). Like, top down arcade shooter simplistic. Much more reactive AI present in Robo Recall, Interstellar Marines, Fallout 4, basically any recent game I've played with robots in it. Most of them just shuffle about a little while I bonk them with my sword over and over until their bullet sponge HP pool empties.

The Ugly: 
_Environments lack interactivity (one again, maybe this changes later). You can walk and stand on "warp pads" and activate the wave trigger and that's it. I saw a few points of cover scattered around that are effectively useless. Maybe cover becomes useful in multiplayer?
_NO atmosphere. You want atmospheric gameplay with robots? Try playing Interstellar Marines. Or Fallout 4.
_Rift face-forward system is pretty bad. Flicking thumbstick to turn feels incredibly clunky. Feels like they shouldn't have even added it. It's not terrible until you get into combat.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974130609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1508470163}
review: Buggy. First weapon tutorial doesn't work i.e., no menu screen to activate the tutorial. Get a warning why trying to play without completing the tutorial that you can't start. Was able to play through the first mission fine. When someone invited me to play a co-op mission, buggy as hell. Two pistols but no way to reload. Then no pistols at all and only clips. I thought this was supposed to be a highly rated game, but it seems like there are still bugs to work out.
developer_response:
Hey whisper-er,

Apologies for these bugs you're experiencing with the game.

We're currently invenstigating the issues you experienced in co-op mode. Do you happen to rememeber if you were the host or client when you experienced these bugs with your pitols?

As for the first weapon tutorial not working: Do you have a video of this issue at all? If so, would you mind sending it to support@survios.com?

Thank you for your patience!

author: {'steamid': '76561198146135421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1510286311}
review:
I had hoped this game would be more polished, especially now that it is a fully launched game. My first few experiences with story mode were awful. The first time I tried to play I used the ninja, while throwing my blade in the first wave it disappeared through a wall never to come back, I hoped I would have respawned on my back but I was wrong. I continued to play just punching the robots till I got to the drones and I just had to wait for them to kill me hoping the whole time my blade would respawn. The second attempt at playing I used the archer. I was pleased when my weapon didn‚Äôt vanish into thin air while playing but near the end of the 4th or 5th wave, the robots just stopped coming. Nothing happened, the game wouldn‚Äôt progress, I tried looking for a bot I missed or maybe a drone stuck in the air but no‚Ä¶ the game just wouldn‚Äôt move forward and for the second time in a row had to quit out of the first level of the story because of a glitch in the game.
Lastly, why do all the windows in the first level of story mode glitch around when you move? I really would expect to see that from a very early alpha or maybe a beta game. Not from a full release‚Ä¶ 
That being said (if you made it this far in my rant) this game seems fun when It works, but it hasn‚Äôt seemed to work for me.
developer_response:
Hey UnicornMan,

Apologies for these bugs you've experienced with the game. We're working on fixing these specific issues you're enduring.

Just to gather more information:
[list]
    [*]When you lost your katana as Saija, were you playing in Multiplayer or Singleplayer?
    [*]If Multiplayer, were you the client or host?
    [*]Also, which mission were you playing when you got stuck on phase 4 or 5?
[/list]
Sorry again for these bugs affecting your experience!

author: {'steamid': '76561198182902058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1111, 'last_played': 1508129511}
review:
When evil robots seek to destroy humanity, you must defend your data core!

In all seriousness I don't leave many reviews but this game really brought me out of my shell. For me Raw Data is a blueprint for what VR is capable of even in it's almost beta-like phase. This is the one game that doesn't seem to be holding back or demoing a project/concept. 

If I were to rate on a scale it would be 9/10... It's not perfect only because of FPS issues and bugs in co-op I experienced. Also I think they could explore the background of the characters and universe a bit more that way I could feel even more bad ass!
