author: {'steamid': '76561197971348987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 1239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1239, 'last_played': 1509827041}
review:
Played with Oculus Rift/Touch.

Raw Data is what I'd call a wave based arena shooter - exactly like the big budget Robo Recall from Epic games. These two games share A LOT, so if you're familiar with RR, you know what to expect here too.

You can choose from 4 characters, who all have distinct weapons and special powers. Detailed info here: https://survios.com/rawdata/heroes/

- Bishop is the good allrounder - My choice for a solo playthrough on hard difficulty.
- Boss has limited range but really high DPS - depending on the map, a really good partner for Bishop in co-op.
- Elder requries a little more skill with his powerful bow, but largely fills the same long range role as bishop.
- Saija is melee focused, but still has a bit of range when throwing the swords like a boomerang.

Playing solo with the first three characters on normal difficulty was proper fun, and I feel the devs did a good job diversifying their abilities and weapons. But Saija turned out to be a great disappointment for me. This melee based character seems super powerful, but the hit detection was just so terrible it ruined the fun for me. I started out expecting to be able to slice and dice the robots hollywood style, but more than half the times my blade just went through my foes seemingly unregistered. The only method that reliably worked was a top down slice to the skull. Doing this repeatedly with 2 swords alternating left and right, I felt more like I was playing drums than being a cool sci-fi ninja.

There's a great deal of options for moving your character. There's teleportation and snap turning - but also smooth stick locomotion and turning. But the kicker is that you can have it all simultaneously(!) which I find great. The telportation has it's limitations to keep it balanced. Raw Data is so close to ticking all the boxes in this category, but sadly the devs didn't implement the turn+teleport combination like you get in RR. Maybe a conscious balancing decision, but until I have a wireless HMD, this much turning around after teleporting behind a foe gets the cable tangled. 

In each wave you have to protect your data core(s) from the incoming robots (much like protecting a relay in RR). To aid you in this you can purchase and build 3 different turret types and a dome shield. You gain currency for each kill.

The levels vary from fairly small confined rooms to quite large vertically displaced platforms connected with winding walkways. 

The visual presentation is really good with settings almost maxed out, but I did experience some framerate issues here and there - especially in the lobby. 

I would've loved a cracking beat heavy electronic soundtrack to go along with the action, but all you get is some dramatic atmospheric movie-esque background music. 

I've had a really good time so far with Raw Data, and while the campaign only gives you 2-4 hours there's plenty replayability for me with the 4 classes and hard/nightmare difficulty settings, global/friend leaderboards,  not to mention co-op.

Having said that there are a lot of bugs and annoyances. Here are some of them:

- Enemies get pushed into walls a lot
- Hands and weapons totally misaligned at times, thus disabling Bishops fusion charged shot
- Falling through elevator floor
-Getting thrown backwards in the air for no reason on "Fatal Error" until you're crushed against wall
- Crashes (had 4-5 so far)
- Restart of a level is cumbersome and difficulty resets to normal
- Enemy turret explosion often missing (they just vanish)
- Enemies running backwards
- Stealth ninja bots standing idle next to my turret letting me kill them
- Teleporting outside arena area = instadeath. Even before a wave starts.
- You cannot rebind the controls, which means you have locomotion on the left stick, which you have to press down to engange the teleport. Needless to say I ended up pressing the stick by accident a lot when the action was hectic, causing me to teleport somewhere random. Pretty confusing. 

Bottom line: Really good shooter that could use some spit shine to reach the polish level of Robo Recall, which I'd recommend above this game unless co-op is essential for you.

80%

author: {'steamid': '76561197970094946', 'num_games_owned': 2748, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 822, 'last_played': 1562202923}
review:
Raw Data may be the best wave shooter available for VR. It‚Äôs polished, the combat is fun and fast, and there is a good variety in the types of levels. Play solo or with friends in cross-platform multiplayer - you can play with your friends if they have the game on Oculus Home.  

There are 4 heroes to choose from ‚Äì the melee focused robot ninja Saija, the rocket-punch shotgun toting Boss, the duel wielding Bishop that was taken straight from Equilibrium and Elder the laser archer because laser arrows are a thing. Each character has a unique arsenal and their own set of abilities and powerful ultimates to stave off those robot hordes.  

If ‚Äúwave shooter‚Äù is something you intentionally avoid, or you haven‚Äôt tried out Raw Data, it‚Äôs worth a look for its polished nature and frenetic, physical action.

Check out my full coverage on 3CR:
https://thirdcoastreview.com/2017/10/11/game-review-raw-data/

author: {'steamid': '76561198110878392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1503638590}
review:
Other's really enjoy this game, however if you're expecting a narrative combined with VR combat system this isn't it. 
Every level consists of defending a terminal from waves of low A.I. enemies.

Attempting to interact with any part of the game environment gives an irritating red hue

Fighting waves of robots requires very little movement and is essentially just shoot in front of you or stick a sword in front of you and wave around, no need for proper placement or form.

I think i just expected something different

author: {'steamid': '76561198001850032', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1608955759}
review:
Completely loving this game, worth every penny. The only problem I have with it is the walk movement. It is based on where your hands are pointing instead of where your face is pointing, and it can be completely disorienting. For instance if I swing my arms down to reload as bishop while walking forward, I'll begin walking backwards or to the sides. It's caused me to fall off many-a-ledge.

EDIT: I've looked further into the options menu to find that this is a control I can change. 10/10 game.

review:
The combat mechanics are great, but they managed to fuck up basic teleportation. For some reason rather than having you teleport where you point the controller, the teleportation lazor is at a 90 degree angle from your controller. Additionally you can't teleport into physical objects, so what do they do? They try to find a location near by that you can teleport to. Seems fine, tell you play with it and find the "find a valid location" system is retarded. 

Is it too much to ask that 40$ game teleports me to where I point my controller?

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198006542142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1563028499}
review:
Ein gutes VR Spiel. Dieses Spiel ist definitiv vollwertig. Es bietet die Freiheit sich so zu bewegen wie man es am liebsten mag. Teleport, Locomotion, alles vorhanden. Es f√ºhlt sich cool an die verschiedenen Waffen in den H√§nden zu halten. Diese sind allerdings an den Charakter gebunden. Es gibt 4 spielbare Charaktere, jeder hat eine eigene Waffe. Es ist wirklich nur eine Waffe, man kann also nicht zwischen verschiedenen Pistolen ausw√§hlen. Daf√ºr schalten die Charaktere verschiedene neue Skills frei die man benutzen kann. Zur Auswahl stehen Akimbopistolen (am Anfang ist es nur eine Pistole, bis zum Levelup), ein Char mit Pumpgun, ein Ninja mit Schwert sowie ein Bogensch√ºtze. Es gibt 10 Missionen mit verschiedenen Schwierigkeitsgraden die man alleine oder im Coop spielen kann. Dazu gibt es 2 PVP Modi, allerdings muss ich sagen dass ich seit ich das Spiel habe erst einmal eine offene PVP Lobby gefunden habe und in dieser in einer 2vs1 Situation war... das war nicht wirklich cool. K√∂nnte mir vorstellen dass PVP sehr witzig w√§re, hier ist aber das generelle Problem das viele MP VR Titel haben... es gibt einfach zu wenige Spieler. Das Game wg PVP zu kaufen, davon w√ºrde ich abraten. 

Das Spiel hat eine tolle Optik, l√§uft bei mir stabil und ist nie abgest√ºrzt. Es ist auch auf jeden Fall geeignet um Kumpels zu zeigen wie cool VR sein kann. Es gibt verschiedene Gegnertypen, insbesondere die gro√üen Roboter wirken sehr bedrohlich wenn sie vor einem stehen. Immersion ist klasse.
Die Missionen unterscheiden sich thematisch, es gibt einen "Dark Room", die Laser aus Resident Evil, einen Oberboss usw. Die Levels beschr√§nken sich bis auf eine Ausnahme auf einzelne R√§ume, manchmal mit der M√∂glichkeit dass der Raum gr√∂sser wird, sich T√ºren √∂ffnen usw. Man bewegt sich generell aber immer in einem (gro√üen!) Raum. Hier h√§tte ich mir etwas mehr Mut zu Korridor und Walkthrough-Levels gew√ºnscht... aber vlt ist das ja was f√ºr eine Fortsetzung... mal sehen. 
Insgesamt bereue ich den Kauf im EA nicht und bin mit dem Titel zufrieden... hatte auf jeden Fall Spass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071155208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1477858208}
review: I have had this game since release and have not been able to trigger the game to do anything. I can walk around the beginning room but the keosk and the training stuff wont trigger. I've tried reinstalling it.  I've tried it at a friends house and was able to run the game just fine, initiate the tutorial, start the actual game portion.  On my computer though it's like a big empty waiting room with nothing to do.  That said I have played it at my friends.  It's  probably the best wave shooter, but that isn't saying much because wave shooters are rather basic and more suited to phone games.   Still.  It's just okay. It would be nice to have levels and be able to walk around more than a small space.  For the lack of actual game content (level modelling and such) you'd think it would have been cheaper to develop / sell for cheaper.  Still worth it on sale if you're bored and want to play a good looking wave shooter.  Make sure to just try it out right away though so you can refund it if it doesn't work on your computer like in my case.
developer_response:

author: {'steamid': '76561197992703739', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1507438031}
review: It's ok. It's not what many people hype it up to be or at least I can't seem to see why. I mean... it's 2017 and more fps games have free locomotion and teleporting is a thing of the past with VR FPS so I'm not entirely sure how i feel with teleporting instead of simple locomotion in VR. I give this game a 4/10 with the 19 minutes I've put into it. It's worth the purchase if teleporting is your thing along with shooting robots with a slow rate of fire pistol. great looking game on top of that

author: {'steamid': '76561198087232830', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1507482255}
review:
I've since requested a refund for this game. The story was interesting and uniqu, the graphics were good however, the gameplay itself was nothing short of just another VR wave shooter. I only had to play 40 minutes to realise that. Maybe some poeple will enjoy this game if wave shooters are your thing, but for me it got boring very quickly. 

Although there is the option to teleport/walk around the area is pretty small, it's basically shoot robots wave after wave. Nothing interesting there for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153804506', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1507328034}
review:
I have the minimum specs required, the GTX 970 and an i5 6500 with 8gb of RAM. But yet, it's still very laggy with the lowest graphical settings on. It runs around 30-45 FPS.

Other than that, the game is actually somewhat decent (if it was cheaper), for $40 it's a bit overpriced. The voice acting in the story is very nice and the story overall is pretty amazing. 

The gameplay is pretty nice and the robots have variatey and are pretty scary. You won't really use the sword person or the bow and arrow.

The multiplayer is just plain dumb, no one plays it, and the gameplay is stupid. The story is the only thing that's really good about this game. It's pretty short too. For the 1.2 hours that I've played on it, I already completed 4/8 of the missions. (correct me if I'm wrong)

There isn't really a lot of replayablity in this game, the campaign is short and the multiplayer is kinda dumb. Maybe I haven't sunken much time into it but the first hour was really enjoyable. After that I didn't really see the point of playing it anymore when I could be playing other titles like Onward, Pavlov, Gorn, and Rec Room. 

Personally, for $40, this isn't a really good game. Maybe for $15-20 it would be decent. It could just be me and my ignorance for not playing the game too long and using used computer parts to build the minumum specs required for VR. 

I dunno.
developer_response:

If you have the time, would you mind contacting us at support@survios.com with your DxDiag attached? We'd be more than happy to help troubleshoot this lag problem you're enduing.

Best regards,
Survios_CS

author: {'steamid': '76561197960453795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1510798640}
review:
PVE is great! Worth getting for that.

PvP is dogshit. RecRoom Paintball is a better shooting experience. So much motion sickness with the two movement styles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967539773', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1536524247}
review:
Yes, it's a VR wave shooter, of which there are many. It's also the best one, bar none, and wicked fun in coop. Graphics are beautiful, classes are fun as hell, story mode takes you on a kinda weakly-written but intense journey, and the weapons handle beautifully. Haven't tried public matchmaking myself, but with how many party invites I've shamelessly ignored, it seems to work fine. Even playing with a friend across the continent I never noticed latency or desync issues.

Either Raw Data or Onward are going to be your favorite game, and I cannot give you any reason not to own both.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990526325', 'num_games_owned': 898, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1511996003}
review:
This is the game I've played the most in VR. Can't wait to reset my progress just to get the achievements and see the story from beginning to end. It may be a wave shooter but it feels very solid.

Pros:
- Great Graphics
- Good Sound Design
- A Story (With a "fake" website giving even more)
- Multiple Characters that all play differently
- Some interesting stages with their own special traps
- A terrifying dark level that still makes me jump, in a good way
- Coop
- PvP

Cons:
- Controls can feel weird sometimes, but better now than before
- Could be longer (different feeling characters help though)
- It is still a wave shooter, which is a con if you can't stand them anymore (Worth it though)

Overall this game is great. It is fun, fast, and exciting. When playing solo it can get overwhelming with everything coming at you in some levels, but it makes it that much more intense. I would highly recommend this game to everyone with a VR HMD.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967753518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1507343343}
review:
Cannot recommend, while the team behind the product is obviously talented/competant the product itself is a mess art style wise and Oculus support is seemingly poor. The game is not ready for release, it needs to go back into the oven for a bit longer IMO.

I had high hopes for this title due to all the hype surrounding it but I don't think it is deserved.

Pros:
 * Model detail is good
 * Plenty of options for picking handedness, locomotion and turning UI hints on and off. You can even setup Oculus room Scale (although if you have 3+ cameras it should probably just do this automatically).
 * They've managed to improve performance since early access, props!
 *

Cons:
 * I seem to not be able to grab a magazine for my pistol 50% of the time, sometimes when I grab it my hand disappears and then the magazine just drops, this is incredibly annoying in battle. Tried replacing batteries in my controller, no effect.
 * Cringe story and plot elements
 * On Oculus Rift the gun doesn't appear to point in the proper direction, it seems to be angled upward for the Vive controller.
 * Hand direction movement seems to be influenced by the roll of your controller as opposed to just the vector from your body to the controller controlling the direction, this just feels awkward since my hand resting rotation will not have my character moving forward.
 * None of the weapons FEEL good
 * Reloading the pistol feels awkward AF when the hand animation plays, it feels like a loss of agency for the purpose of a cool animation but it just ends up feeling bad. Actually a lot of the "grab here" animations feel awkward like this, it seems like my wrist is snapping to accomplish some of them.
 * Art direction leaves a lot to be desired in terms of robot design and lighting, a bit to RGB 255 neon for my tastes. It almost feels like an asset flip with the designs seemingly being all over the place, you have the base robot with a cartoonish humanoid face (which I'm not a fan of) then you have more industrial non-humanoid faced robots which look much more appropriate. This is a facete that I think Robo Recall nails.
 * I don't actually know where the fun factor is, bullet sponges are just boring.
 * Some of the art feels unfinished, e.g. the font on a lot of the terminals in game looks like the default UE4 font which you'd more see in prototypes or asset flips.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014933293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2919, 'last_played': 1621737434}
review: This game is one of the first full games that you can get on VR.  A good story mode coupled with fun co-op and PvP.  I think the PvP is what shines here, though.  It's like Overwatch VR, but with a smaller cast.  Hopefully in the future there will be new characters, modes, and maps in PvP.  One great plus about this game is that the devs and community managers are all extremely active and responsive.  Buy the game and then hop onto their discord and get playing!

All in all, hours of fun and worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029858003', 'num_games_owned': 1512, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1511808531}
review:
After two months, this is the best game I have found so far for the Vive, and about the only one that has truly felt like a full, normal game. The gameplay is superb, ramps up in difficulty pretty fluidly, and is good fun. The classes and their skills are more fleshed out than any other VR game I've played at this point. With more than just here's your attack, and here's one or two skills you can choose to equip.

Where this game really excels though is in multi-player. This is my one gripe with it though. Whether it's because the Vive market has a limited amount of players, or just that the people playing Raw Data aren't the most social with their VR experience. I've had a bit of trouble finding others to join a group with. But this game, alongside Rec Room, are the two I've played that shine the most in multi-player gameplay. I feel like they both almost require it.

review:
Do yourself a favor and go buy Sairento. Thats the game you're looking for. Not this one. Don't waste the time or money on this 1999 arcade shooter, go be a fucking ninja jumping over walls and shooting robots in the head with a bow and arrow, all in slow motion.


The primary reason I refunded this garbage was because the locomotion was pure ass. If you can't do Locomotion right, just don't make a VR game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145733770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1691895533}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049107167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1508821122}
review:
Absolutely one of the best VR games available. Outstanding graphics, intense gameplay, and allows for different play styles. Much more than a small sampler like most VR games. 
My single complaint is having to sit and wait through story elements a second time, It gets tiresome when I just want to kill some bots.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043916592', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1081, 'last_played': 1702004393}
review:
A nice change from wave shooters by making it a tower defense instead.
The difference would look minor, but it does wonders for making the game feel more full and alive.

The levels, while seemingly sharing similar archetypes, are a blast to play through with decent narration to keep you involved.
Add co-op into the mix, and you have far more firepower... though you still need to coordinate and not die.

PvP is a bit rough, but quite satisfying with a full room of skilled players.
Get a good match, and it can keep going for ages.

I was uncertain going into it (the first level makes it [i]look[/i] like a plain wave shooter), but once you have some upgrades and mid-game stages, it was completely worth it.
I think anyone looking for a shooter experience that's not in Arcade-style and isn't named Superhot, should find something to like here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005592598', 'num_games_owned': 537, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 3520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3520, 'last_played': 1507334967}
review:
Raw data is the full package and a must own game. If I were forced to sum it up succinctly, I would say It's Overwatch in VR. 
Playing this type of VR experience is like getting to be the ultimate badass. You feel like a freaking jedi slashing, throwing, and force pushing your way through waves of robots. You feel like a gun cleric a la Equilibrium when you play as bishop. 

All of the characters are unique and rewarding to play. The levels are well done, challenging, and fun. The story is classic cyber punk / science fiction, and they really nail the details of building immersion into that world.

Oh yeah, there's pvp too, and it's good. Really good. Honestly, I wish there were more levels because I can get a little bored of playing the same few over and over, but the mechanics of everything are spot on.

TL;DR: Get this game if you are looking for that hotness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028823418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 949, 'last_played': 1516137498}
review: un exelent jeu probablement l un de mes pr√©f√©r√© en vr surtout en coop .

author: {'steamid': '76561197969664977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1512937547}
review:
OK, I'm a big fan of this game.  I've fully unlocked Bishop (gunpriest) and the sword lady, and while both are fun to play, a couple missions are much, much easier with reliable ranged weaponry.  You can blitz through the first nine missions on Normal in ~4.5 hrs, which will fully unlock one of the characters and most of the way unlock another.  There's also a Hard mode, and a Nightmare mode which I haven't unlocked yet.

Aside from single player, there's co-op and PvP.  I haven't tried either of those yet, either; but I'm already super happy with what I've played, and am looking forward to firing up the full version now that it just releaed.

Word of warning, the second level is a little tense.  It's dark, it has creeping enemies, and jumping scares.  Most of the game isn't like that, but, well, forewarned in forearmed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048878547', 'num_games_owned': 665, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1523926073}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999535959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1507440867}
review: I can't recommend this game for more than 10-15 dollars. If you can grab it at that price during a sale then it's a good purchase. I've had this game for a few months now and it's been a disappointment. The gunplay and physics are outstanding but the level design and some of the choices they made with enemy units really drag this game down. The first level is the best by far, I can play that over and over again; it's fun. The rest of the levels get pretty ridiculous pretty fast. To the point where you have to shoot these robots in the head 5-6 times to kill one, it's freakin tedious. Then there's these big boss robots that take a hundred rounds to put down and there's other stuff spawning at the same time. It's just not fun feeling overwhelmed and the simple joy of blowing these robots away becomes a chore. I play the first level once in a while and that's about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975912077', 'num_games_owned': 1542, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1507508571}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985904075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1503035004}
review:
At $40, Raw Data is confident that it works well enough to be worth your money.

I don't believe this to be the case. The handheld controller designs are really janky with Oculus, and I'd imagine not much better with Vive. It's hard to do what you want to do, often times I would endeavour something and struggle to press the buttons on my controller to make it happen - not exactly the kind of immersive design you desire most in VR.

The character renders in multiplayer are blocky and not indicative of a game made in 2017, although the other players move in a very fluid and convincing manner - hand animations and heads of other players are mapped really well, more than enough to forget the other players have headsets on.

The game's universe looks and feels really great - the oppressive "Blade Runner" concepts are really neat, but up close everything looks a little flat.

There's some very interesting concepts at play here, the telekinesis and melee play in multiplayer is an awesomely creative endeavour - unfortunately Raw Data struggles to be humble,

author: {'steamid': '76561197993564613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1637879504}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993313814', 'num_games_owned': 1081, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1578730856}
review:
Still one of the very best games for VR and has gotten better and better as it marches towards its 1.0 release date. While it is technically a "wave-based shooter", it feels so much more than that. The best teleportation system in VR (although it has trackpad locomotion too if that is your bag), and sublime gunplay (and swordplay). The missions are challenging and fun to replay on harder settings. The power-ups are fun and give the game a great sense of progression. 

For the longest time Raw Data has been the benchmark for quality in VR for me. The graphics are superb, and the game feels very much like a polished fully fleshed out game (unlike far too many unfinished and bite-sized VR experiences). If you have a VR headset then you MUST own Raw Data. With single player, co-op and PVP and several different play styles, there is something for everyone (or at least everyone that enjoys VR shooters). 

In the years to come, Raw Data will be looked back upon as a landmark VR game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198418584519', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1634616345}
review: Lotta fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021129705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 1830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1709, 'last_played': 1584953595}
review:
Raw Data is pretty fun, mostly just a wave shooter with a new PVP aspect added to it.

There are four main weapons for each class, the pistol (dual pistols thru upgradin'), the katana, the shotgun, and a bow. The pistol class is generally the one you want to start out with as its the most straight foward out of all the classes. The katana class is also good, although frustrating in solo when the drones come flying out its difficult to hit them. The shotgun class is nice too and makes short work of enemies in close range. The bow class is harder at first to use however if you're familiar with other VR bow games like in the lab, you'll adjust more comfortably. My preference is mainly the bow class especially in PVP with homing arrows you'll be poppin off kills left and right

The PVP is great fun, and where most of my time in this game has come from, however there aren't that many players and oftentimes I find myself playing against like 1 other player or an empty lobby. When there's a populated lobby however, the experience is well worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141388264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2654, 'last_played': 1690597510}
review: Raw Data is one of the best vr games to have come out this summer, particularly in terms of multiplayer pvp. I have been looking for others like it but none quite compare to the sheer fun of slicing, blasting and loosing arrows onto the opposing team. Excellently cooperative and incredibly fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966463890', 'num_games_owned': 945, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1469911597}
review: One of THE VR hardcore games

author: {'steamid': '76561197966693381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1505681514}
review:
Do you like stumbling around in the dark?

Are Katanas your favorite throwing weapon?

Looking for enemies that will make zombies interesting again?

Do you like poorly designed Controls and endless tutorials?

Well then this is the game for you.

Special note for Oculus touch users. It is obvious that the DEVs never actually used these in game. Many menu options are awkward or unusable. Press down on the joystick while pulling the trigger and hitting a button on the same controller? 

While this is a technically solid game it is weighed down by terrible/boring game design.   It feels like they wanted to combine tower defense and a wave shooter but they took the worst parts of each genre and mashed them together.

Requires 360 degree awareness because poor level design (generally a circular room). VR headsets do not provide the same field of view humans have. It cuts off the peripheral vision which makes full 360 awareness awkward in a headset. Most VR designers control the action so it feels more natural but that isn't the case here. 

Outdated teleport system makes locomotion a must.

Every weapon feels bad. Pistols are weak and unsatisfying. Sword is more like a throwing weapon than a melee weapon. Shotgun... well 2 handed guns are bad in a lot of VR but this was one of the worst. Bow... just load up The Lab and save your self 40 bucks.  Dropping your weapon leaves you unarmed untill it teleports back.  Reload mechanics for pistol were fun though.

Enemys are bland and uninteresting.

On the plus side this game does have a great center line/front facing indicator.

author: {'steamid': '76561198395358969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1094, 'last_played': 1535684022}
review:
I have a lot of fun with this game. Joining games, giving invites sometimes takes a couple tries to accomplish. The only character I have not completely unlocked is the archer but once I do I'll update this review. The guy with the shotgun bugs out here and there, it doesn't register when you pump and sometimes the bullets stick mid air. The dual pistols are by far my favorite, and the swords are pretty sweet. I like the options of laying out shields and lasers to the data cores. The mortars seem a little less useful if you're using them for protection against the data core.
The maps are great, the train map is probably my favorite but I have yet to unlock level 10. 
I don't spend a whole lot of time with this game, I usually play it when I want a small break from other games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001905338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 1372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 911, 'last_played': 1572204332}
review: On every generation of games, there are games that people will talk about for years to come.  Games that go down in history.  Raw Data, is that game for VR.  Graphics, play control, immersion, story, and gameplay are all better than they have a right to be.  If you have a VR system, get Raw Data.  You won't regret it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023810129', 'num_games_owned': 686, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1504895191}
review:
Hand tracking is bad. Shotgun is impossible to use on oculus. because it's arm is too freaking big.
Tutorial is broken.
Aiming with a pistol is impossible because of that stupid "rotate to look at cameras" message. WHICH CAMERAS?
developer_response:
Hey SneakyJoe.ru,

Apologies for the negative experience you've had with the game.

If you have the time, would you mind supplying us with a few more details?
[list]
    [*]Which part of the tutorial is broken for you?
    [*]Are you stuck progressing through a specific part, or are you unable to access the tutorial completely?   
[/list]
Also, the "rotate to look at cameras" message is a helper tip to remind Oculus users to face their sensors. Sorry for the confusion!

If you disable you helper tips through the in-game options, this message should stop appearing for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998070174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1641024581}
review:
One of the best VR titles available that acts like a full length game.
Definitely worth the money, lots of content, regular updates, and ONLINE MULTIPLAYER.

Basically, its a defend the objective kind of game, where waves of robots come at you with melee, lasers, rockets, and some are cloaked. You are a Data Theif, your job is to break into super computers and steal the data, during the upload the computer fights you back by sending robotic sentries to attack you and your uplink. You can dodge the attacks, even the laser beams, and fight back with your respective weapons based on the character you chose before the start of the game. You can shoot them, melee them, trap them with traps and turrets, and even use a futuristic bow. 

Stealing the data and getting away with it at the end of the level yeilds you experience towards unlocking new abilities and weapons for your character, and progressing onto the next level.

Pros:
Easy to jump into
Fast Paced Gameplay
AAA Graphics, very smooth not pixelated like alot of VR titles are
Original
MULTIPLAYER

Cons:
Teleport Movement style can sometimes make it difficult to maneuver around the map
Some bugs
Needs more unique enemies

author: {'steamid': '76561197962623146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1632840603}
review:
Of the the first batch of VR games I tried, this one rocked most! Awesome game, with lots of action. Not quite as intense as Aeon, but you still get a good workout. Storyline and setting is fun too. Tried the multiplayer a bit, but there weren't many players at the time and I didn't go back. Definitely highly recommended. And I didn't even try the sword ninja yet!
Oh, what the devs could have done better is show in-game that the last level cannot be unlocked yet! I played the second-to-last level 5 times before I gave up on unlocking the last one (and found a day later that it is still in development, grrr)

author: {'steamid': '76561198410582348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1544243920}
review:
This review is about the single player aspects only. Multiplayer is available in co-op and PvP.
Raw Data is an exceptional game, even in its current Early Access state. The level design is well thought out and implemented. The graphics are jaw droppingly beautiful. The enemy robots are challenging and varied and the weapons /  abilities of the 4 character types are fun to learn and advance with neat upgrades as you progress through the levels.

Level design was definitely thoroughly thought out and lovingly designed with beautiful graphics and detail. Instead of standing in a single location, you can move around to confront the hordes of robotic aggressors, taking the battle to them. You have a "base" of operations which is where you enter into the level. There is a console from which you need to extract data and while this data extraction is taking place, the robots are deployed in an attempt to stop you. From this base, you can zip around the level using teleportation or use the walk mode. There are generally ramps and platforms which lead from your base to the entry areas where robots start their march to stop you by attacking your base (and you). With Room Scale play, you will be ducking behind containers and consoles in order to avoid being hit by blaster fire, popping back up to return fire on the robots (some of whom also use this tactic against you).

Enemy robots come in a wide variety, each with unique abilities. These range from basic dumb drones to ones which are much more capable and are used like a boss /mini-boss on the levels. Don't just focus on the robots walking and running (and sometimes crawling) towards you though as there are flying drones who add to the frenzy, raining shots down upon you and your base from above. The enemy can even upgrade from basic robots to big, hard hitting ones on at least one of the levels which added a great twist to the strategy of how to deal with them. 

To deal with these robotic killing machines, you can choose from one of 4 different character types, each with a different weapon of choice and abilities unique to that character and weapon. The weapons start out with basic abilities but as your character defeats levels, the abilities for those weapons improve. For example, the handgun starts out with the requirement to reload by grabbing a fresh clip from your hip using your off-hand but then progresses to just lowering the gun down to reload and on to dual wielding.. The varied weapons and upgrades assures some great replay value as each weapon type has its own strengths and weaknesses to master.

In addition to the primary weapons at your disposal, you get to place turrets and other helpful additions to the level. These need to be protected as the robots will attack them. You can repair the emplacements if they take damage. These tend to offer limited help as the focus remains upon the player to defeat the advancing robots and to defend the base of operations (and now your turrets). They do offer a little extra breathing room by engaging / slowing enemies while you may be focused on other attackers. Don't rely on these emplacements to handle anything on their own or you may find that your defenses are suddenly gone on your left flank!

There are few downsides to the game, which should get addressed as development continues. None of them are show stoppers by any means..

1) Swapping weapons to off hand happens too easily in a fight. This I am sure is a frustration which every player of the game has encountered when first starting out. It is far less of a problem now for me but it's a game mechanic which should be addressed by the developers. As it is now, this is a frustrating rite of passage of sorts for new players to learn to avoid doing.
2) Menu systems in game need work. The means of enabling special abilities is a little odd and needs to be refined. As it is, I rarely use these special abilities due to the clumsy activation method. Turret menu system can take some getting used to and can be improved. The menu also gets blocked often by other pop-up prompts hovering on your hand, trying to get your attention (such as the prompt telling you to grab a handle to continue to the next phase of a level).
3) Training flow needs improvements. It's not always clear what needs to be done to progress the training. Again, this is really for new players as experienced player figure out what needs to be done to move the game forward. There are odd glitches at times with training which frustrates new players.
4) AI still needs some refinement as some of the robots seem to get stuck trying to seek out cover. When they do find some protective cover, they sometimes make obviously confused decisions on how to attack. Currently, the AI looks to be in a rudimentary initial stage.

Overall, this is an amazing MUST HAVE game and it's still in Early Access! Improvements and features are being added regularly. This is a game which will set the standard for VR wave type games. Throughout the day, I am constantly looking forward to getting back into the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045283341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1993, 'last_played': 1667888757}
review: I have had Raw Data for a year.  When it came out it was still in beta.  As they added on it became clear that it was a really good game.  The playability is excellent.  Not too hard, not too easy.  It has become my go-to game.  If I want some VR fun now it is Raw Data.  The individual or two player campaigns are a lot of fun, and the PvP is a lot of fun (even though I am meat)!  It has a good mix of a simple story.  I highly recommend Raw Data to anyone who is new to VR or already been in a while.  I can't wait to see what they do in the future.  Totally worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002571680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1647055287}
review:
REVIEWED ON: Oculus Rift
This game is exceptional. It's not without it's flaws, but overall this a strong contender for best VR title currently available. 

PRESENTATION -
Though thematically similar to Robo Recall, this title is far more interesting both in it's style and its presentation. The art direction is second to none, with some of the most clever and interesting concepts on display in the VR category. Taking strong cues from Ghost in the Shell, Metal Gear Solid, Syndicate, The Matrix, Equilibrium and Blade Runner; the art department has done an incredible job of building it's own world while providing just the right amount of homage.

UI & FIRST IMPRESSIONS -
The interface is decent, but not fantastic. For some reason we couldn't get into the Steam Home menu from the game, only Oculus home. The menu's are a bit buggy. For instance, my microphone remained muted after we turned off the "Mute Outgoing Voice" feature in the menus. We had to toggle it a few times, but eventually it kicked back over. With that said: it had an option to mute outgoing voice, which is actually a great quality-of-life addition to the game. Pulling people into matches is also equally problematic. With some people not seeing invitations or finding it challenging to join the game. However 4 out of 5 times things worked perfectly, and we had a generally painless experience getting everything to work.

GRAPHICS -
Really second-to-none for VR games right now. The graphic style, character design, weapon design, animations; while not game-changing, are as good as it gets in VR right now. Everything is heavily borrowed from other works as mentioned above, but as with all creative endeavors the measure of quality is how those things are mixed together. Nothing is new, really, so it's a matter of whether a team can take previous concepts and add their own spin.

Raw Data leans on Asian Techno-Punk themes but includes some cool atomic-age references and some stuff that's also pretty out there. In the later half of the game there's a stand out level involving a trip to a psychodelic batanical garden that is exceptional. Tripping face on fauna pollen as the hexagonal panels imitating the sky flicker in and out above you; all while you blast away at robots that may or may not be real, is an extraordinary experience and is easily the games strongest moment.

There are however some reused environments that get kind of samey. The graphics are for the most part top shelf, but there is a bit of a creative inconsistency that adds some surprise to the game but also keeps it from being AAA good.

SOUND -
Good, but not great. There are flourishes of a auteurs hand: like a cutesy Japanese PA voice slowly glitching between chipper pleasantries, and sinister threats. The skree of de-limbed robots hurling themselves towards you in the dark. And some pretty crisp gun reports when you just mad-dog akimbo blast a horde of robots in an overstimulated panic.

The voice acting is also decent, but not exceptional. The Jarvis AI as a character is pretty on point, being a solid mix of Tony Starks AI buddy and a clueless corporate tour guide. Your in-ear handler is pretty cooky cutter, but delivers her lines well.

With that said, this isn't doom. The music and sound effects mostly serve a purpose. They weren't really designed to be a crucial part of the experience. There are no meticulously crafter effects soundscapes ala Alien Isolation, nor is there too strong of a thematic approach like the campy 80s tech swells of Robo Recall. It's all very good, but only good enough so as not to notice, not to feel strongly one way or the other about.

CONTROLS -
A mixed bag of awesome and irritating. Things generally work well, but there are some things that elicited several WTF's. Almost all of the issues are borne out of the limitations of the controllers combined with some poorly defined spacial areas. For instance, the pistol character doesn't get his second pistol till a few levels in. Before that you have to manually pull a magazine from your belt loop. The problem is the location of said magazine is on your hip, but it doesn't quite align to where your looking, nor does it quite align to where your actual body is. So sometimes you look down and the magazine is right there, and sometimes you look down and it's rotated 90 degrees away from your hand. This can break the flow of a fun fire fight.

Also, a friend had several instances where he threw his ninja sword and that shit basically just went out for cigarettes and never came back. Weapons when dropped usually warp back to a players hand, but in this case it just... forgot, we guess. Our friend basically just spent the rest of the match sadly checking for his sword over his shoulder, only to sadly find it missing and just punching robots with his little lady ninja arms. 

Shotgun controls are finnicky. But they usually are in VR. Triggering special abilities is for the most part painless, with a few exceptions. Not sure if this is everyones experience but anything that required triggering a special by putting your hands close to your head, just never works reliably. Two characters specifically require putting hands near your head to charge up, but for some reason it just wouldn't work sometimes, or trigger at random times, or kind of glitch on and off. 

The traversal mechanic is good. Warping is in no way disorienting, and the walking mechanic is fine. Nothing new, but well executed. 

WRITING & STORY -
Generic, with both some cliche but also funny moments. A good example of some interesting ideas, that needed more polish. The world is pretty fully realized, but the characters are neither annoying near endearing. They're just kind of there. And things are usually so hectic you basically ignore them anyway. There are some rougher moments though. The levels with the the bog-standard megalomaniacal CEO bloviating over a loud speaker while hordes of robots come at you, are so bad as to be irritating. We've been there, we've done that. Ten billion times.

If video game writers were to be believed, every asshole above middle-management in an evil corporation, is just waiting with his finger on the fucking loudspeaker button just waiting for some would-be hero to break in. Do these guys have this prepared? Like in the shower in the shower every morning going over talking points hoping that todays the day?

"You will fail in your quest terrorist! Should I go with quest? No lets go with mission. Ill say mission. More contemporary."

As mentioned above there is one mission where you travel to a psychedelic corporate retreat that was so clever it almost seemed like it came from another game. The dialogue writing in this section is so head-and-shoulders above the rest, it's almost jarring; but is an entirely welcome change of pace.

LEVEL DESIGN AND PACING -
It's a wave shooting. And realistically, even though there are ten maps, there are five maps. Putting a fog effect on a previous map, is not a new map guys. That's just lazy. It was okay the first time it happens, but when it happens four more times it gets to be a bit incensing. 

With that said, its still way more content then any other VR shooter, so if it's the best of the bunch what is there to complain about? Still better than whatever-the-fuck happened with Robo-Recall and their one-map that they somehow think is three that they then make you replay over and over like they think you won't notice. 

We get it, Epic, you like de-limbing people. You have a sadism fetish. It's okay, just get a FetLife account like the rest of us.

FINAL THOUGHTS -
Even for all it's flaws, the game amalgamates to being greater than the sum of it's parts. We've played this VR game more than any other, and for now it's the app to beat. It's both familiar and new, and more than anything the action, which is what we spoke about the least, is really the main feature here. It's a fun, frantic and violent escapist experience. 

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198031201473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1507323279}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018482347', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1646774696}
review:
Raw Data is one of those essential must have VR games. It makes you realise how much fun you can have in a FPS VR title. You will be facing hoards of robots that want to kill you, you're mission is to take the Data from their core. There is serval maps to choose from and all have slightly diffrenet objectives while facing these hoards of robots. So far there is 4 diffrenet classes to choose, Duel weeled pistols, Sword master, Shotgun, and a archer who shoots arrows from his bow which feels very badass. This is the type of game where I can just take out all my fustration, it does a great job on immersing you into this futuristic setting where robots are normal to see around. 

Has been one of the best co-op experinces I've had in VR, you can see this game has been built up for mutiplayer from the start. Nothing is better than showing off you're badass moves tearing up robots infront of you're mates. PvP is really addictive, fast pacing 4v4 action. I really hope they add a competitive mode for PvP as it would keep me coming back daily. Leaderboards for PvP would also be great, I'm sure we'll see this in future updates. 

You must have this for you're VR headset as it is some of the most fun you can have in virtual reality right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284569293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1581901944}
review:
Update: I can no longer recommend until they add support for the Index controllers, and I've read that they will not be doing that, or any other work on this title. 

If you have room scale VR, this game is a must have, and well worth the $44. It needs some tweaks here and there but it's fun as hell to play once you get the hang of it. So far I'm even loving the PvP, and that's not always my thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193177038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1509761056}
review: This is an awesome game to put your HTC Vive to use. The mechanics and controls of the game are so easy to understand. Grab the gun from the hip, grab the clip from the other side, insert into the gun, boom you just reloaded. Reach over and grab the sword from your back, boom now youre wielding a sword. Crouch behind objects for cover, ball up your fist and punch, and block. This game I give a 10 out of 10. Check it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198369781416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 18279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14553, 'last_played': 1690473242}
review: I am absolutely blown away by this game and love every minute of it and being able to play with someone else adds so much to it too i have played with people from all over the world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016152495', 'num_games_owned': 1661, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1566119405}
review:
I would absolutely recommend this game for just about anyone.
Just not as a first purchase if you have to decide between this and every other game for the VIVE
Don't mind my hours... Idk wtf happened but I think it's missing about 10 hours of playtime. (I haven't used the bow yet)
Great Gameplay in general but it can get a little repetitive. It is the same through most of the game. beat 5 levels, hear some story about stuff happening. PROTECT THAT FUCKING CORE!!! 7/10
Teleporting instead of walking. Good for people new to VR or have bad motion sickness. I like that teleporting can run out of charge so you sometimes have to be smart about where you are going. 7/10
[b]Weapons[/b] are good overall getting an average of 6.5/10 but if you only care about the pistols it has some of the best gunplay in VR
[list] Pistols are amazing to use 9/10
    [*]Irons sights super good
    [*]You get to have a lot of those action movie moments
[/list]
[list]The sword is really fun to use 7/10
    [*]Throwing can be hard but good once used to it
    [*]In general good weapon
[/list]
[list]The shotgun is the worst weapon in the game in my opinion 3/10
    [*]Feels awkward to use
    [*]Makes the game feel a lot slower
    [*]Simply quite boring to use
[/list]
[b]Graphics[/b] are really nice for vr 8/10
[b]Levels[/b] have a nice amount of variation. Still easy to find your way around but there is some cool shit that happens not to spoil anything 7/10
[b]Story[/b] I mean it has one and for VR that is good enough haha 5/10 (I'm sure there is lots of detail if you look into it but I couldn't be bothered)
[b]Progression[/b] Lacking. There is progression but it's simply "Here's a unlock token get the next ability" I would prefer something like start with one pistol and get the choice to use the token to get a varient of the weapon, upgrades, abilities maybe attachments. But I mean for VR progression is rare and at best this is all it is. I'm glad it's there, just saying it could be better. 7.5/10
I got nothing else so here have a shortened version
TLDR
Gameplay 7/10
Teleporting instead of walking 7/10
[list][b]Weapons[/b]6.5/10
    [*]Pistols 9/10 
    [*]Sword 7/10
    [*]Shotgun 3/10
[/list]
[b]Graphics[/b] 8/10
[b]Levels[/b] 7/10
[b]Story[/b] 5/10
[b]Progression[/b] 7.5/10\

author: {'steamid': '76561198146374547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1562761253}
review: Raw Data proved to be a very good game. At first, I thought that it was too expensive, but when I bought it I understood that it is nothing like other VR games. It's worth its money. It has many campaign levels, Oline PVP and Co-op, and a wide selection of characters with many abilities which you unlock as you play the game. It is honestly the best VR game I have ever played

author: {'steamid': '76561197987289348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1010, 'last_played': 1655863622}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966115739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1507406185}
review:
Big Positive: The game shows you where the center of your play area is at all times, this helps you make the most of the space you have (and its great if you have a RL cooling fan aimed at the center).  Since the setting contains alot of neon style holographic stuff, the center of play space indicator does not feel out of place.  Its hard to describe what a big deal this is in practice and I can only hope that other games start adapting it (even as an option).  

I glossed over this game for a while since the idea of shooting down waves of sterile looking robots didnt appeal to me all that much.

Turns out that my impression was wrong.

Thanks to a good backstory the robots have a sinister implication that fits the mood and ambiance of the game perfectly.

Multiplayer has been amazing fun as well, running around with guns blazing akimbo style against real opponents is a blast.

The game is a wave based shooter, but you have alot of freedom of movement to play with so quite often you will find yousrelf running around.  The different characters and the different abilities you have also translate to alot of fun.

I think this is one of the best VR offerings around today and I have been giving alot of titles a try recently.

author: {'steamid': '76561198350106311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1501048345}

author: {'steamid': '76561197963141848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2401, 'last_played': 1643045281}
review: I've had this title since it was released and always have thought that it was one of the best exerpiences available...This has been one of the better EA experiences as well with a lot of updates... the game has come a long way.  I could have said that 6 months ago....Then the devs went and added online pvp with 3 maps and another hero.  So that's now 10 levels for single player and online co-op along with 3 maps for pvp and 4 fleshed out and very well done heroes.   I'm over 35 hours in and have yet to even unlock all the maps...some of the best replay value available. And some of the best multiplayer in vr on the market as well.  Easily worth every dollar, get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117146064', 'num_games_owned': 844, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1595474428}
review: A scary and fun vr wave shooter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077253135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1345, 'last_played': 1559434807}
review: In my opinion the best roomscale VR game on the market. The last update turned it from good to great with Multiplayer and Touchpad movement. It is very replayable with 4 charactor/weapons to choose from. The begging levels are kinda meh but later levels are huge with plenty of space to move around. It operates similarly to tower defense but very intense. Graphics are among the best in VR. Looking forward to the finished product which will definitely be considered a full AAA game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031755820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1567334980}
review: I liked this game alot way back when it first came out.. but then didnt play it for a while but did notice there had been a few updates since..  and HOLY SHEET this game has rocketed to the top 3 Vive games for me.  Polish, characters, content that keeps coming, and optimisation.  Absolute gem!  Love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013838194', 'num_games_owned': 821, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1503634943}
review: --  8 games and 1 week into owning my HTC Vive and this is my favorite VR game.  The graphics are amazing-- none of that cartoony look-- but instead some of the great Unreal Engine 4 lighting and realism.  For a futuristic shooter, this has elements that are scarier than any horror game I've played in VR.  Shooting down drones is insanely fun.  Buy it now.  Play it now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064975291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1533858381}
review:
At first i wasn't going to buy this because it is one of the more expensive VR games out there. I got this on sale for $32 USD and let me tell you i feel like even that was a steal. This game is awesome.

Do you want to feel like a badass with dual pistols and setting up towers with other VR people, get this game. 

Do you want to feel like a jedi who can throw their lightsaber and use the force to guide it throw the air like a badass, get this game. (closest thing to a light saber without being sued)

Do you want to pump a shotgun fucking endlessly while zombie robots are on you like some sort of face hugger out of a god damn alien movie, get this game.

Do you not have this game? Get this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005517559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1643405399}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001868742', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1504891297}
review:
I like the game mechnics, combat, Physics, Graphics and everything in Player vs Environment mode of the game. I was excited about the pvp mode. But after playing it for few times I am not enjoying it at all.
The new Archer class is really  very hard to use in fast paced  pvp gameplay which makes the class no pick for all matches. Only new player takes it who doesn‚Äôt know it yet.  I wish the pvp mode was slow paced. This fast paced locomotion and shooting gameplay does not suit for PVP VR. It would be way more fun if the pvp was  slow paced  and tactical teamplay.
I would rate the game 7/10 just cause of PVP. 

I would not recooment the game for PVP !

author: {'steamid': '76561198040051575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 895, 'last_played': 1501261538}
review:
Good lord I love this game. From playing with different people in the campaigns, to trying to solo the story content with all four characters, this game is tons of fun.

Pros: 
     [b]Character Variety[/b]
          Each character feels completely different from eachother, and each has unique elements to it's gameplay. 
     [b]Level Design[/b]
          With the exception of the first two levels, each map feels totally different and unique - different places to hide, different enemy spawns, and tey're all pretty gorgeous. 
     [b]Gameplay[/b]
          Man... I almost jumped out of my skin the first time I saw a crawler coming at me. I was playing the dual weilding pistol gun-fu master Cleric and reflexively put my guns up and started pulling the triggers until both clips were empty. Sniping enemies with the new Rogue Hunter is tons of fun, blowing things in half with The Boss' shotgun, or slicing robots with Saija's katana... It all feels good. This is a wave shooter, but you have to move around all the levels (and some are quite large) in order to actually defend anything.

Cons:
     [b]Enemy Variety[/b]
          I don't feel like there are too many different kind of enemies, and some just look to similar to one another (like the walkers/runners and pew pew shooty guys/bzztbzzt laser guys), but this is kind of a minor complaint.
     [b]Matchmaking[/b] 
          The matchmaking in this game feels rather weak, and several times my mic just wouldn't work with the other person, so we played in silence. Other times I would join to be disconnected. I still haven't been able to play PvP at all, because whenever I try there is "An Error occured while trying to join the matchmaking lobby"

Is this worth the money? Absolutely. Bugs are being ironed out, the jaggies are gone, and it's a hell of an experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978829443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1248, 'last_played': 1531789812}
review:
The last time I tried Raw Data was just after the big update where they added voiceover content to the missions.

Coming back to it now, it's hard to put my finger on why it feels so different -- generally speaking, apart from a few significant fixes (like the charge robots disappearing instead of dying), it's really just the hero abilities that have been significantly reworked.

Long story short: I can't pinpoint why it's so much more fun, but I was having a great time playing solo and coop last night.

It's now my favorite wave shooter, and one of my favorite VR gaming experiences. Polish matters, and somehow it's just that final polish that was the missing element.

I don't like saying "must-have", but if you enjoy VR gaming, you're doing yourself a disservice not to pick up Raw Data.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969833533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1508614364}

author: {'steamid': '76561198329163766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1500177279}
review:
This is a must...I say a must if you own a VR headset...very polished coop game you can play with your friends...
Developers keep updating the game...and it gets better and better..
As of this review, 4 characters all with different capapbilities..but I like Saija the best..due to special telekinesis abilities...
Its almost like a cheat where you can throw your enemies around with just a click of a trigger...and freeze the giant while your coop buddy finish it off...all in all a very entertaining VR title....with great replay value..

author: {'steamid': '76561198064888417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 957, 'last_played': 1688361540}
review:
New Rogue update takes an already fantastic game and continues to impress. Now supports fluid movement instead of strictly teleport movement with the thumbsticks. Many VR titles can't get archery right, this game gets it perfectly. 

Definitely my favorite VR title so far, keep it up Survios!

review:
This game is amazing.  It's been my favorite game since I got my vive 3 months ago.  All of the characters are a blast to play as and they all have a variety of abilities.  There are a lot of levels as well as co op, and NOW PvP.  The developers of this game are amazing.

Here's a video of the new character:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v6KwnQ9YgNI

author: {'steamid': '76561197965466357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1567770032}
review:
If you're tossing up between getting this, or Sairento.... get this. 

It offers a mix of player types - a shotgun weilding guy, a pistol person, or a ninja type.

It's intense, fun, and varied.

author: {'steamid': '76561198243446654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1547497982}
review: Very well crafted.  Very, very intense gameplay.  Ran out of bullets and started frantically punching everthing.  Crawling zombie bots jumping out of nowhere.  Added challenge of reloading your weapons amid encroaching threats.  Get it. Community seems active and devs are actively updating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393010793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1521075235}
review: first game i bought for my htc vive it runs very smoothly with very minor problems the only one i can think of personally is that when the enemies hit you they dont always damage you i mean this is good if yo want to beat a level and have and advantage but for people who are playing vr for the realism it takes away a bit of the immersion. i tried the multplayer beta and from what ive experienced its a great idea. It was also an amzing idea to add more characters! it adds a lot of the variety to the game and i hope the archer class makes it to singleplayer after the update is released. Ive had a lot of fun playing this game it keeps you on your toes and is very demanding of your phisical body. Keep up the good work!

author: {'steamid': '76561197967672396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1518669060}
review:
After buying a few games for the vive, i found a few good experiences, but they were short lived. Then i decided to pick up Raw Data and oh my god.

This game is super polished, super fun and is excellent for multiplayer.

Once you get a handle on how the game plays you'll immerse yourself completely, doing awesome skill moves all the while wiping out robots with a friend.

would definitely reccomend, super fun 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198017105236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 769, 'last_played': 1585434338}

developer_response:

Sorry for the negative experience you've had with the game.

Just wanted to reach out and see what kind of movement system you'd prefer over the teleshifting. Also, if you have any additional feedback, feel free to use our [url=https://survios.com/rawdata/feedback/] Feedback Form.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198010458971', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1561597933}
review: Is it another wave shooter? Well, yes.... yes it is, but it's a really well done wave shooter with entertaining writing, good voice acting, a pseudo-story, and above all, FANTASTIC gameplay. There are currently 3 characters. There is Christian Bale from equilibrium, a ninja-robot, and a shotgun weilding bralwer. All feel very fun and very distinct, and each of them have 6 unlocks that you get by leveling up whch makes you feel gradually more and more badass. I've played about 10 hours so far and I have not beaten the game yet (though admittedly, I have replayed several areas as the co-op is fantastically fun). I'll probably play about 7-8 more hours to unlock everything for every character until the Dev releases new stuff, which they are currently in the process of doing. I bought this game for $40, and I normally don't do that. I have no regrets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255412644', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 816, 'last_played': 1631740184}
review: In the newly emerging world of VR, this is the game that will set the standard for the genre. the controls feel fluid and natrual. the gameplay and immersion are amazing. and it'll make you feel like a freaking badass!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065441962', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1588362348}
review:
Excellent Waze shooter in VR, multiplayer with different avatars and weapon option works very well.
Much more fun with a few others.  Not tried the PvP yet though.
May be early access but it's incredibly polished

author: {'steamid': '76561198009199822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1586653108}
review: Very enjoyable wave shooter.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979998129', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 854, 'last_played': 1523682150}
review: This game is the first game that really got me to fully buy into the dream of VR. Playing coop with my friend was one of the most fun things I've done in video games. The first day I played this, my trigger finger was sore the next day from the robot genocide. The new PVP mode is one of the best I've played. It's almost like pavlov with special abilities and classes. Can't wait for the PVP release and I'm really interested to see how it fares on PSVR.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963580550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1558233711}
review:
This is one of the best AAA-quality VR games for the HTC Vive.   Here are the pluses and minuses:


PROS:

+ Graphics and Sound  are simply stunning
 + Decent variety of enemy types
+ Hit detection is on point, and enemies react appropriately when shot or sliced with a katana (a rarity in most vr games at the moment)
+ Voice acting is well-done although somewhat annoying at times.  However, you can skip through most of the voice over portions of the game during missions.
+ Easy to pick up and play but very challenging.  They hit you with tons of baddies on the get-go.  On hard mode, online co-op is necessary to survive.


Cons:

- So far, I've only seen tower defense (point defense) missions, and hopefully there are different mission types as I progress.
- Teleport locomotion only (It would be great to have other options for movement)
- Very hardware intensive. My i5-6600k with a 1070 barely runs this smooth.  This game could use better optimization.

Overall, Raw Data is a must-have title for any Vive owner.  I would recommend this plus Pavlov and Superhot VR for fans of shooting games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057130595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1527553263}
review: This is the best VR wave shooter out there. If you are into wave shooters and like a ton of action and moving around, this is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198396306198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1521639249}
review:
When I bought Raw Data it was still selling for ¬£29.99 but I still feel like I have had my monies worth out of this game. Seeing as it was playing this game for the first time that really convinced me that I needed to get my hands on a Vive.

So I guess I have this game to thank as to why I have had so much fun over the past few months. It's an awesomely stylish wave shooter that feels very similar to a mix of I Robot and a film called Equilibrium (if anyone remembers that). It literally makes you feel like a bad ass taking out robot after robot. It's interesting how each different character has a unique weapon dynamic and it's fun playing around with them all to find which best suits your style of play.

It does become slightly repetitive near the end of the missions but the good thing about these types of games is it's always fun to just play for a bit of mindless robot slaughtering action. Although that being said I would love to see a proper single player/co-op campaign be added to Raw Data. Maybe a bit more dynamic with the enemies than just 3/4 slightly different robots.

Arizona Sunshine is a great example of a game that has managed to incorporate both a great campaign and horde mode, would love to see Raw Data go down a similar path. 

7 out of 10
