author: {'steamid': '76561197985041082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1498792876}
review:
Choosing whether to say 'yes' or 'no' to recommend is difficult for me, but at the end I can't. If you're just looking for gunplay and robots, that's cool, but if you dislike zombie-style jump scares, look elsewhere. I got to exactly story mission 2 when the lights went out, and a robot's upper torso jumped at me out of the darkness, attached itself to my face and vomited plasma into my eyes. I had to close my eyes inside the headset and yank the earbuds out of my ear to stop the cyber-screaming before force-quitting the game from my keyboard. I *HATE* jump scares, and I specifically avoid horror games for this reason. Doubly so when I'm in a VR helmet. I doubt I'm ever going to play this game again.

That said, the quality seems really high, and I enjoyed absolutely everything about the game up until that precise moment. But I personally will never play it again with that mission in place as a hard barrier to the rest of the game. I'm probably going to request a refund.
developer_response:
Hey Thaewyn Ravenwing,

Apologies for the negative experience Mission 2 gave you.

As far as missions with jump scares and horror-style environments:
This is the only mission that really falls into this category.

If you can stomach it, we highly encourage you to complete this mission so you can experience some of our later levels. If you enjoyed Mission 1, you should really take a liking to the later missions :) 

Best regards,
Survios_CS

author: {'steamid': '76561198059613773', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1498683828}
review:
bought for 30 bucks (oculus+ touch user here)  i7 3770k@4.6GHz & GTX 1080 
37 minutes in i am not impressed so far. Graphics are ok (meh models but to my eye good textures,  lighting is pretty good) with everything at epic except shadows at medium. Framerate was solid except when loading tutorials where I got complete freezes for 1 sec.

Menues and general control doesn't seem to well polished. For example the postion of the hands seems of and when you hold a shotgun it gets even worse. Grabbing the front to make the pump action is more frustrating than forgiving.
oculus users manually have to enable roomscale. Even though steam detects 3 cams it doesn't cary over automatically.
turning right with a and left with x is a pretty nice addition although weird at first. I would have prefered an implemetation liek in robo recall that makes use of the analog stick you use for teleporting for more than just another lame button.
About the pistols: Why do manufacturers go for a position where the top plate of the rouch controller is level with the horizon to get the gun level with the horizon? the touch controller grip is way more angled than a guns grip and it feels shitty to alway have to angle you wrists o far towards the ground to get it to acctually shoot parallel to you eyes direction. This is just makes it weird and uncomfortable because it wrist overstretches and your hand doesn't feel the same position as it looks in game which is subconciously of-putting and I HATE IT.

I only tried single player so far (until phase 4 of the only mission playable as a new player). I had one texture bug after hitting the wall in the newly opened area when the large robot comes in for the first time (the one shooting rockets in the air) where the wall was sprincled witrh red pixel in a rectangle (not blood-like, like a texture bug!). I liked the sword throwing mechanic though it is impossible for me to accurately hit stuff with it(might be due to the same prboelm that causes the controller pos being of - I will try reseting my camera setup before the next round). The deflecting mechanic was an enjoyable alternative for a melee class to deal with ranged/flying targets. I am not yet sure if pointing your sword in any particular directions makes any difference to the direction you will deflect to though.
Coop and eventually pvp(saw a beta teasered ingame) might be fun but I haven't tried it yet.

So far I do not feel like it is a bad product but that there are som excution errors with the good concepts at hand that could easily be fixed. In short I am not convinced yet that I spent my money wisely.

I will update this as I go and add if I returned it or deciced to keep it.

Whoever finds any typos can keep them.

EDIT: The 2 week period is now over and I never came back to playing it again. I will try though in the future. Not because it was a good game but for my 30 bucks to feel less wasted because that is what it feels like atm :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198020445786', 'num_games_owned': 1090, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1507420082}
review:
9 out of 10

A year on it still remains the best VR shooter, the immersive gunplay is unmatched. Some levels are hard to solo so multiplayer is essential and there's always people hanging around looking to team up. The different characters are well balanced, each has there stengths and weakness which leads to different play style strategies and ultimatley replayability to master and unlock all the skills.

For a title in ea it's very well fleshed out with content and bug free. And the good news there is more goodness to come.

review:
Raw Data est pour moi un des jeux √† avoir dans sa biblioth√®que quand on poss√®de un casque VR. L'immersion est excellente, la rejouabilit√© des niveaux tr√®s bonne, le gameplay jouissif et on peut jouer une ninja jedi avec un katana laser !
Le seul b√©mol que je trouve est la difficult√© √† trouver des gens proche de chez vous (des fran√ßais quoi...). Je suis pas anglophobe, je comprends pas trop mal l'anglais mais c'est plut√¥t que je le parle tr√®s mal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026293167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1697414251}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970702657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1583081279}
review:
Murderous Robots to shoot the arms off of?  Check.
Shoot from behind cover or go Full-Tank? Check.
Reload action that makes you feel like an action hero? Check.
Feeling of smugness after a particularly well-timed headshot or over-the-shoulder drone hit? Oh, YES, check.
Dual-wield pistols? Check and check.
Bounce back shots with sword that just stays on the legal side of being a lightsabre?  Ping!
Genuine terror as a broken robot jumps ONTO YOUR FACE?  Aagh! Gerroffme!

All the above in a VR experience so you're actually DOING it and not not just pushing buttons on a gamepad.
All the above polished like a proper game and not just a VR tech demo.

My friends grinning like loons after they've had a try, and immediately checking their bank accounts to work out how they can afford a Vive?  Priceless.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970637117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1508681317}
review:
Aujourd'hui  est la premi√®re fois que je me rends compte qu'il est encore en acc√®s anticip√©. Un probl√®me avec les derniers pilotes NVidia fait planter le jeu. Jusqu'ici, j'y ai jou√© avec une 970 et les nombreuses options graphiques permettent d'y jouer confortablement (fluidit√© et visibilit√©). Je l'ai relanc√© avec une 1080 TI avec toutes les options au maximum et l√† (si on oublie le bug susmentionn√©) c'est la claque !!
Le graphisme ne fait pas tout et, au niveau gameplay, les diff√©rents personnages et leurs pouvoirs vari√©s ajoutent au plaisir. Attention toutefois avec le sable laser !! Pris dans l'action, vous testerez souvent la solidit√© des contr√¥leurs et de vos mains.
Pour moi, c'est ind√©niablement un tr√®s bon choix pour les amateurs d'action.
Bravo aux designers et aux d√©veloppeurs qui sont tr√®s r√©actifs et proposent r√©guli√®rement des mises √† jour.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978718822', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1523422588}
review:
What's the point of a early access if you can't even play it? This game is great fun, I really wish I could play through a full mission without having the game crash before I can finish it. It's even more frustrating online, once you finally find a game and play with a partner things do get extremly cool, until of course it crashes.

I tried everything, from closing all apps and services to overclocking, underclocking, etc. I shouldn't even have to, I am using a Titan X Pascal and a i7 4970k with 16gb ram. Even then I tried switching from epic graphics settings to high and medium, the game still crashes no matter what I do.

Being that this is a steam game and I am using the oculus rift, it is also very annoying that the game crashes me back to the oculus home screen, where it is impossible to launch this game again, so I have to take the helmet off and turn my screen on to launch the game with my mouse.

A lot of fun and I am sure the fiinal product will be incredible but right now this game will give you grey hairs due to its instability.


EDIT. NVidia's latest drivers are the ones causing problems, I rolled back to 382.05 and the game is running fine so far. Now I can say it is one of the most fun VR games out there.
developer_response:
Hey kuhne,

Apologies for the crashing issues you're experiencing with Raw Data.

There is a known issue with the latest Nvidia drivers (version [b]382.33[/b] & [b]382.53[/b]) that is causing the game to crash for our users. This problem is currently being investigated by Epic and Nvidia. 

Could you try rolling back your video card's drivers to an older version, then see if the crashing persists? [b]Note[/b]: Some users have reported that reverting back to driver [b]382.05[/b] has fixed their issue.

Thank you for your patience!

review:
If this game didn't crash ALL THE TIME.. It would be my favorite shooter.

It's sooo good in what it does well.  The imersion is fantastic and the gun play is insanly fun.

But it just crashes constantly.  I would say that when i fire it up, there is a 50% chance that I won't be able to complete a mission because it will just crash.  Super bummer there...  When it gets fixed (IF it gets fixed) this game will be a force to be reckoned with!

BTW.. you do get 3 different hero choices but imho the katana is difficult to throw accurately and reloading the shotgun is absurdly intrusive.  So I just play with the hand gun, it seems to work better than the others!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960410235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1545404458}
review:
Raw Data is one of the most refined VR experiences currently available. From depth of gameplay to variety, content, graphics and sound, Raw Data is a class act. Heck you even have liquid physics simulation via Nvidia Flex!

I don't think I can say much that hasn't been said, but if you're looking for a really solid and enjoyable VR action game, look no further. Raw Data should be in every VR gamer's library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334540513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1520294299}
review:
Raw Data is an action game that was built from the ground up for VR. The gameplay is epic, with several different weapons to choose from, for use in immersive and strategic missions, and even the option to play both singleplayer, multiplayer and even co-op. You can also play as one of three characters. It is strategic, giving it a lot more depth than a typical VR wave shooter, with the ability to level up and upgrade weapons and unlock special abilities. There are not only FPS gameplay options but also the option of using a katana and fist fighting for variety. The graphics and detailed visual design are amazing, as are the atmospheric sound effects and the voice acting. It is also story rich giving the gameplay more depth and style. There is already an abundance of content and a lot of replay value. Overall a fantastic game so far, and it is in early-access so we can expect even more content! 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yRtROYZ73FA

author: {'steamid': '76561198032222270', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1542125264}
review:
I much prefer robo recall

unfortunately the only thing this game has going for it in comparison is the swordplay

I don't understand why reloading needed an animation instead of just snapping in the cartridge. I don't understand why enemies don't recoil in a more responsive method. I don't understand why there are extra animations that move your hands out of position.

the lack of immersion is frustrating. Please take notes from Robo Recall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000001987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1496308124}
review: All of the good things you're reading in the other reviews are true; i'm writing this to add that it looks great on a 1060 3GB.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968559405', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1538228579}
review:
Amazing game.  One of the best VR experiences I've had.  It's not one of those games with a 1 hour campaign... Very replayable as well.

Supports VRWorks and thus runs very smoothly on my GTX 1070.  Able to run "EPIC" settings.

Raw Data is pretty much a tower defence game (a genre I love) in first person.  The combat is fun and furious.  The waves are scary.  I have to play it on the lowest skill level at the moment.  The game is a challenge and I like that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038994471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1577919430}
review:
I have to say this is one of the most fun VR games I have. The controls seem pretty tight for a VR game and it is really fun. 

Only thing I have issues with is how unfair it can be with certain specs you pick. It does require some help with friends or other nearby players, but as far as I can see the multiplayer part doesn't work very well. Had it crash, sometimes it says mission failed, and other times it says no connection to server. Really sad because they can be even more fun in a PvE and PvP moments. Other than that single player seems to be really fun and is well worth the try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198243655712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1568080373}
review:
Awesome game can't count the amount of times those crawlers have scared the crap out of me.. This is a nicely polished game so far it's going to be good to see what they add with future updates.

If it even mildy interests you I would recommend buying this, It didn't appeal to me too much at first but once I played it and unlocked some upgrades and all you start to see it's not just a simple wave based shooter (Even if it is a wave shooter it's a damn good one!).

BUY IT!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023647995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1526566349}
review:
Great VR game.
Many stages to play and each of them has it own concept.
The laser stage is my favoriest.
Multiplayer play also good.

The ninja is a little hard to play especially aginst drones.
The shotgun need thow hand to grip it but with two controller it was hard to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962691097', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1671265776}

author: {'steamid': '76561197980090491', 'num_games_owned': 620, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1620070171}
review:
I'm on a lower end machine as far as VR goes and I am still able to run this game. Things like this are why VR was made. It is completely immersive and feels like you're actually there.

I particularly love the forearms included and as long as you don't do anything really weird with the controllers, they actually take the position of where your actual forearms would be in real life ad that just adds to the feeling of actually being there.

If you have a Vive or a Rift, I can't overstate how much you need to get this game. It will be considered one of the defining titles of early virtual reality.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038996237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1553937679}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970262395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1538982831}
review:
This game is what I was hoping VR was going to be, while I was slightly dispointed by the small combat areas. Aside from that small complaint though, everything about this games makes me excited to put my Vive back on. Starting as the sword combat character I was instantly in love with warping around and slashing the bots apart, the controls work very intuitivly, though I have no idea why anyone would use 'hold.'
I've finished the game on normal and I can't wait to go back through on hard and nightmare!

This might already be an option, but a toggle to make the menu button a hold to open would be great as I do accidentally hit that alot in two handed sword mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993725267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1573867890}
review: Addictive and amazing!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991437203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1605763301}
review:
This game is amazing. The only weirdness so far is the shotgun (its a bit... odd, considering that your hands don't move once they are "attached" to the gun), but other than that everything about the game feels real.

You can punch things, slice things with a katana, shoot things with a shotgun (or bash them in the face with the gun if you want), shoot things with pistols, and launch grenades at enemies.

Defensively, you can teleport, physically dodge kicks, punches, and projectiles, and deflect incoming fire.

The game really requires a larger room (6ft x 6ft or bigger) to really let loose in the game, but you can manage it with a smaller play area. It is hard not to lose track of where the safety grid is, though, with everything going on and how intense the actual gameplay is.

To top all of this off, the game is a FULL GAME. There is good voice acting, a story, and multiple missions. There is also multiplayer, though I haven't given that a whirl yet.

All in all, the game is superb. It's like blade runner or ghost in the shell, but as a game that you can step into and experience yourself. Definitely one of my favorite VR games so far, and definitely the most polished one of the bunch I've experienced. It's great to see a real game and not just a tech demo (fun as those are).

author: {'steamid': '76561197995451226', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1500140675}
review: PLEEEEEAASSSEE add more then 2 co-op its what this game needs

author: {'steamid': '76561198069208364', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1538267049}
review:
My first [i]real[/i] VR game after The Lab. 

[h1][b]I am mindblown.[/b][/h1]

You can chose between [b]three[/b] character, all of them have a different weapon type.
Melee, Pistol and Shotgun. All handle differently, all holster differently, all shoot differently.
Oh, and you have skills. Depending on your character. And yes, you can switch between them if you feel like it.

I honestly have to take a moment here.
Because as soon as I put on that VR headset, I was in a different world.
It looks so stunning, it feels so real, no stuttering, no lags. 
[i]Another world.[/i]
I am more the melee person and have fought my way through waves & waves of different enemy types, defending data cluster and playing alongside complete strangers.
You may think wave-games get boring easily, but not this one. As soon as a wave is finished, you really feel like you accomplished something.
[i]And yes, Melee really does hit you physically, too. :) [/i]

If you have a VR headset and you are looking for something easy to get into, that is 
1. fun
2. easy to learn
3. playable online and in singleplayer
4. running smoothly
5. absolutely beautiful looking
[i]and[/i] mindblowing
then you should buy this game.

Yet, I have an issue.
It may be not so important for others, but I started noticing it.
The sound. I don't play with a headset, so my TV is my output source, but certain [i]important[/i] things are too silent.
Suddenly enemies ran into generators and I didn't know why?
Took me another few level to figure it out.
Yet, it was an issue for me, deciding if I shall go there or not and what it actually does too?
I still don't know that part.


I was lucky enough to have a friend [spoiler]Razontex[/spoiler] gift it to me. 

[b]9.7/10[/b]

review:

NEEDS REPLAYABILITY GAME PLAY

author: {'steamid': '76561197960788581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1603669875}
review:
AMAZING! OUTSTANDING! BAD A$$ GAME!  

It is excellent in Multiplayer as well.  Nothing like teaming up with a buddy.

Pros:  
Awesome graphics, excellent interactions and controls, best interface in a VR game I have seen yet, lots o variety of levels and weapons.

Cons: Kicks your computer's a$$ as it is really hard on the hardware.  Make sure you have a VERY stout system to avoid laggy gameplay and crashes.  
Needs more in depth story and levels, but not really a con as this is the way the game is made.  

Good job to the devs and keep up the good work!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977593651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1544409396}
review:
ok, so you got VR, a lot of the games you look at are either escape the room, labor simulator, or rick and morty.

what else is there?

this. it is a wave shooter, but its far from a stand in place let the enemy come to you, no you'll be moving around the map in later stages quite often. 3 characters to choose from, different styles for each, Cleric a pistol weilding maniac, you got your katana wielding melee character, and it wouldnt be a game without a shotgun with a grenade launcher attachment.

gameplay is straightforward, play through each wave of the stage till the mission is over guarding a central node the enemy will be going after, aside from you. each stage however, has its own range of elements.

since you cant be everywhere at once there are various turrets one can build during and between waves to cover a path for you or to simply watch the data node your defending.

probably the only thing i disliked was the price, but after having played it and enjoyed it for 2 straight hours, i can say its got replay value in that 40$.

oh also, co-op. yeah guess thats a big feature too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972218991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1565458982}
review:
Love it! I experienced Robo Recall on a friends Oculus and fell in love. Went and got a vive, my first paid game was Raw Data and I have NO regrets. This IMO blows Robo Recall out of the water for gameplay.

For an Early Access game, the polish is quite good. The gameplay is fast paced and gets even better as you advance through the missions.

The Co-Op is a lot of fun too, especially if you are having a hard time soloing a mission. Always someone online that will join you :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198029161317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1565373634}
review: Raw data is a pretty good game with awesome mechanics and gameplay but lacks off when it comes up to equipment and progression. The only thing is, well a few skills on 3 characters and that's all progression you can count on. No new weapons, no new equipment. As far as I got there is like about 10 different levels and that's all (but they done really nice). But I don't really see any good replayability in this game after you finish all the missions.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961448571', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1539726664}
review:
It's not a tech demo. It's not a proof of concept. It's a real game! A real game made for VR, with a storyline and killer robots and shotguns and grenades and swords. If you have a Vive, you need to get this.

NB. Stop your whining, "ooh it costs ¬£30". You spent ¬£700 on a Vive and all you've managed to do is fanny around in Portal VR:Stories for an hour and div around in "The Lab". Other than that it's sat on a shelf. And that's what I'd say if I went back in tim and spoke to my past, younger, stupider self.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119322387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1085, 'last_played': 1584280982}
review:
The quintessential VR game of Steam, this game is Robo Recall for Steam. Unfortunately, I'm an Oculus user and getting Robo Recall for free beats Raw Data, hands down. However, lets be fair and rate this game comparitive to Steam Games.

I understand some users like myself still ache for a triple A game but till that day comes, this game is the closest you will get. Also note that this game was the reason I bought VR. Below are the Pros and Cons.

Pros:
- Myriad of differrent abilities that allows you to test the VR feedback mechanism of your room setup
- Fine tuned graphics with adept ighting for gorgeous backdrops as well as close lit setting
- Exceellent response to actions allowing fast paced combat
- Generous character development with light grinding
- Unrivalled Multiplayer comparitive to current VR games
- Continuous updates with excellent dev market strategies to keep the game flowing with new users
- Pristine community still fresh of the boat with good co op dynamics allowing for better community make up (Never had a toxic player ever)
- Construction mechanics for assistance
- Deathcam is hilarous

Cons:
- Static maps per game session (This ultimately gives Raw data that test demo feeling and not triple A material)
- Hard on resources (Whether a 2 sensor setup or low GPU standard, you will encounter bugs that will break immersion)
- Only 2 players allowed ( I truly wish there would be a 3 or even 4 group make up per game session with this much multiplayer finish)
- Repetitive waves when you played long enough, it would have been better if I could travel to a different area and solve puzzles as a team or solo (Only 1 map allows this so far and that too only 1 puzzle)
- Limited Objectives variability (Mostly defending certain hotspots, but does have instadeath laser dodging and 1 puzzle) They could expand further on this like picking up  quest items for puzzles, grabbing dead units for cube healing, hyper mode where you get 2nd life if you've killed high number of units before death
- No life or gear character upgrades that would give variability within a round or throughout the game (Stealing robot components for armor, hacking for homing projectiles or assistance, shield mechanics, cube sustainability, etc)

Its still EA thus the cons I mentioned really just need time to be developed. For the price tag, I've paid higher for simpler mechanics but we have to keep in mind VR is in prestige mode at the moment, like buying the latest phone, car or gadget that will lose value over time. This applies generally to all VR games, not just Raw Data

author: {'steamid': '76561198032083871', 'num_games_owned': 377, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1705852566}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042238818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 719, 'last_played': 1507945477}
review: If you've got a Vive, this is definitely worth playing. Literally ducking behind cover, trading fire with enemies using dual pistols you actually feel like you're holding.. it's amazing. The sword wielding character is also a LOT of fun. You can actually go full Jedi and use telekinesis (though I don't really care for the current controls) and even reflect shots fired at you with your energy sword. The shotgun guy.. not so much fun. It was kinda cool using two hands to hold the weapon, but he just feels so much slower to kill things than the others. Wish there was an assault rifle guy instead.. but it's EA, so who knows.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966519608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1503261255}
review: This game is another wave shooter. It's great. Graphically and with regards to the game mechanics, all good stuff. The multiplayer leaves something to be desired but VR is a small player base. There's no real story- I mean, it's a wave shooter and there are different levels, but who cares. 3 characters with different guns/moves at the moment and enough variety to keep things spicy. Replayability is high and visually impressive, so I recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985736502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1507486222}
review:
Raw Data is, without any doubt, one of the best VR games out there right now. Don't let you fool by the wave shooter label. Yes, ist is some kind of wave shooter, but not the one, that let's you just stand in one position and shoot enemy waves. In fact, this game has more to do with the horde mode you get in a game like Gears Of War. So you have a level to jump arround (smooth locomotion is not supported) and fight waves of enemies. The game practicaly never keeps you trapped in just one position. 

The better you play, the more credits you earn. With this credits you can buy weapon tourets or shields and other helpfull stuff to place inside the levels. These things will help you to fight the enemy waves. Talking about the enemies: The developers mix this up on this front and you have to fight all kinds of robots and flying drones - some just run at you, some shoot guns, some have a rocket launcher, some are as tall as a house. 

The game is still in early access but allready offers a lot of content. You can play as one of three characters with different weapons and abilities. Every character can learn new skills throughout the game, so you can level up and become stronger. Probably the best thing is, that you can play every mission in coop with one other player, so you can combine the abilities of different characters. There are always players online and many of them are ready to join you in a coop mission.

Unlike many other VR games you get a lot of playtime out of this. There are quite a few levels and some of them take a good amount of time to complete. The replayability is high too and since it is still early access, there might be even more to come.

Graphics are good, so is most of the level design. The game runs very well on my Radeon R9 390 so players with a stronger GPU might probably get even better visuals. 

So if you are new to VR and ask yourself, if this game is worth the money: Yes, abolutely! Just give it a try, no matter if you own an Oculus Rift or an HTC Vive. This is one of the games, that make it worth to own one of these expensive headsets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029220070', 'num_games_owned': 514, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1507965918}

review:

Really cool graphics and design overall. But gameplay itself is boring after a while. Price is way too steep for what you get.

Levels like Nuke Fusion, Cataclysm, etc. are more complex than the earlier missions, so we are just curious if you had a chance to try them out.

Also, if you have any feedback on how to improve the game overall, please submit your ideas through our [url=https://survios.com/rawdata/feedback/] Feedback Form[/url]
If you have the time, we really would appreciate it :)

Best regards,
Survios_CS

author: {'steamid': '76561197970969536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1496342527}
review:
I was starting to get discouraged about the lack of proper games for the Vive, seeing as most games are concept demos. 
Having owned the Vive for a year I was still considering the Space Pirate Trainer to be the only real quality game to own. And thats a simple game.

Well, that era is over. This game is so cool, blew all my expectations away. It got great action on par with Space Pirate Trainer but with more variety, character progression and gameplay depth and just the right amount of movement. It also has a really nice scifi setting and a story that makes you feel you are inside a PKD novel :)

Its Early Access, but the level of polish and detail is really top notch still.

Of you own a Vive, this is the game to get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025525920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1491686190}

developer_response:
Hey Mick,

Apologies for the poor performance you've endured.

Our next major update will be big performance-wise, so hopefully you'll experience better gameplay when it gets released.

In the meantime, have you tried lowering your Resolution Multiplier settings under the in-game graphics options? Also, if you haven't done so already, try setting Shadows to low.

Thank you for your patience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043268694', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1026, 'last_played': 1507581993}
review:
This game is easily described as an tower defense VR shooter.  Early on you get to choose between 3 characters each with different weapons, the first mission is simple, nothing to defend except to stay alive.  Allows you to learn the basics after the brief tutorial.  Then they add a defense objective to keep alive and then they add basic turrets.  

The VR is done great, you have your basic room scale movement to crouch behind cover, to dodge bullets or small movements to get better angles.  Then you can teleport around to get to various areas of the battlefield, to lay turrets and such.  Teleporting can either be wherever you want or long distances by the way of beacons.  There is enough happening to keep you busy but not enough to completely overwhelm you.  Difficulty settings are great, normal is very well balanced for 1 person.  Also the game has 4 player co-op!

To add on to the VR experience the weapons act about as you would expect a weapon to.  Initially you have to reload the pistol by grabbing ammo from your non dominant side and bring it to the bottom of the gun.  You can hold the melee character's sword two handed style for extra damage and the shotgun is a pump action shotgun that needs to be manually pumped.  All characters also have skills such as a pistol skill that temporarily gives unlimted ammo in automatic firing mode.

My only real con for this game is the price.  39.99 for an early access game is steep but the game is VR and the game seems to have 8 levels with 3 different characters.  The developers are already working on a 4th character with a bow and it does have multiplayer and 4 different difficulty levels though I'm not sure if the last difficulty level requires beating the game or if it isn't implemented.

As of this review I would probably call this my favorite VR game yet!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042358222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1500820961}
review: A nice tower defense wave shooter mix. A lot of fun for sure!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972632347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1492722078}
review:
This game is awful.
It runs great, graphics are pretty, blah blah blah.
The gameplay is revoltingly bad.
Games like this are why VR is failing.
Don't let the videos and other reviews fool you.
There isnt any meaningful story or levels or anything.

You stand in a room and defeat waves of enemies.
Thats it. 
The entire game.
I just saved you 40 bucks.
developer_response:
Hey R3volve,

Sorry to hear you had a negative experience with the game.

Raw Data is still in early access, so there will definitely be more content coming down the road, which will include new levels that are more complex.

Did you get a chance to play any of the later missions, such as Nuke Fusion? 
These levels really incorporate the tower-defense element of the game.

Also, if you have any feedback on how to improve the game overall, please use our [url=https://survios.com/rawdata/feedback/] Feedback Form[/url]

review: A more mobile and varied wave shooter than most with a decent amount of interesting features such as deployables and power ups. author: {'steamid': '76561198017822828', 'num_games_owned': 346, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1546300632}
review:
Definitely my favorite VR game right now. Has amazing visuals, scary immersive soundrack, and good effects. The robot's movements, looks and response to being shot make them feel so realistic that the first time I was literally rolling on the ground, screaming, kicking and pulling that trigger like my life really depended on it. The atmosphere is just thrilling.

I usually really try to get immersed in the VR world, so that my experience would feel as genuine as possible, but this game pulled me in with no effort whatsoever. Definitely worth the price.

Pros:
*Interesting premise. A large robotics industry planning to take over the world with robots that were supposed to serve the humans, and you get to uncover the truth, by being in the first one to confront them- sounds like that movie i-Robot. 
*Very good visuals (high textures, good contrast and lighting)
*Very good animations and effects (robots react to shots, can be dismembered, pleasing headshot splatter effects)
*Great soundtracks. Matches the atmosphere and really builds up the tension and stress, which just adds to the experience.
*Can play in co-op- share the thrill!

Cons:
*Wish there was some limit to how far or how frequently you can teleport, because a lot of the time it feels like too much of an advantage to zap around enemies, never letting them get too close. Makes me feel too safe, knowing I can get away with a push of a button at any time.
*Needs more ways to defend yourself so you don't have to always rely on teleporting to safety (like shields, magnetic grenades that either slow or divert enemy movement, use dead robot bodies as cover by picking up and holding, or smth).
*Needs more weapons, and ability to switch between weapons during a mission, and make each robot type have a weakness against certain weapons, so that switching between weapons is encouraged for efficiency.
*I know this is supposed to be a horde shooter, but it would be nice to have a point to point A--->B type of level design, where you're trying to escape, or maybe infiltrate deeper through series of grab and run objectives that always keep you on your feet and alert.
*More ways to promt the user to move, lean, duck, reach out. If teleporting wasn't such an advantage then maybe one on one fighting mechanics could be made more interesting.

Overall awesome game, loving it. Can't wait to see what changes does the future hold!

author: {'steamid': '76561197985970458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1491769120}
review:
Played as the Cyborg Ninja during the free weekend for a couple of hours. For a "shooter" this has really satisfying sword play. Dashing around slicing robots in half, smashing them into ground with telekinesis, launching into AOE ground slams, reflecting bullets with my blade, felt like a robot Jedi :) I won't be buying this immediately as I recently spent too much on VR games, but this is on my list to get in the future!

Also, Co-op play was very fun. Any game with co-op play automatically gets a few points higher in my mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999600638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1491756649}
review:
I played Raw Data during the free weekend and I didn't find the game to be as good as I was expecting it to be. I encountered multiple glitches and the game crashed as well. The gunplay also wasn't as good as what I have gotten used to in the past couple of months of VR gaming. The environments look great but the animations are not on the same level.

The game certainly has potential but it still has too many rough edges for me to recommend it. If the feel of the weapons gets improved and the bugs get squished, it would probably be a worthy addition to any VR library. In its current state, it just doesn't offer enough to justify the price tag that is on the higher end of prices for VR games.
developer_response:
Hey Veskum,

Thank you for trying out the game over the free weekend.

Apogolies for the crashes you endured. Were you prompted with an unreal crash reporter when the game crashed?

Also, if you have the time, could you elaborate more on the glitches you experienced(were they with specific characters, levels, weapons, etc.)?

Best regards,
Survios_CS

author: {'steamid': '76561197970715975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1494100079}
review:
This game is awesome.  It's almost as good as Robo Recall.  Maybe just not as polished.
The graphics are great, gameplay is fun (especially multiplayer).
I would like to see more impact interaction with the robots though.  Usually, the sword goes right through them without any physical blowback or effects.  It would be cool to be able to cut robots as you slash them.
The movement system is quite disorienting.  You move by pressing the left joystick (Oculus) and turn 90¬∞ by pressing buttons.   I wouldn't say that's very intuitive.
I don't see why we can't both turn and move with one stick just like in Robo Recall.
But enough complaining...  This game was worth the money.
The difficulty is quite hard so it keeps you coming back for more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997801929', 'num_games_owned': 2935, 'num_reviews': 407, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1591481891}
review:
Disclaimer: Playing during the free weekend trial period.

[h1]One of the best wave shooter experiences for the Vive.[/h1]

Raw Data has a slow, seemingly broken intro level (damn hand scanner), but once you make your way into the actual lobby and play some missions, it quickly becomes a lot of fun and stays that way.  The story is pretty much a pattern of extracting data and defending your little, circular area.  It's quite fun, but it's also somewhat repetitive.  A variety of enemy types are thrown into the battle, so if you thought the iconic android character was the only thing you'd be fighting, think again.  There are some bulky, armored types and some flying drones along with some variations of the three.  There may even be more later in the game or in later updates.  I highly recommend this game to Vive users.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020135537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1491669894}
review:
I really liked Raw Data, though due to some crashing issues I wasn't able to delve too deeply. I was able to watch a friend play several Phases on his Vive, so I'm confident in my review.

The game is incredibly well constructed and while linear in concept and repetitive in play, bears all the hallmarks of a AAA title. The voice work seems solid, the graphics are clean and crisp, and the play is focused. Locomotion is handled by teleportation, so no VR sickness here. Most of the time you stand stationary and crouch or turn so the game has focused on one thing and done it well. There are bugs, but as of this review, they seem minor.

The animations of the enemies are beautifully rendered and while the "blood" nee "hydraulic fluid" makes me laugh every time I see it, it manages to keep the title at a PG-13 level. This game is also very physical, so I would steer clear if you're a disabled VR player - a LOT of dodging and two-handed play is required.

All around, this is a great title if you like shooters, swinging a sword, and/or shotguns and grenades. Given my personal crashing issues with a moderate VR computer, I'd say that you want a higher end VR-ready computer on this title.

Definitely worth the price of admission if you have a friend to play with. A little on the pricy side if you don't have someone you know has a copy and is up for covering your back.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970648728', 'num_games_owned': 467, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 840, 'last_played': 1701154616}

author: {'steamid': '76561198034786163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1043, 'last_played': 1495236959}
review: This game is simply AMAZING! All 3 characters are unique and all 3 are great - there is no one best! And the gamplay is second to none when it comes to room scale VR!  I hope they keep adding new mission, possibly new characters and hopefully one day equipment upgrade - but even if none of that happens, I 100% say this is a MUST BUY FOR VR! It is ONE GAME that literally fulfills all my childhood dreams of what VR Games SHOULD BE! Just please don't skimp on your PC! I would say that a 1070 is the ideal minimum, but 980 Ti is even better. Of course GTX 1080 and above are better still. It's not like you can't play this game with a GTX 1060/970 - but you will have to run low quality settings unless you don't mind re-projection anyway, I know because my Bro has a GTX 1060 6 GB i7-6700HK quad core laptop - and it needs minimum. Whereas with my HEAVILY OCed 980 Ti I can run High/Epic settings with a 1.3x/1.4x resolution multiplier.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030374178', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1524982721}
review: In my optinion this is the best VR game out currently.  There are enough gameplay elements (weapons, skills, levels, enemies) to keep it interesting and the game is very nice looking.  I recommend putting the render scale to 1.6 if you can (higher doesn't seem to be noticable) as it will greatly increase immersion.  Gameplay is fun, lots of adrenaline and a good workout.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970582376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1212, 'last_played': 1507316988}
review:
Das Beste Spiel auf der Vive das ich bisher gespielt habe.
Seit ein paar Patches l√§uft es bei mir auch richtig sauber.
Hab eine i7 6700k 16gb ram und ne asus 1070. Ich kann es fl√ºssig auf high mit 1.4x Supersampling spielen.

- Es gibt jetzt schon 3 heros die mitlerweile ziemlich ausgereift sind.
- Viele F√§higkeiten zum freischalten, schwer zu meistern.
-  8  Missionen, sie werden vom Gameplay fordernder und besser je weiter man im Spiel kommt.
- Fortbewegung funktioniert √ºber "Teleshift". Es ist wie ein schneller nach vorne fliegen, durch clever eingesetzte effekte    ist es gut vertr√§glich und f√ºhlt sich deutlich besser an als der klassische teleport. Auch ist man dadurch sch√∂n schnell was dem Spiel eine gute dynamik gibt.
- Es hat eine witzige story die aber fast nur √ºber die Gespr√§che zwischen deinem Operator und der Ki Simon erz√§hlt wird
-Koop gameplay

Mindestens ein Held und eine Mission werden noch dazu gepatcht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198371661222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1591695871}
review:
I like this game. It is the first one I bought after buying my Vive. The graphics are nice, and I have had very few problems with the performance...I was even able to push the graphics setting up a bit even though my specs aren't top of the line. The only problem I have had is the lack of people willing to playing multi-player, and the levels can be brutal without help.

That said, I support the dev team, and I hope this game reaches its full potential. It would also be nice to have more of a campaign mode with a bit of story line to set it apart from the rest. Right now, I'd put it at 8 out of 10.

Also, this is my first steam review. Hope it helps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002604444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1510455345}
review: I purchased the game back in Nov. 2016 and at that time I was running a water cooled gtx 980 ti & i5 6600k. At that time the game was unplayable with lag/stuttering and crashes, so I refunded the game. Fastforward to March, 2017 and I'm running a gtx 1080 and i7 6700k. The game whether by my hardware upgrade or game updates performs wonders better. There is also a fair amount more of content. I have enjoyed my few hours in it so far. Wish I knew how to find or start a dual match. After owning many vive titles I can't help but feel slightly exhausted of the wave based shooter genre though. Wish there was more of a multiplayer or story element to games. With all that being said this game is worth a purchase if on sale (20% off frequently) and you run high end hardware (don't bother with anything less than a 980ti imo). It is by far the best visual HTC Vive title I've played (and I've played most the good ones) so you need hardware to heavy lift. My only complaint would be that I would expect more progress on the early access in the near year it has been out. Needless to say I would recommend it if you want a great vive experience and have the hardware to run it.

review:
Well After 4hrs of gameplay and it being a shinny enemy wave attack game it got boring fast. Never anyone online to play with. Shows the lobby with 30+ people standing around but no matter who u call or msg or invite to game NEVER had anyone accepte and game with. So its been solo play for me as no user base it seems. Only dramatic part of the game is the first Robot you see smashing the glass. After thats it's sadly rinse and repeat boring game play. 

All I can say is a mate gifted it to me and Glad I didn't have to pay for it. 

In short if you get it for free or 75% off do it, otherwise not worth your time and money and be aware. As all the VR devs are circle jerking each other stating how fantastic 'VR' gaming is but currently all the 'popular' games clones of each othe. Boring wave attack after wave attack.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991739868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 938, 'last_played': 1539819405}
review:
Raw Data is my favourite action game in VR so far. I've been following it since release, and await each new content update with bated breath.

What is so good about it? Well, I'm glad you asked!
The reason isn't any single feature, but how it masterfully blends all of its elements:
[list]
    [*]Action-packed, immersive 360¬∞ gameplay with great controls.
    [*]High-end visuals and audio with a high overall production quality (this also applies to the voice acting).
    [*]Full co-op support, which makes everything better, but VR even better[i]er[/i].
    [*]A large amount of content with great replayablility and lots of variety, both in missions and in playable characters.
    [*]Weapons and a wide variety of skills that feel great to use, and also all have a meaningful impact on gameplay.
    [*]Perhaps most importantly, a nicely balanced difficulty progression and multi-faceted possibilities for improving your skill.
[/list]

That last point is something that you might also call gameplay [i]depth[/i], but I wanted to be precise since that term gets thrown around a lot. What I mean by it is that there are many ways to improve how you play the game. You can improve your performance in terms of action gameplay, how well you use your weapons and skills and how quickly you can detect and dispatch enemies. You can improve your strategy: where do you position yourself, when do you use time-limited skills, which enemies do you attack first, who covers which area in coop. Finally, you can also greatly improve your play by increasing your meta-knowledge of the game. Learn the maps, spawn points, the exact behaviour of each enemy type, and mission-specific challenges.

And what is truly crucial here is that all improving in any and all of these is extremely rewarding.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989285779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1490053563}
review:
Originally, my review was mostly about the game crashing.  It looks like asynchronous reprojection causes the game to crash.  That's fixed though, now that I've disabled that feature.  Survios did a good job troubleshooting that issue via email, and they also responded here.

Pros:
This is more developed than a large percentage of games available for VR.
Unlike most wave-survival shooters, you can actually move around.

Cons:
It's a wave-survival shooter, which I personally have seen too much of at this point.
There's something about the combat style I don't like, at least when using the sword.  I'm not even sure what it is, but it feels like the room-scale version of button mashing, if that makes sense.
The tutorials are tedious.
There should be a better explanation for how multiplayer works.
Level 2, "dark source", is the most annoying game level since the "follow the train" level from San Andreas.  That level alone makes me never want to play this game again.

I haven't tried all the characters, or gotten that far into the game.  It's worth trying.  Depending on preferences, some might absolutely love this game.
developer_response:
Hey GreiBush,

Sorry to hear you're experiencing this crashing issue with the game.

Would you mind supplying us with the following information:
[list]
    [*]Are you prompted with the Unreal Engine Crash Reporter when Raw Data crashes on you?
    [*]If so, could you add your SteamID to the crash reporter dialogue, as well as what hero/map you were playing at the time?
    [*]What are the specs of the system you're running the game on?
[/list]
Also, there's currently a known issue where Steam VR's asynchronous reprojection causes Raw Data to freeze/crash on some systems. 
Could you navigate to the Performance tab of your SteamVR settings, then uncheck "Allow asynchronous reprojection" to see if the crashing persists?

Thank you for your patience!

review:
[h1] Amazing Game!!!!! [/h1]

This game makes you feel awesome while holding a sword or two pistols or a shotgun. I prefer the sword :) This game is demanding on a system so you may have to tweek with the settings a little to get it right. Prepare to stink!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198300666321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1488231222}
review:
UPDATE 2017-02-27:
I found the problem to why my game was making me so motion sick. I normally run my games with a super sampling number of 2.0-2.5. This will NOT work with this game. I turned down the sampling to the original number of 1.0 and everything was running smooth like butter. No motion sickness and/or "sphere warping". This is really important to know before playing this game!

Now that i works as it should, I can say that this game is the most immersive VR-game I've ever played! Really good one!

Original post: 
I'm having really big problems with this game. The sorroundings is warping when I move around in the game, making me go motion sick in a few minutes. Someone got the same problem? It seems that the game is "sphere warping/projecting"?

author: {'steamid': '76561198303908840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 856, 'last_played': 1585922264}
review: Raw Data is my favourite game, and for a good reason- it's really awesome. The gameplay is intense, and there aren't any bugs or glitches that i have come across. I keep coming back to this game, and I enjoy it every time. What i would love to see is a survival mode, with waves of easy enemies, and occasionally some difficult enemies.

review:
This is by far the best out of these statoinary wave shooters. With the difference that you can teleport around, so it's not that stationary.

author: {'steamid': '76561198217617232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1606606041}
review: It's an awesome game but it keeps crashing at different places. I haven't gotten through the first level without crashing.  I'm running Nvidia  1080 graphics card.  I've set supersampling below the recommended 1.0 and it still crashes.  Can anyone help me out with this?  I love the game but it crashed the VR app so I have to reboot all the time.   I would recommend the game if the bug can be fixed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114028242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1538805125}
review:
I decided to give this game a shot since it was frequently recommended as one of the best VR games currently. After playing it for some time, I honestly don't understand what everyone thinks was so great about it. 

The Pros: 
1: It looks fantastic. Easily one of the best games graphically speaking.
2: The game is very polished. Smooth gameplay and menu system. 
3: A good challenge, definitely easy to get swarmed. 

The Cons: 
1: Characters: The trailer for this makes it seem like you have access to a variety of weapons (Pistols, sword, etc.), but really you have access to three characters that have a specific weapon they can use. Was fairly disappointing. 

2: Enemies: The enemies were immensely boring. Think of it as the iRobot movie, but the enemies walk at a Star Wars battle droid rate. Sometimes a big one shows up. No unique characteristic, just big. Some do actually shoot at you. Somehow they were all just very....blah. 

3: Weapons Gameplay: The only weapons/character you ever have to use is the Pistol Expert. Using anyone else is fairly pointless. The sword/saber gameplay is terrible. You can stand in one place and gently wave it around like an orchestra composer and do better then if you were actually trying to use it as a sword. Then proceed to stand around waiting until you're surrounded since the enemies only approach in large clumps. 

4: Controls: The shotguns two hand grip controls are very intermittent. You have to "grab" the pump to hold the gun. You also have to "grab" the ammo off of your back to reload it.  There are two different controller schemes. One to click and hold the grip button to grab something, the other to toggle on/off. So you have the choice of potentially dropping your magazine while reloading, or being glued to your shotgun. The game can get very hectic and this setup causes nightmare when you're trying to be quick. 


Despite the cons, it is an excellent looking, well polished game that was definitely well developed. However, after giving it a fairly long chance (~5hrs) it got very boring very fast. It also never actually got engaging. In the first ten minutes I reached my conclusion as to how lame the enemies were. I had heard so many good things about this, and yet I was honestly forcing myself to play it after the first two hours. For $40, it was an overhyped letdown.
developer_response:
Hey VetteofSD,

Sorry to see you had a negative experience with the game.

We do appreciate you being detailed with your feedback.

Saija and Boss will be getting some changes in the new update, so hopefully you'll find them more enjoyable when the update releases.

Also, if you have further feedback on how to improve Raw Data overall, please submit your thoughts through our [url=https://survios.com/rawdata/feedback/] Feedback Form[/url]

We hope to bring you and all of our players a better experience with future updates!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042113113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1509666064}
review:
Pew Pew Pew!!
This is a nicely done wave shooter.
You're not just stuck in one spot while shooting endless waves of the same object.
There's still a lot of glitches to work out "like enemies getting stuck behind doors and walking through structures. The game is loads of fun but I'm not sure about the price tag. 


Pros
Super immersive 
Action packed
Nice grafx
Multi-player capable
Able to move around
upgrades

Cons
Price
repetitive 
still plenty of glitches to work out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198290053856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1672040647}
review:
Ok, so after some time away doing other things, I decided today to follow the dev's instructions about deleting the .ini files and to give this game another try.

I'm glad I did.

So, first off, thanks @Survios_CS for the tip, deleting the .ini files reset whatever it was that had been screwed up, and for following up a few days later with a comment (didn't even see that until just now, sorry).

Raw Data still has a few things that can be improved (it's still ridiculous that you have to agree to the EULA every time you want to play, the tutorials could use some work, and the single-player game doesn't pause when you hit the menu button), but despite that, it's one of the more well-polished games out there.

One of the best points is that the controls are very accurate without making it too easy. The difference between blocking projectiles and getting hit seems realistic, i.e. it's not enough to just face in the right direction, but the projectiles are slow enough to give you a chance to get the katana in the right spot. The ability to teleport short distances gives you a great advantage over the AI bots, but I'm guessing they'll get progressively harder in later missions. The graphics are very nice, with a modern/futuristic look, and just looking down at your virtual hands is pretty impressive. There's a good mix of action and strategy, and so far it hasn't gotten boring despite being yet another wave-survival kind of game.

Happy to change my vote from a thumbs down to a thumbs up, especially since it's an early access game, so I guess bugs are to be expected, and given that it seems to be quite actively developed, I'm sure it'll just continue to get better.
developer_response:
Hey aaamos,

Sorry to see the game is stuck in this awkward state for you.

Could you try deleting your .ini files and see if that helps at all?
Your .ini files should be located at [i]C:\Users\Username\AppData\Local\RawData\Saved\Config\WindowsNoEditor[/i]

Let me know if the issue persists!
Survios_CS

author: {'steamid': '76561198350254288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1510899797}
review:
This is my 2nd rewrite. I have to reverse my feelings about this awesome game once again unfortunately. This game rocks.... but thanks to a defect in the Vive controllers and this games use of the thumb pad for teleporting I have to give it a thumbs down. Playing this game with the Vive will easily break the thumb pad. The small rubber disc under the thumb pad easily shifts out of it's seat and the only way to fix it is to tear down the entire controller..

BEWARE... the "easy" fix is a crapshoot and CAN ruin your controller.
developer_response:
Hey andychn,

Sorry to hear you're experiencing this crashing issue with the game.

When the game crashes on you, are you prompted with the Unreal crash reporter?
If so, could you add the following information to the dialogue box:
[list]
    [*]Your Steam name
    [*]Your system's specs
    [*]what you were doing specifically in game when it crashed?
[/list]
Also, there's currently a known issue where Steam VR's asynchronous reprojection causes Raw Data to freeze/crash on some systems.
Could you navigate to the Performance tab of your SteamVR settings, then uncheck "Allow asynchronous reprojection" and see if that helps at all?

Best regards,
Survios_CS

review: Great game, one of the best VR titles I've played so far. Buy this if you love fast paced gameplay and lots of action. Only problem I experienced was a drone getting stuck behind a wall making it impossible to advance in the game without restarting it. Other than that, I would highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987101256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1526947412}
review:
8/10

This game let me relive all of my childhood dreams of being inside time crisis. The shooting feels good, even if using the shotgun is burdensome. The game is a challenge, and you will find yourself trying a few levels more than once. 

That being said, there isn't a ton of variety. There are 7 maps/levels, each one is really fun. There is limited character variety and you will most likely play the same hero that everyone else plays, pistol dude. 

The game is in early access and as long as the game is continued to be updated I will continue to recommend it. I believe that it is worth the price, and that with the inclusion of more characters the game will be the premier VR wave shooter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031238746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1612052413}

review: After a long debate on if I wanted to take the next step into VR I did, and the first game on my list was Raw Data. I have seen  many different videos on this game and I was very interested. So after a painfully long setup time i got my VR gear setup and I started up Raw Data. The tutorial is a bit slow but the game itself was amazing. The robots are scary as hell especially if they get a bit to close. The gameplay is flawless and I am always entertained by it. Definitely one of the best VR games that are available

author: {'steamid': '76561198355344738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1646379799}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972366872', 'num_games_owned': 504, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1485745566}
review:
I'm a bit torn here. There seems to be a lot of potential here, but it was wasted on me, because of a few glaring issues that I ran into early on.

First, I feel like there was an incredible disconnect between the framing of the Tutorials and the actual gameplay. The tutorials happen in an incredibly safe environment, and give you a very basic understanding of how to fight, and dont really give you any understanding of how the enemies are going to approach you. For example, one robot will stand stationary in a room, and you take a few shots at it. Then, the very first level totally throws you in at the deep end. Robots start spawning all around me, faster that I can take them out, and moving towards me like a hoard of zombies - I was not expecting this game to give me the same kind of anxiety as The Brookhaven Experiment, and I quickly felt overwhelmed. I was not prepared, and it was a really negative experience.

Next, there were a few mechanics that were just plain uncomfortable, and I felt were really bad implementations in VR.

I spent a bit of time in the tutorial area, where all movement was teleportation based, and felt good. Then when selecting a level, the 'loading' transition was an elevator that moved down suddenly - with no warning, it almost made me fall down. 

FInally, it may seem like a small quirk, but probably my biggest problem with the game was an action that one enemy did... There's a type of 'ninja' robot that cloaks, and dashes around to avoid your fire. Several times it dashed up fairly close to me, attacked, then ran away - but at one point it walked up close to me, attacked, and as I was returning fire it dashed THROUGH me, to the other side - Maybe this wont bother everyone, and may seem inconsiquential - but with the level of immersion in VR games, this just mentally hit me like a ton of bricks, and my brain didn't know how to deal with this stimulus - This one tiny action made me feel confused, disoriented, frustrated, and angry.

I think there is a good game here somewhere, but buried under a poorly thought out VR experience. I can't recommend it to anyone who experiences any level of discomfort in VR - I was able to handle more time in Windlands and Brookhaven than Raw Data.
developer_response:
Hey Blaaguuu,

Sorry to see you had a negative experience with the game.

What mechanics specifically did you feel were uncomfortable?

Also, if you have any additional feedback on how to improve [i]Raw Data[/i] overall, please submit your thoughts through our [url=https://survios.com/rawdata/feedback/] Feedback Form. [/url]

We hope to bring you and all of our players a better experience with future updates!

review: Playing with some stranger on the line was amazing. It mostly involved my teammate laughing over his mic while I screamed "Ouch, my body! Help!" as robots clawed at my feet. 10/10 would be mauled by robots again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142850956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1499713549}
review: Incredible, mind-blowing experience. To be able to play this with other players, communicate with them through your own voice and basically feel like you're really there... is simply unreal. author: {'steamid': '76561197971465147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1642147714}
review:
Most VR games are glorified proof of concept / tech demos. This is NOT true for Raw Data. One of the most immersive and engaging VR experiences I have played to date, and there is a LOT of content, as well as some interesting multiplayer potential.

This, alongside Vanishing Realms are must haves for VR. Simply put, if you own a VIVE or a RIFT, buy it.
